loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Джонбасова Фотима проживает в городе ТУрсун-заде. Возраст 34 года , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Уже четыре года занимается торговлей  тканями. Реализует товар  путем хождения из дома в дом по кишлакам. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, что поможет увеличить ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит сможет  в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fotima J. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 34 years old, married, and has four children. She has been selling fabric for four years. She sells her goods door-to-door in villages. She wants to take out a loan to increase sales by improving her selection of goods. She can repay the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en:
D. Sadriddin is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Sadriddin has worked as a barber for many years. He is very talented and maybe that’s why he has so many clients. Also he doesn’t charge much for his services. Now he wants to borrow money so he can buy newer instruments for hair cutting. This way Sadriddin thinks he can offer better service for his clients and in that way, earn more and improve his family's standard of living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing higher tech instruments for barbering

loans.name: Rossette's Group

texts.en:
Rosette O. has a dairy business and is currently branching out into pig farming. 5 years ago, Rosette had 4 local cows, but they were not producing milk that would earn a good profit. So, Rosette sold those cows and bought 2 Heifers. After some time, she took those female cows to be impregnated. She says that in Uganda, you can use in-vitro fertilization or you can just take your female to a place where there are males and leave them for some time.

Now, she has the two original cows, plus three young female ones that are not yet old enough to produce milk. The cows that are producing milk, produce between 5 and 8 liters per day. After she milks them, there is a man who comes and purchases the milk for between 400 – 500 USH per liter. Rosette wants to purchase a male cow so that she will no longer have to pay the fee associated with getting her cows pregnant. She also wants to buy a few more calves, rather than waiting for her cows to give birth again. She will use a portion of her 2 mil UGH loan to do these things.

Recently, Rosette has noticed that there is a large demand for the products of pig farming so she has decided to branch out into that. She started by purchasing two pigs, and one is now pregnant! But, she does not yet have a formal place to keep her pigs. She is planning to use a large portion of her loan to build a pig pen on her farm.

Rosette is a single mother of six children. Her children range from 9 to 18. The father of her children left her years ago, and then recently passed away. Before he passed away, he was helping her to pay school fees for the children, but now that he has passed away it is up to her alone.

She says that as her children age, it is very important to be able to meet their needs. She says that if you are unable to meet their needs, they will go looking for other ways to get what they want. As her first-born is a girl who is now 18, she is particularly worried about meeting her daughter’s needs.

loans.use: To build a place to keep pigs, to buy a bull, and to buy a calf

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.en: K. Marufjon is 52 years old. He is married with 5 children. Marufjon sells dried fruit in the central local market. He has been in this business for 11 years. Dried fruit is very popular in Tajikistan. Any hostess keeps dried fruit on hand to serve when guests visit, and dried fruit is as a rule served at all family occasions, like wedding parties, birthday parties and others. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Marufjon's business is quite successful and brings in stable income for his family. Now Marufjon wants to increase the stock of his goods in order to be able to supply his buyers' demands. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni for a 9-month term. Marufjon would like to thank all for their support and promises to pay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruit like raisins, dried apricots, almonds and pistachios in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Shahzodamo

texts.ru: Холматова Шахзодамо проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 35 лет, Не замужем. Домохозяйка. Занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Опыт в бизнесе уже восемь лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить молодую корову. Она нужна ей для того чтобы получить породистое потомство. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shahzodamo H. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 35 years old, unmarried, and a housewife. She breeds cattle. She has eight years experience in business. She plans to take out a loan to buy a young cow. She needs it to establish a pedigreed bloodline. She can repay the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying young cows

loans.name: Boir

texts.en: Boir is 43 years old and the father of two children. His wife is a housekeeper and supports him in everything he does. He is a hardworking person and has been providing taxi services for more than 3 years. The most important thing to him is that his children go to college later and successfully finish it, so that they will become professionals and have a better future. Boir wishes to keep his taxi business growing, and for this he needs to have his tools in good working order. Boir is requeting this loan because he needs to buy spare parts to improve the tools' condition. Thanks to this work, Boir has been able to stabilize his quality of life. loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi

loans.name: Kholmamad

texts.en: I. Kholmamad has raised cattle and farmed for 11 years. With two children and the responsibility of providing food for his home, has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Today Kholmamad finds himself in need of purchasing calves to raise in order to take greatest advantage of raising and selling them when necessary. For this reason, Kholmamad is requesting loans from IMON International in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family. loans.use: To purchase young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Каримова Саида проживает в городе ТУрсун-Заде. Возраст 37 лет , замужем и имеет шестерых детй. Муж работает в пекарне по выпечке лепешек. Сама занимается торговлей яиц. Занимается этим видом бизнеса один год. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот для себя и закупить муку для деятельности мужа. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saida K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 37 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband works in a bakery making flat bread. She sells eggs. She has been doing this one year. She plans to take out a loan to increase her sales and to buy flour for her husband’s work. She plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a small producer in the district of Djabbar Rasulov in Tajikistan. Together with his wife (pictured), he's been raising cattle for more than 12 years. These cattle produce the income which allows him to feed his three children and his wife.

As well as caring for his livestock, he also cultivates wheat, which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income. Rashid has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.

loans.use: Purchase young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle shed

loans.name: Khushnudbek

texts.en:
S. Khushnudbek is 20 years old. In spite of his young age he is working and supporting his parents. He is an expert in computer services. He provides computer services such as printing, scanning, lamination and audio editing of video tapes and discs of clients' family events. He has been in this business for two years already.

Khushnudbek tries to use modern, up-to-date technologies in his work to satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. For instance, now he is planning to purchase a new computer in order to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business. For this purpose, Khushnudbek requests $1,200 for the term of 12 months. This is Khushnudbek's first loan and he thanks everyone for the support. He promises not to let anyone down and to pay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing a new computer to improve the quality of his work

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Мирзоалиев Махмадшариф проживает  в районе Бохтар . Возраст 37 лет , женат и детей не имеет. Имеет среднее образование. По профессии плотник. Занимается производством пластиковых окон. Для того, чтобы увеличить объем продукции , хочет получить кредит и использовать его для закупки материала. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadsharif M. lives in Bohtar. He is 37 years old, married, and childless. He has a high school education. He is, by trade, a carpenter. He works making plastic windows. To increase his production volume, he wants to take out a loan and use it to buy materials. He can repay the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials (plastic)

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
Gafurjon is 28 years old and makes a living buying and selling livestock. He's married with two young children who he must feed and educate. Over the years, Gafurjon has become very knowledgeable about what is required to raise cattle: their feeding, their calving, etc.

It should be noted that, in the past, this young man endured hard economic times for a while, but he's managed to come through thanks to the help provided by IMON International, Kiva's partner. IMON International has granted loans that Gafurjon has used to buy calves, which is also the reason he needs this loan now. The loan will greatly improve Gafurjon’s income and his family's living standards. In the photo you can see Gafurjon’s mother, who helps him with feeding his cattle.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Аъзам проживает в городе Курган-тюбе. Возраст 41 год, женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Торгует хозяйственными товарами. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент . Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Azam A. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children. He works in sales. He has a shop in the city market. He sells household goods. He wants to take out a loan to improve his selection of goods. It will help him attract new customers and to increase sales. He can repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improve the selection of goods

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 34-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their child. Mohamed has been working as a painter for fifteen years. He paints houses and furniture.

Mohamed requested a loan of $1000 US Dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is the first time that Mohamed has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When Mohamed first started his business, he didn’t have any difficulty. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase tools and paint for his work.

loans.name: Pir

texts.ru: Шарипов Пир житель района Бохтар.Возраст 45 лет, женат и имеет десятерых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. Опыт в бизнесе уже 8 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Pir S. lives in Bohtar. He is 45 years old, married, and has ten children. He has a high school education. He sells household goods. He has eight years experience in business. He plans to take out a loan to increase his sales. He can pay off the loan in six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improve the selection of goods

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
HilA. is a 32-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. HilA. has owned a clothing shop for nine years. He requested a loan of $1000 US Dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him yo open a new, bigger shop and to diversify his merchandise. HilA. is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started, he had difficulty building networks. HilA. decided on doing his business because he always wanted to open his own shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hilal will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Nile Lending (B) Group

texts.en: Monica is a trained nurse running a much needed pharmacy in Jinja.  Monica opened this pharmacy immediately after finishing school and it has now been open for three years. Monica’s husband is the head teacher at a high school in the area.  Together they have two children, a boy, who is 3 and a little girl (being held by Monica in the picture above), who is 2. Each week Monica sells about 200,000 USH worth of medicines a week, and from that she is able to save 30,000 USH.  Her savings are not as much as she would like because she is still renting her shop area.  She pays 100,000 USH for her two-room shop per month. Monica is requesting a loan of 500,000 USH to restock her supply of medicines.She usually buys them a few times a week, but when she gets a loan she can restock more quickly and efficiently.

loans.use: To restock the supplies of medicine

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22-year-old engaged man who lives in the Bekaa. Mohamad has been working in agriculture. He plants potatoes, tomatoes, wheat and other vegetables. He also sells milk.

Mohamad requested a loan of $1500 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase livestock. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mohamad first started his business, he had difficulty building networks. Mohamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Aamar

texts.en:
Aamar, 46 years old, lives in Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Aamar has been selling coal for fifteen years. He is requesting his first time loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase coal. 

Aamar is special in his field because he is the only one in his region who sells coal and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors, tourists and others. When Aamar started his business he didn’t face difficulty. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase coal.

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi, 67 years old, lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife. Fawzi has owned a home product shop for seven years.  Fawzi has not faced many difficulties since he started his business because he knows how to adapt himself depending on the season and on people’s needs. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region.  Fawzi began his business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on improving his business and diversifying his merchandise. 

He is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for his shop. He wants to get souvenirs and home gifts since Mother’s day is coming soon. This is the first time that Fawzi has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for shop

loans.name: Milad

texts.en:
Milad is a 53 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. For 15 years, Milad has owned a pastry shop where he sells Lebanese sweets.

Previously, Milad received a loan that helped him improve his shop. Milad is famous because he is known for his good sweets. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When Milad first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulty. He opened it because he enjoyed making and selling pastries and wanted to have an independent work life.. In the future, he plans to expand and improve his work. 

He is requesting a loan of 2500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase raw materiA. and change the décor of his shop. He successfully paid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase raw material and change the décor of shop

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona, 42 years old, lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Three years since opening her business, Mona has develop a good reputation because she makes a variety of tasty sandwiches, especially her falafel. Her clients include her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capitA.. She pursued this business because she wanted to improve her financiA. situation. In the future, she plans on opening a coffee shop and expanding her business. 

Mona is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her restaurant. This is the first time that Mona has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her restaurant

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en:
Abdel Karim, 41 years old, lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. For 10 years, Abdel Karim has worked as a mechanic selling tires and changing car oil. Previously, Abdel Karim received a loan to help him improve his business and his financial situation. Abdel Karim is special because he renown for his good mechanic work in the region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have any difficulty. He pursued this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation and have an independent work life. In the future, he plans on expanding his business. 
 
Abdel Karim is requesting a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise, such as tires, tools and oil, for his garage. Abdel Karim has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Fama B., 49 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Niaguis Néma depuis 7 ans. Son activité est la vente de bétail. Elle veut acheter des vaches dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour ensuite les revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’entretien de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fama B., age 49, is married and has seven children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group Niaguis Néma for seven years. Her business involves selling livestock. She wants to buy cows at the weekly markets and then resell them. Her income enables her to help support her family. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell livestock

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: EL CARMEN se encuentra situado en el B/ La cuchilla  el entre cuarto y quinto anillo D. la ciudad zona sur entrando por la Av. Moscu el grupo se encuentra en su  1° ciclo, compuesto por 11 personas,como presidenta tenemos a la señora Johana B. C. y tesorera Rosmery V. C. y D. secretaria, Mirna B. G. , el  grupo se encuentra con un credito desembolsado   D. 16,500 Bs que solicito el grupo, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican ala venta D. cosmeticos ,comida ,abarrote y venta D. ropa son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos, las reuniones del grupo se llevan acabo los dias Lunes a horas 15:30 PM en la ubicacion indicada anteriormente.Las Sras:estan conformes D. trabajar con Emprender porque con el credito otorgado lograran incrementar sus ganancias y al mismo tiempo ahorrar, otra actividad es la D. compartir con sus amigas vecinas  cada quincena  . 
La Sra Johana C.  es Presidenta del grupo, es su primer ciclo, ella se dedica al rubro D. venta D. cosmeticos  y tambien posee un snack tiene 6 años D. antiguedad  en el rubro todas las mañanas sale a su negocio D. snack y al mismo tiempo aprovecha D. vender cosmeticos, trabaja 6 dias a la semana; su trabajo requiere D. un incremento D. capital para mejorar su snack e invertir en la compra D. mas cosmeticos. es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no va a defraudar .La Sra Johana B., es  responsable del grupo .
texts.en:
The “El Carmen” communal bank is located at B/ La cuchilla between the fourth and fifth ring of the city’s southern zone entering by Moscu Avenue. This groups is in its first cycle, is maD. up of 11 members, and the president is Mrs. Johana B. C. and the treasurer is Rosmery V. Casto and secretary Mirna B. G.. The group is dispersing a loan of 16,500B to its members. The women in the group sell cosmetics, food, groceries, and clothing so they need loans quickly. The group meets on Mondays at 15:30 PM at the location previously mentioned. The women are working with Emprender because with the loan they will be able to increase their earnings and at the same time saving. Another activity is sharing with their neighboring friends every 15 dyas. Mrs. Johana C., President of the group, is in her first loan cycle. She sells cosmetics and also has had a snack stand for 6 years. Every morning she goes to her snack business and at the same time takes advantage of selling cosmetics. She works 6 days a week. Her work requires an increase of capital to improve her snack business and invest in buying more cosmetics. She is very responsible and active in the group, and the opportunity that Emprender provides her she is not going to disappoint. Mrs. Johana B. is the responsible representative of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to improve her snack business and invest in buying cosmetics

loans.name: Prodan

texts.en: Prodan D. repairs agricultural machinery.  His is a mechanic. In his district, D. is known as a professional engineer.  He is required to repair equipment in local household.  Prodan is borrowing from Microinvest to purchase spare parts for agricultural machinery to repair his own tractor so he can process the land.  The business is located in Cioropcani village, Ungheni district.  D. plans to open a workshop about repair techniques.

loans.use: purchase spare parts for agricultural machinery repair

loans.name: Komla  Mawusi

texts.fr: Monsieur W. réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il exerce comme activité la vente de mortiers qui est utilisé pour piler le fufu, le fufu est un aliment très apprécié dans la cuisine Togolaise, il expose aussi ses marchandises  non loin de la route  qui mène à kpalimé, ce qui lui permet d’attirer les passants. Il fait face en ce moment à une demande très élevée, il conquiert tous les jours de nouveaux clients, pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle il a besoin d’un crédit pour acheter  des mortiers, il est marié et a deux enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. W. resides in the Adidogomé district. His work involves selling mortars, which are used for pounding fufu (a highly appreciated food in Togolese cuisine). He also displays his merchandise not far from the road leading to Kpalimé. This allows him to attract people passing by. Right now, he's facing very high demand. Every day he wins over new customers. To satisfy them, he needs a loan to buy some mortars. He is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mortars

loans.name: Akosuaa

texts.en:
Akosua O. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two girls and a boy.  All of them are currently in basic school.

She trades in bags of all sorts.  Akosua purchases traveling bags, ladies’ dressing bags, etc. from Accra and treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Hweakwae, in the Eastern Region of Ghana.  The major occupation of the dwellers of this community is farming.  The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, many inhabitants combine trading and farming activities.

She wants a loan to purchase more of the bags and other fashion accessories to maximize her profit margin.  Akosua has been in this business for six years.  She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: Purchase traveling/dress bags

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is divorced and the mother of ten children, but she has lost three through ailments.  She is a 70 year old who trades in charcoal in the neighborhood of Kwahu Da, a suburb of Nkawkaw, where she lives with some of her children.

Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes, obtained from burnt fresh wooden logs.  Through this trade, she has supported her first two children to complete apprenticeship training but the rest are still in school.

Adwoa obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of her town and retails them to her customers to support her family with income.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supply of charcoal to serve her customers.  Adwoa believes the loan would enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children.

Adwoa is a member of a borrowing group called ‘Anigyee” (translated: happiness) Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral and provide support to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda inició el negocio porque queria apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con el sueldo de el no era suficiente para solventar los gastos.

Comenzó el negocio en enero del 2002 inicio  vendiendo calzado por catalago a sus familiares y amigos, quienes la han ido recomendadno y asi ha ido progresando mucho, ya que ahora tiene mas ventas por lo cual ha obtenido mas ganancias


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para adquirir mercancia de temporada y asi poder oferecer a sus clientes mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Esmeralda started a business so that she could help her husband with household expenses. His salary alone wasn't enough to cover their bills. In January 2002, she began by selling shoes from a catalogue to her family and friends, who then recommended her to new customers. Esmeralda's business has made a lot of progress. Sales are high, and she is seeing good returns. Esmeralda needs a loan of 5000 MXN ($375 USD), which she'll repay over the course of 20 weeks. She will use the loan to purchase seasonal shoes and offer her customers more variety.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: Ami Mawulon

texts.fr: Cette dame  est mariée et a 03 enfants, elle réside dans le quartier de tokoin cassanblanca qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Depuis 2007 elle  a mis sur pied le commerce de débit de boissons non loin de la pharmacie « bon pasteur », ce commerce lui réussit  bien , la plupart de ses clients sont des tenanciers de bar. Son stock de boissons est épuisé, pour rehausser son stock, elle demande à wages un crédit pour l’achat de boissons.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married and has three children. She resides in the Tokoin Cassanblanca district, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. In 2007, she set up a beverages outlet business not far from the Bon Pasteur pharmacy. This business is successful for her. Most of her customers are bar owners. Her inventory is exhausted. To replenish it, she's asking WAGES for a loan to buy more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: An entrepreneur, Cecilia K., 57, takes care of her four kids, two boys and two girls. They are pursuing an education at the junior and senior high school levels.  She wants to be financially able to support her children to the highest degree of education possible.  Cecilia runs a grocery shop.  She sells products like evaporated milk, candy, toiletries, bottled water etc.  She has been in business for four years.  She also sells cosmetics to support her family with additional income.  Cecilia expects higher profits if she receives her loan.  Her grocery products sell very quickly.  She will be adding vegetable and spices to diversify her trading.  Cecilia lives with her children in a family house at Kwahwu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana.  She is a member of ‘Anigyee’ (meaning: Happiness).  Members in this group guarantee one another as social collateral to access and repay loans.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’ablogamé, elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale dans sa boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS MAWOULOLO », agbeyomé a une parfaite maîtrise de son commerce parce qu’elle exerce ce commerce depuis 1982, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Beaucoup de personnes exercent ce commerce dans les environs de son quartier et pour faire face à cette concurrence elle doit rehausser son stock, raison pour laquelle, elle sollicite auprès de wages un crédit pour l’achat de produits d’alimentation générale, elle est mariée et a 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Agbeyomé lives in the neighbourhood of Ablogamé, where she has a grocery store called "Ets Mawoulolo". Agbeyomé has a perfect mastery of her trade because she has been in business since 1982. She buys her goods from the main market in Lomé. Many people have the same type of business as she does in the neighbourhood and in order to compete she needs to increase her stock, which is why she is asking Wages for a loan to buy general grocery products to retail. She is married and has four children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general grocery products

loans.name: Nicolsa Emperatriz

texts.es: La Señora Nicolasa Emperatriz Paladino Cáceres tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada. La actividad económica de Doña Nicolasa es producción de panadería. Hace mas de tres años que se dedica a este negocio es aquí donde realiza la elaboración de pan dulce y pan simple por lo que este negocio nace por la necesidad de proporcionar a su familia un medio de ingreso. Los propósitos de Doña Nicolasa son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos ya que así no perdería a sus clientes. Es por este motivo que Doña Nicolasa solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podrá realizar su producción de pan. Los deseos de Doña Nicolasa son de establecer una tienda de ropa y así poseer ambos negocios. La cantidad que solicita es de C$8.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolasa Emperatriz Paladino Cáceres is 59 years old and married. Nicolasa is a baker. She has been baking for more than three years, making sweet bread and traditional bread. This business was born of a necessity to provide economically for her family. Nicolasa plans to improve the quality of her products so as not to lose any customers. It is for this motive that Nicolasa seeks financing for working capital in order to be able to make her bread. Nicolasa wishes to establish a clothing store and in this way have both businesses. She seeks C$8.500 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 37 años, vive con su hija de 8 años en casa de sus padres. Tiene un restaurante que abrió hace 3 años en un local que arrendó en una zona comercial de su localidad, y con la ayuda de su madre frece todos los días la atención en desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Por las mañanas trabaja como profesora en una escuela cercana a su casa y por las tardes se dedica a tender su establecimiento, para Clara, tener este negocio le ha permitido tener más ingresos de los que tiene como profesora y esto le permite solventar la educación de su hija, que es lo que le satisface de haber emprendido este negocio, además, le es rentable porque un restaurante siempre tiene demanda y sobre todo en horas del almuerzo. Ahora Clara desea ampliar su negocio y mejorarlo para vender mayor cantidad de platos de comidas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada de trabajar en su banco comunal y le agrada más porque están formando lazos de amistad muy estrechos. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de espejos que decorarán su establecimiento, manteles de mesa y víveres no perecibles para la preparación de sus comidas; como sacos de arroz, menestras, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Clara is 37 years old and she lives with her 8 year old daughter in her parents’ home. She has a restaurant that opened 3 years ago in a location that she rented in a commercial zone of her area. With the help of her mother she offers breakfasts, lunches and dinners at her restaurant everyday. In the mornings she works as a teacher in a school that is close to her home and in the afternoons she tends to her establishment.

For Clara, having this business has allowed her to make more income than she would make as a teacher alone. This extra income permits her to fund her daughter’s education, which is what satisfies her most about running her business. Additionally, her business is profitable because a restaurant is always in demand, especially during the lunchtime hours.

Now Clara desires to increase and better her business to sell a larger quantity of meals. This is the first time that she has a loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic to work with her communal bank and is even more pleased because they are forming strong friendship bonds. The money that she is soliciting is for investing in the purchase of mirrors that will decorate her establishment, tablecloths and non-perishable supplies for the preparation of food; such as sacks of rice, vegetable stews and sugar among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve decor of her restaurant and to buy non-perishable foods for the preparation of foods.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa S. is 60 years old, married and blessed with four children.  Two have completed senior high school.  She works with zeal to support her family.  Theresa is a fish monger and she also runs a small grocery shop in a shed in the local market square. Theresa procures her goods at wholesale prices and has been in business for ten years.  According to Theresa, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.  The loan will enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and improve her family finances.  She lives with some of her children in a house in Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.  She is a member of a group called “Anigyee" Trust Group.  Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access and repay loans.

loans.use: Procure fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: S. abiba est une dame qui est mariée, et a  05 personnes à charges , elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de bois de chauffe dans son quartier, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1982, elle a donc une parfaite maîtrise de ce commerce, les revendeuses de boissons locales viennent s’approvisionner  chez elle, actuellement son stock de marchandises s’épuise et elle voudrait se réapprovisionner. Elle demande alors du crédit pour acheter du bois de chauffage.
texts.en:
S. Abiba is a married woman with five dependents. She has been selling firewood to the people of her neighbourhood since 1982 and so she has mastered this business perfectly. The women who sell local drinks come to her to buy their firewood. She is almost out of stock and wants to restock. She is asking for this loan to buy more firewood.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Elsa Sofía

texts.es: La señora Elsa aprendió el oficio de su madre ya que ella desde muy pequeña empezó a  salir a vender al mercado acompañando a su madre para poderle colaborar en la venta de verduras, por este mismo hecho ella no pudo concluir sus estudios, solo llegó a primaria, posteriormente ella formó su propia familia pero su esposo tampoco cuenta con un negocio estable ya que se dedica a la jardinería y sus ingresos no son suficientes para sustentantar los gastos de sus dos hijos que van a la escuela, por este motivo ella se hizo de un pequeño capital cuando era aún muy joven para poder trabajar y colaborar a su esposo.
texts.en:
Elsa learned her profession from her mother. As a young girl she began to go out to the market to sell accompanied by her mother, to help her sell vegetables. This is also why she was unable to complete her schooling, she only completed primary school. Later she had her own family but her husband was not able to find steady work as he is a gardener and his income isn’t sufficient to support the expenses of their two children who go to school. So she took a small amount of capital when she was young to be able to work and collaborate with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is 33 years old, married and blessed with two kids.  Currently, one is in school.  She is a fish monger who sells in a shed in the local market square.  She procures her goods at wholesale prices and has been in business for ten years.  According to Akosua, most of her customers are food vendors and households in her community. 

She lives with one of her children in a house in Anyinem, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Akosua believes the loan would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually improve her family finances.  She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Patience Trust Group.  Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access and repay loans.

loans.use: Procure fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Dante

texts.es: Dante tiene 25 años, vive en casa de sus padres. El ofrece el servicio de electricista desde hace 5 años, implementó en su misma casa un taller para realizar reparaciones de  equipos electrodomésticos, realiza también instalaciones eléctricas para casas e instituciones, es por ello que en ocasiones viaja porque solicitan sus servicios en instituciones lejanas a su localidad. La demanda que tiene es a razón de que sus trabajos son de buena calidad, esto le genera a Dante la rentabilidad que desea y también la satisfacción de  realizar un trabajo independiente. Ahora quiere mejorar su taller de electricidad y comprar más instrumentos innovadores que potencien la calidad de sus trabajos. Es la primera vez viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchas ganas de emprender un trabajo solidario con sus demás compañeros de su banco comunal. La cantidad que está solicitando es para invertirla en la compra de herramientas y materiales que utiliza en su taller como; cobre, alicates graduados, desarmadores de diferentes medidas, etc.
texts.en:
Dante is 25 years old and lives with his parents. He has been working as an electrician for five years, and set up a workshop in his own house to repair household appliances. He also does electrical installations in houses and institutions, and so occasionally must travel because his services are requested in institutions that are far from his town. He is in such demand because he does high-quality work, which helps Dante earn the income he wishes, and also gives him the satisfaction of working independently. Now he wants to refurbish his workshop and buy more tools that will boost the quality of his work. This is the first time he's requested a loan from MFP, and he is eager to work in solidarity with the other members of his communal bank. He is requesting this sum in order to purchase tools and supplies that he will use in his workshop, such as copper, pliers, screwdrivers of different sizes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his workshop

loans.name: Etsé

texts.fr: Monsieur A. etsé  est un homme marié, il a 02 enfants, il réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’adidogomé. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille est la vente de friperie. Il fait son commerce depuis 2004 et s’approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoé où ce commerce est très développé. Il veut rehausser son stock, raison pour laquelle il sollicite de wages un crédit pour  achat de friperie.
texts.en:
A. Etsé is a married man. He has two children and lives with his family in the neighbourhood of Adidogomé. He sells second-hand clothing in order to make money and support his family. He has been in this business since 2004 and gets his stock from the local market of Hedzranawoé which is a hub for the used-clothing business. He wishes to increase his stock of clothing which is why he is asking Wages for this loan to buy second-hand clothes.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Nuevo Milenio Group

texts.es: El grupo "Nuevo Milenio" esta representado por el señor Walter Santos y conformado por 12 miembros D. los cuales su principal actividad es el comercio D. productos como accesorios D. celular, material D. escritorio, cosméticos, abarrotes, dulces y al servicio público D. pasajeros. Este grupo sabe que existe L. competencia pero no le da importancia ya que saben como trabajar con sus productos. El destino del crédito es para L. ampliación D. sus negocios y a L. compra D. insumos y materiales que mejoren L. calida D. sus productos para incrementar sus ingresos y mejora más aun L. calida D. vida D. sus familias. Los socios(as) Van cursando su tercer ciclo dentro D. L. institución por lo que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como cumplir con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad, honestidad y muchas ganas D. salir adelante
texts.en:
The group 'Nuevo Milenio' is represented by Walter Santos and is comprised of 12 members, for whom the principal activity is the sale of products such as mobile phone accessories, stationery, cosmetics, groceries, sweets, and transport tickets. This group knows that competition exists, but this doesn't worry them as they now know how to work with their products. This loan is destined to increase their businesses and buy items of necessity and materials that improve the quality of their products, to increase their earnings and further improve the quality of life of their families. The members are in their third season in the institution, which is why they have experience as a supportive group and know how to meet their obligations with responsibility, honesty and a lot of enthusiasm to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. She says two children are in school now but the last born has not yet started school. She lives with her family in their own house at Anyinem, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Mercy works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. Mercy sells foodstuffs. She sells plantain, cassava, yam, etc., on a table in the community market. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She also distributes the cassava and plantain to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. She wants a loan to buy the food stuffs on a larger scale so that she can cut down on costs, and on the frequency of trips to procure the goods and also to maximize profit.

Mercy is a member of the community group called Patience. Members in this group provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: Carmen María S. C. tiene 45 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Carmen no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Carmen es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de ocho años que se dedica este negocio y dio inicio con capital propio por medio de una amiga que le dijo que esta era una buena fuente de ingreso y recurre a Fundación León 2000 para solicitar financiamiento y así comienza con su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Carmen son de seguir administrando su negocio de una buena forma. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir en la compra de nuevos productos ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y sus clientes solicitan variedad de productos. Sus deseos son de viajar ala exterior para conocer otros países. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 7.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Carmen María S. C. is 45-years-old, married and doesn’t have any children. She has been selling a variety of merchandise for over 8 years. She started her business with her own capital at the suggestion of a friend who said it would be a good source of income. She turned to Fundación León 2000 for funding and her business took off.

Carmen plans to continue managing her business effectively. Since the summer season is approaching and customers will demand a variety of products, she will use this loan as working capital to invest in the purchase of new merchandise. Her dream is to travel abroad to learn about other countries. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 7000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina M. elabora joyas que las lucen las personas  de pollera  en las fiestas folklóricas como ser la Fiesta del Gran Poder y la fiesta Universitaria, solamente tiene un operario quien trabaja todo el día mientras la señora visita las clientas, vive en una pequeña casita junto a su hija que esta en edad escolar la que también sabe del oficio ya que le ayuda a la mama en su tiempo libre, ya que es el único ingreso con el que cubre los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Cristina M. makes jewelry that people in folk festivals such as "la Fiesta del Gran Poder" (The Festival of Great Power, a festival in La Paz, Bolivia) and university festivals wear on their skirts. The business has only has one operator who works the whole day while Cristina visits the customers. She lives in a small house with her school-age daughter. Her daughter is familiar with the operation since she helps her mother during her free time. It is their only source of income for their family expenditures.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of jewels and stones for jewelry-making

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Monsieur N. habite le quartier d’adidogomé, il a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’huile à moteur dans une cabine qu’il s’est fait construit par un menuisier, il a appelé cette cabine «  DAVID SON », il a commencé ce commerce en 2002, il s’approvisionne chez des fournisseurs au port autonome de lomé et  au bénin. La plupart de ses clients sont de conducteurs de taxi moto. Il veut rehausser son stock .Etant client de wages il demande un crédit pour acheter de l’huile à moteur.
texts.en:
Mr. N. lives in the neighbourhood of Adidogomé. He makes his money selling motor oil from a stand he commissioned a carpenter to make him. He calls his stand "David Son". He has been in business since 2002. He gets his stock from distributors in the autonomous port of Lomé and from Benin. Most of his customer are moto-taxo drivers. He wants to increase his stock. Because he is a client of WAGES, he is asking for a loan to buy more motor oil.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motor oil

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G. is a 30-year-old divorced mother of a single boy who is in school. Ama lives with her son in a rented apartment in a community called Anyinem. It is located in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number is also involved in trading and other business activities.

Ama is a hairdresser by profession. She does both plaiting and perming. She says she graduated from apprenticeship training eight years ago and has since trained five young ladies in hairdressing who have started their own businesses. Apart from hairdressing, Ama also sells assorted soaps through hawking house-to-house in the early morning before she resumes work at her salon.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy hairdressing equipment, fashion accessories, artificial human hair, pomades and other materials she will need to serve her clients satisfactorily. She hopes to increase her income to enable her save more to support her son’s education. She is a member of the Patience Trust Bank group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials and fashion accessories

loans.name: Villa Taruma Group

texts.es: El grupo "Villa Taruma" en su mayoría esta conformado por personas del área peri-urbana y representado por la señora Hedilberta. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de ropa americana,  zapatos, comida, carne, elaboración de pan  y al servicio de transporte público. La competencia en el mercado es alta pero las socias venden en las zonas peri-urbanas donde ya tienen clientes fijos. El destino del crédito es para el incremento de productos para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de sus productos con insumos de mejor calidad. Este grupo se encuentra iniciando su segundo ciclo en el cual demostraron puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The group “Villa Taruma” is mostly formed from people from the peri-urban area and is represented by ms. Hedilberta. The majority of the members sell American clothing, shoes, food, meat, bread and public transportation services. The competition in the market is high, but the members sell in the peri-urban zones, where they already have loyal customers. The loan will be used to increase their products to boost their earnings and to improve the quality of their products with better supplies. This group is beginning their second cycle and have demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in their payments, which demonstrates experience as a united group.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more goods and better-quality supplies

loans.name: Sisters In Business Group

texts.en:
David (left) is the leader of this group. He is fifty years of age. He was born in Yele Sanda village, four miles from Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have eight children. Four of his children are in secondary school, three in primary school and one is still sucking. He has been a businessman for over twenty years now.

David sells market food. He sells pepper and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this new loan, he will expand on his business. He will be able to buy about four bags of pepper and three barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm-oil. He buys his goods from either the village called Kalamgba or Tambiama. A bag of pepper costs him Le 200,000 and a barter of palm-oil costd him Le 40,000 in either of these villages.

So far, David faces no serious challenge in his business that is worth noting. Business is going fine and smooth. He enjoys what he does for a living. To David and his colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy four bags of pepper and three barters of palm-oil

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las PodeR." esta representado por la señora Carmen Cecilia y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades de venta de productos como dulces, tarjetas, cosméticos, electrodomésticos y al servicio de mensajeria, secretaria y soldadura de arco y oxigeno. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es una lucha de cada día pero, los socios del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de progresas. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de insumos, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresaos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calida de vida.  Una mayoría de los miembros del grupo no tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios pero saben como trabajar para cumplir con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
Las PodeR. ('The Powerful Ones') community bank is represented by Carmen Cecilia and is made up of twelve members. Some members sell products such as sweets, phone cards, cosmetics, and home appliances, and others provide services such as those of a courier, secretary, and welder (specializing in gas metal arc welding). Competition in the commercial sector is a struggle every day but the group members know how to get through it thanks to their experience and progress. The loan will be used to buy supplies, materials, and tools that will help improve the members' incomes, providing their families with a better quality of life. The majority of the group members don't have experience working in solidarity groups but know how to work in order to fulfill their obligations with responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Jehová Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Las tres Señoras del grupo solidario Jehová es mi Fortaleza, ambos son muy buenos en sus negocios por lo que en estos momentos no cuentan con el suficiente capital de trabajo es por eso que solicitan financiamiento. La Señora Josefa Eufemia M. J. su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos y la venta de tortillas tiene mas de 5 años ya que su negocio ha sido un medio de supervivencia para ella y su familia y por medio de los financiamientos es que ha podido salir adelante. La otra Señora que constituye el grupo es Doña María Auxiliadora M. J. tiene la edad 44 años ella se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y refrescos naturales hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, los propósitos de Doña María Auxiliadora son de seguir manteniendo su negocio y obtener mas recurso para la compra de mas productos variados y ofertar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Y su última integrante Doña Thelma J. R. tiene la edad de 62 años, ella se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de granos básicos y refrescos naturales hace mas de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio pero es importante resaltar que su negocio nació por la necesidad de generar una fuente de ingresos para su familia la Señora Thelma es madre soltera por lo que su aspiración es seguir manteniendo su negocio ya que es el único medio de manutención para ella y su familia. La cantidad solicitada por Doña Josefa es de C$3.000 córdobas, a Doña María Auxiliadora es de C$3.000 córdobas y a Doña Thelma es de C$3.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
The three women in the solidarity group Jehová es mi Fortaleza, although all are very good at business, at this time are lacking sufficient funds and so are requesting financing. Josefa Eufemia M. J. works selling staple grains and tortillas. This economic activity has supported her and her family for more than five years, and she has been able to keep her business going thanks to financing. The other woman in the group is Doña María Auxiliadora M. J., who is 44 years old. She has been selling staple grains and natural drinks for more than three years. Doña María Auxiliadora's goals are to keep her business going and obtain more resources in order to purchase more varied products and offer her customers better service. The last member is Doña Thelma J. R., who is 62 years old. She has worked selling staple grains and natural drinks for more than 9 years, but it's important to note that her business came about because she needed a source of income for her family. Señora Thelma is a single mother, so her goal is to keep her business going, since it's the only means she has to support herself and her family. Doña Josefa is requesting C$3.000 córdobas, Doña María Auxiliadora is requesting C$3.000 córdobas, and Doña Thelma is requesting C$3.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is 45 years old. She is a widow and mother of three kids who currently attend school. Abena lives with her family in their own house at Anyinem, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Abena works hard to support her kids’ welfare and schooling.  She sells foodstuffs and vegetables like plantains, cassavas, yams, tomatoes, onions, egg plant, etc. on a table top in the community market.  She buys her goods from farmers in surrounding villages.  Abena has been in business for twelve years. She also distributes cassavas and plantains to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators.  Abena wants a loan to buy food stuffs on a large scale so she can cut down on costs by reducing her number of trips to procure goods to maximize profit.

She is a member of the community group called Patience.  Members guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and repay loans.

loans.use: Buy food stuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Rositas" esta representado por la señora Nataly y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales se dedican en su mayoría a la venta D. cerveza, comida, ropa, zapatos y a actividades D. servicio D. construcción D. viviendas, limpieza domiciliaria y la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir. La competencia dentro D. este ámbito es dura, pero saben como salir adelante teniendo productos variados y al alcance del bolsillo D. todos sus clientes. El destino del crédito para la adquisición D. mercadería para poder maximizar sus ingresos que son el sustento D. sus familias.  A pesar D. que es un grupo relativamente tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios y saben como responder a sus obligaciones con responsabilidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
The group "Las Rositas" (Little Roses) is represented by Nataly and maD. up of 13 members, who are mostly engaged in the sale of beer, food, clothes, shoes, and service activities such as house construction, house cleaning, and the manufacture of clothing. The competition in this field is tough, but they know how to get ahead by having various products that are affordable to all their clients. This credit is for the acquisition of merchandise, to be able to maximize their income that is the sustenance for their families. Although it is a relatively [new] group, they have experience working with solidarity groups and they know how to respond to their obligations with responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 54 años, vive en su propia casa con sus 4 hijos mayores. Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, tanto nueva, como de segundo uso, Dominga realiza sola este trabajo motivada por la necesidad de generase mayores ingresos. Vende todos los domingos en la feria comercial de su localidad de manera ambulante, y disfruta de su actividad porque desde joven le gustó el comercio. Su negocio es rentable porque las prendas de vestir  siempre tienen demanda. Por ello Dominga está pensando acrecentar su negocio vendiendo también zapatos, además quiere acondicionar un espacio de su casa para tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus prendas o otros productos más. Es la cuarta vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, Dominga disfruta de cada reunión que realiza su banco comunal y promueve la solidaridad entre todos. El dinero que requiere lo usará en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa, en especial de chompas de lana para la próxima época de invierno.
texts.en:
Dominga is 54 years old. She lives in her own house with her four grown sons. For four years, she has sold second-hand clothing. Dominga was motivated to begin this business because she needed to generate more income. She sells every Sunday at the local market, as a roaming vendor. She enjoys her work because she has liked retail since she was young. Her business is profitable because her articles of clothing are always in demand. For this reason, Domingo is thinking about expanding her business to include selling shoes. In addition, she wants to renovate a space in her house where she can have a store from which to sell her articles of clothing or other products. It is her fourth time seeking a loan from MFP, and she has demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. Dominga enjoys all of her meetings with the communal bank, which promote solidarity among everyone. She will use her loan to purchase a larger quantity of clothing, especially wool sweaters for the coming winter.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her second-hand business

loans.name: Las Cariñosa Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las Cariñosas" esta representado por la señora Petrona y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales se dedican en su mayoría a la venta de pan, ropa y a la elaboración de prendas de vestir. La competencia dentro de este ámbito es dura pero gracias a que ya tienen clientes fijos de tiendas se acaba el producto diariamente. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de materiales, insumos y a la adquisición de mercadería que facilite y mejore la producción y por ende sus ingresos los cuales son el sustento de sus familias. A pesar de que es un grupo relativamente nuevo se ve que son gente responsable y con ganas de salir adelante para mejor la calida de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Las Cariñosas” communal bank is represented by Petrona and is made up of 15 members, most of whom work selling bread, clothing, and making clothing. The competition in this line of work is tough, but thanks to the fact that they already have steady customers, they sell out of the products daily. The loan will be used to purchase materials, ingredients, and merchandise, which facilitate and improve production and therefore their incomes, which support their families. Despite the fact that they are a relatively new group, they are responsible and with a great desire to get ahead and improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de operaciones

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de jugos en un puesto que tiene en el mercado de su localidad desde hace 12 años. Todas las mañanas atiende su negocio, y es una distracción y satisfacción generar sus propios ingresos y relacionarse con las personas que acuden a tomar un jugo de frutas preparado por ella. Gladys considera a su negocio rentable, porque siempre hay personas que consumen lo que ofrece, por ello quiere abrir otro puesto en el mercado y contratar a una señorita para la atención del mismo. Crecer es uno de lo grandes anhelos de Gladys, por lo que continuará dedicándose a su negocio. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y fue una de las personas más entusiastas para la formación de este grupo humano que es su banco comunal, y seguirá trabajando con eficiencia para que todos sigan unidos. La cantidad que solicita es para comprar frutas por grandes cantidades, adquirir otra licuadora y vasos nuevos para servir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladys is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. She has been selling juices at a stall in her local market for 12 years. Every morning she attends to her business, and finds generating her own income and interacting with the people who come to drink one of the fruit juices she prepares both entertaining and fulfilling. Gladys considers her business worthwhile, because there are always people consuming what she's offering, so she'd like to open another stall in the market and hire a young woman to attend it. This is her first loan with MFP, and she was one of the people who was most enthusiastic about forming the communal bank to which she belongs. She will continue working efficiently so they all remain united. The sum requested is to buy fruit in bulk and to purchase another blender and new glasses to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit to prepare juices

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate Boakyewaa is 57 years old. She is married with five children. She lives at Mampong with her family. Currently all of her children are in school. She is a chemical seller and Kate also sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonic, pain killers, malaria drugs etc. in her neighborhood.  Many local people patronize her drugs as first aid and cure when they are sick. She has been in business for twenty years and the only person who supplies pharmaceutical products in the community. Kate's chemical is registered to operate by Ghana pharmaceutical council.  She wants to use the loan to increase her supplies of drugs to include others that are frequently requested by her customers. Kate hopes to raise good income to take care of her family.  She also hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her children in school. Kate belongs to a village bank called ‘Naomi’.

loans.use: Buy increased supplies of pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is 63 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children: three girls and four boys. All of them are out of school and living independently.

Her husband is a farmer. However, he doesn’t go the farm any longer because he has lost his eyesight. His predicament forces Adwoa to work very hard in order to provide daily bread for the household and pay all the hospital bills. She lives with her husband and some grandchildren in a family house in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers of this community is farming.

Adwoa sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions and garden eggs (similar to eggplant) and tilapia on a table top in the market square. She procures her products in Nkawkaw, a nearby city in the region.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Adelina Lucrecia

texts.es: La Señora Adelina Lucrecia S. Chavarría tiene la edad de 55 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. La actividad de Doña Adelina es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que su negocio dio inicio por su madre quien le enseño a realizar esta actividad y además se instruyó en la administración del mismo. Los propósitos de Doña Adelina son de ofrecer a sus clientes más productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que en estos momentos no posee el suficiente dinero para realizar la compra de los productos que sus clientes solicitan. Sus sueños son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que es lo único que les dejara a sus hijos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$13.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Señora Adelina Lucrecia S. Chavarría is 55 years old and married. Doña Adelina sells fruits and vegetables. She's been working in this business for more than seven years, ever since her mother taught her how to run it. Doña Adelina's goal is to offer her customers more products. The loan is for business capital, since at this time she doesn't have enough money to purchase the products her clients request. Her dream is to improve her home, since it's the only thing she can leave to her children. She is requesting a loan of C$13.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: John

texts.es: John tiene 32 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Se dedica al transporte en motocarro desde hace 3 años, cubriendo la ruta interna de su localidad, trabaja diariamente y durante todo el día ofreciendo este servicio. John disfruta de su trabajo porque es independiente y dueño de su propia movilidad, además se puede dar un tiempo libre para sus hijos. Este trabajo le permite cubrir sus gastos y las necesidades de sus hijos, por lo que considera que esta actividad tiene buenas ganancias y le anima a planificar su futuro comprando otras unidades para hacerlas trabajar con otros choferes. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, para él, esta es una nueva experiencia de trabajo en común con varias personas, lo que es de su agrado y se compromete a seguir adelante. La cantidad que requiere es para la compra de llantas nuevas para su movilidad, además del pago de la renovación del seguro de accidentes.
texts.en:
John is 32 years old, and he lives with his two children in his parents' house. He has been working with an autorickshaw for three years, covering an internal route in his town. He works all day every day offering his service. John enjoys his work because he is independent and has his own mobility, and he can take some time off for his kids. This job allows him to cover his expenses and the needs of his children, therefore he believes that this activity has good profits and that encourages him to plan his future buying other units to make them work with other drivers. This is the first time he has requested a loan with MFP. For him, this is a new work experience in common with other people, which he likes and he is commited to keep going forward. The amount he requests is for the purchase of new tires for his unit, plus the renovation of his accident insurance.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new tires for his autorickshaw and insurance

loans.name: El Porvenir Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "El Porvenir"  esta  representados por la señora Juana  y conformado  por 5 varones que se dedican al transporte y a la agricultura  y 14   señoras en su mayoría  se dedican  a la venta de horneados, comidas, ropa y refrigerios.  Este es su 1er ciclo en nuestra institución pero demuestran gran entusiasmo y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. La competencia no les preocupa ya que la buena calidad de sus productos tiene su mercado asegurado en especial con la modalidad de trabajo que tienen. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de insumos y herramientas para mejor su servicio y también la calidad y cantidad de sus productos para incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. La experiencia de los miembros del grupo en créditos solidarios hace ver que tienen experiencia en el manejo y administración de fondos así  como en su responsabilidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Porvenir" is represented by Juana, and consists of five men who work in transport and agriculture and 14 women, the majority of whom sell baked goods, food, clothing and snacks. This is their first loan cycle in this institution, but they demonstrate a great deal of enthusiasm and the drive to work to succeed. Competition does not worry them since the high quality of their products secures their market, especially with their work ethic. The loan will be used to purchase inputs and tools to improve their service as well as the quantity and quality of their products, in order to increase their sales and thus their incomes. The members' experience in credit solidarity groups shows in their ability to manage and administer funds as well as in their responsibility toward their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa S. est une jeune femme qui a pour l’activité la vente de draps, sacs, parfum, tissus et divers en couture.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis deux ans, et elle sollicite ce premier crédit au près de IMCEC pour renforcer ses activités.  Cette femme dynamique et travailleuse est mariée et elle habite à Thiès.  Avec les profits de son entreprise, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Awa S. is a young woman who sells sheets, bags, perfume, cloth and a variety of sewn items. She has been in business for two years and is requesting this first loan from IMCEC in order to bolster her business. This energetic and hard-working woman is married and lives in Thiès. With the profits from her business she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets, bags, perfume, cloth and a variety of sewn items

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua F. is a 40-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has five kids. Four of her children attend school and the last-born is still breastfeeding. She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, abetie and other local dishes in the community where she lives.

Akua has been in this business for the past 15 years. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

Her picture was taken when she visited. Akua belongs to a village bank called "Naomi." She hope to receive GH¢700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna O. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children, three girls and six boys. Six of them are currently in school: senior high, junior high and primary schools. The rest are running their own businesses and living independently. Her husband works with a mining company in their community. She lives with her husband and children in a family house in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers in this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, many inhabitants combine trading and farming activities. 
Anna is into the palm oil production business. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers to prepare the oil. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Anna wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. It is her dream to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Penda S. est une femme qui a pour activité le commerce de divers produits (patte d’arachide,  huile de palme, mil, tissus etc.). Elle va s’approvisionner à Diaobe. Elle fait ce commerce depuis sept ans  et elle sollicite ce prêt auprès de l’IMCEC pour renforcer son activité. Cette femme veuve qui habite a Thiès fait ce travail pour aider ses enfants à se nourrir.
texts.en:
