Penda S. is a woman who sells a variety of products such as peanut paste, palm oil, millet, cloth and so on. She gets her goods from Diaobe. She has been in this line of business for seven years and is asking IMCEC for this loan in order to bolster her business. Penda is a widow who lives in Thiès; she works in order to feed her children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods: peanut paste, palm oil, millet and cloth

loans.name: Las Bondadosas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las  Bondadosas" están representadas por la señora María Elva y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales son del barrio Toborochi y se conocen desde hace tiempo. Todas los miembros tiene sus pequeños negocios propios de venta de productos como  cosméticos por catalogo, comida, pan, ropa y a actividades de servicio como limpieza domiciliaria, niñeras y a la construcción de viviendas. Las socias aceptan que existe gran competencia dentro del mercado de venta de productos pero llevan años vendiendo en el mismo lugar y saben como salir adelante por el bien de sus familias ya que representan el pilar de los ingresos de sus hogares. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería y productos de mejor calida para brindar a sus clientes un mejor producto mas competitivo y la compra de herramientas para brindar un mejor servicio para incrementar sus ingresos y mejor la calida de vida de sus familias. Todos los socios poseen experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que conocen como administrar los fondos otorgados y como cumplir con responsabilidad a su plan de pagos.
texts.en:
The "Las Bondadosas" communal bank is represented by María Elva and consists of 13 members from the Toborochi neighborhood who have known each other for some time. All of the members have their own small businesses selling products like catalog cosmetics, food, bread and clothing, and providing services like housekeeping, babysitting and home building. The partners accept that there is competition in their respective markets, but they have been selling in the same area for years and know how to succeed for the benefit of their families, as they represent the mainstay of income in their homes. The loan will be used to purchase better quality merchandise to bring their customers a more competitive product, and to purchase tools to improve service which will bring in a better income and better their families' quality of life. All of the partners have experience in credit groups, so they know how to administer the funds and how to fulfill the responsibility of their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. is 60 years old. She is a widowed mother of five children, two males and three females. She says all of them are out of school and living independently. She lives with her grandchildren in a family house in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers in this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, good for farming.
Ama is into the business of selling soft drinks. She sells soft drinks such as Coke, Fanta, Sprite, etc. She buys from wholesale dealers in Nkawkaw because of her limited working capital. She keeps the drinks in a fridge to cool and then sells to people in her neighborhood. She wants a loan to procure crates of soft drinks in bulk. It is Ama’s dream to help her grandchildren in school.

loans.use: To buy crates of soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda T. est une femme marie qui fait la restauration chez elle. Elle faisait partie d’un groupement mais actuellement elle a ouvert son compte à l’IMCEC Thiès. Ce crédit lui permet de renforcer son activité de restauration c'est-à-dire vendre du fraiche aussi en période de chaleur. Elle est mère de trois enfants, avec ses revenues elle peut aider son mari sur la scolarité de celles-ci.
texts.en:
Aïda T. is a married women who is a restauranteur out of her home. She used to belong to a solidarity group, but at the present time, she has opened her own account at IMCEC Thiès. This loan will enable her to enhance her restaurant business, that is, to sell cold items as well when the weather is hot. She is the mother of three children. With her revenues, she can help her husband with the schooling costs of the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enhance her restaurant

loans.name: Mara

texts.es: Mara tiene 28 años, vive con su pequeña hija en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a realizar bellos trabajos tejidos, y en algunas ocasiones bordados, para sostener ella sola a su hija. Trabaja en su misma casa, lo que le permite ver a su pequeña, y una vez que termina de elaborar sus tejidos los reparte a las personas que solicitaron el pedido. Para Mara, realizar este trabajo es una distracción que le permite obtener ganancias y de esta manera seguir creciendo económicamente. Su deseo es tener una tienda donde pueda exhibir sus bellos trabajos, incrementar su producción y obtener más ganancias. Es la primera vez tiene un préstamo con MFP, está contenta por la labor que realizará en su banco comunal y desde ahora asume su compromiso de un trabajo solidario. Con el dinero que solicita comprará lana de diversos tipos para la elaboración de sus tejidos, asimismo invertirá una pequeña parte en la apertura de una bodega en sociedad con su hermana, Mará aportara con mercadería en dulces y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Mara is 28 years old and she lives with her young daughter in her parent’s home. She has been making beautiful knitted items and occasionally embroidered items for 5 years in order to support her daughter, of whom she is the sole support. She works from her home, which enables her to watch her daughter and when she finished making her knitted items she delivers them to people who have ordered them. For Mara, this work is a distraction that enables her to generate income and in this way continue growing economically. Her wish is to have a store where she can exhibit her beautiful work, increase her production and obtain more earnings. This is the first time she will have a loan with MFP, and she is content with her work with the communal bank and she accepts her promise of working together with her group. With the money she seeks she will buy various types of wool to make her items, and she will invest a small part in opening a store with her sister. Mara will support it with merchandise such as candy and soda pop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different types of wool

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 34 years old. She is divorced and the mother of four children. Mary believes in hard work and dedication, which is the secret to her success. She is a single parent who always wants to see joy in the family. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like banku and abetie. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She needs the loan to enable her to inject more capital into her business so she can purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava dough, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She says the cost of raw materials is very high now. She also wants to save part of the loan to venture into crop farming in the near future. Her picture was taken when she was going about her normal daily chores. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Naomi’. She hope to receive GH¢800 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Volimata

texts.fr: Mme Volimata S. est une femme qui fait de l’embauche ovule depuis 10 ans. Elle  a une grande expérience de ce travail. Elle achète des moutons au marché hebdomadaire de Touba-Toul pour les revendre durant les fêtes de Tabaski. Avec ce crédit elle veut renforcer son activité dont les revenues vont servir à payer la scolarité de sa petite fille qui est en classe de terminale.
texts.en:
Ms. Volimata S. is a woman who has been working for ten years fattening sheep . She has a lot of experience in this trade. She buys sheep at the weekly market in Touba-Toul in order to resell them during the Tabaski holidays. With this loan, she wants to bolster her business. The profits from it will be used to pay the schooling costs for her granddaughter, who is in the 12th grade.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K., 56 years old, is divorced and the mother of four kids, two currently in school. She operates a shop and sells items like blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags to other females. She has been selling in various communities during their market days. Mary sometimes sells through hawking and has been trading for the past 35 years. It is her desire to provide a quality education for her children and to secure a better future for them. Mary is constrained by the funds available to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her have more resources to purchase good quality and large quantities to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Naomi’. She hope to receive GH¢700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase slippers and ladies wear.

loans.name: Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Esmeraldas" esta representado por la señora Andrea y conformada por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Nicolasa y su hija Maribel  ellas cuentan con pequeños negocios propios e independientes una D. la otra. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales como la venta D. refrescos, comida, empanadas, cosméticos, plásticos y a actividades como la confección D. prendas D. vestir a y a la construcción D. viviendas, este último desea emprender su negocio D. venta D. material escolar. Los socios(as) luchan día a día con la competencia pero tratan D. ganar su ingreso diario para poder llevar el pan D. cada día a su familia. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y para emprender nuevos negocios que les den mayor ganancia y una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias. La mayoría trabajo con  otras entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios, para otros miembros es su primer financiamiento, pero saben como trabajar y responder a sus obligaciones con responsabilidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
The "Esmeraldas" group is represented by Andrea and consists of 12 members, including family relations between Nicolasa and her daughter, Maribel. Each of them has their own small business and an independent income. The majority of the members work selling soft drinks, food, empanadas, cosmetics and plastics, or making clothes and building houses. Another member wants to start a business selling school supplies. The partners fight day to day against their competition, and try to earn an income to be able to bring their families their daily bread. The loan will be used to purchase inputs, materials and tools to improve their current incomes and start new businesses that will bring in a better income and thus a better quality of living for their families. The majority have worked with other financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital, and know how to work and respond to their obligations with responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is 56 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two males and one female. She says all of them are out of school and living independently. She lives with her husband and grandchildren in a family house in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers in this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, good for farming.
Agnes trades in foodstuffs such as yam, cassava, plantain, and other cereals such as beans, maize, etc. She buys from a town called Afram Plains where the cost is economical and she treks to nearby markets to sell. She sells to retailers and food vendors. Agnes has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods on a large scale to supply more customers. It is Agnes’ dream to help her grandchildren in school.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam and cereals

loans.name: Yemica

texts.es: Yemica tiene 20 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años en una casa alquilada. Ambos se dedican al transporte con su auto propio desde hace 2 años, cubriendo la ruta interprovincial de su zona, juntos trabajan y se apoyan mutuamente, por parte de Yemica en preparar los alimentos y controlar el mantenimiento de su movilidad y él como chofer. Diariamente, excepto los domingos, ofrecen este servicio, negocio que eligieron por ser una actividad que les genera ganancias necesarias para cubrir los gastos familiares y a la vez ahorrar para en un futuro adquirir una casa propia y un carro adicional para el progreso de su familia se desarrolle. Es la primera vez que Yemica está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser  puntual en sus pagos, así mismo de trabajar para el bienestar de todo su grupo. La cantidad que está solicitando es para invertirla en el mantenimiento de su movilidad para que siga trabajando por mucho más tiempo.
texts.en:
Yemica is 20 years old and lives with her husband and her two-year-old son in a rented house. Both she and her husband have been working in transportation for two years, using their own car to travel the interprovincial road of their area. Both work and support each other: Yemica prepares the food and ensures the maintenance of the car while her husband drives. Every day, except for Sundays, they offer this service. They decided on this business as a business which would make enough money to pay for the household expenses and allow them to save for the future. They want to own a house of their own and buy another car so that their family can continue to make progress. This is the first time that Yemica is asking for a loan from MFP and she is committed to repaying punctually as well as to working for the wellbeing of her entire group. The loan will be invested in the maintenance of the car so that she can continue using it as a source of revenue for a long time to come.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To perform car maintenance

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth K., 42, is married with eight children. Currently, five of them are in school. She lives with her husband and kids in Boanim, a suburb of Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works very hard because, as a mother who wants to see her kids get to the university level, the partial responsibility rests on her shoulders .

She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by hawking through door-to-door sales. Ruth is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her kids in school.

She wants to use the loan to buy plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for that support. Ruth belongs to a village bank called "Naomi." She hope to receive GH¢800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama F., 45, is married and has given birth to five children: three boys and two girls. She says all of them are still in junior high or primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers of this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, many inhabitants combine trading and farming activities.

Ama is in the palm-oil production business. She procures palm fruits from local farmers to prepare the oil. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She also sells to food vendors in her community. Ama wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. It is her dream to help her husband give their children the best education they can afford since it is the best legacy they can give them.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia B. is 45 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Afia believes in hard work and dedication, which is the secret of her success. She lives with her family at Dome, a suburb of Mampong in the Ashanti region. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like banku and abetie. Banku is prepared from milled maize grain and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She needs a loan to inject more capital to purchase raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava dough, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She says the cost of raw materials is very high now and she also wants to save part of her proceeds to provide a better education for her children.  Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa,’ which means ‘Pray for Life’. She hopes to receive 800 GHS to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and restock inventory

loans.name: Anakpa

texts.fr: Monsieur anakpa a pour activité le commerce de carte de recharge, il exerce ce commerce depuis 2004 et de façon ambulante, il est célibataire alors il travaille dur afin de pouvoir gagner sa vie. Il veut agrandir son commerce, il s’adresse alors à wages pour demander son premier crédit  qui lui  servira à acheter des cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
Mr. Anakpa's business involves selling recharge phone cards door-to-door. He has been in this business since 2004. He is unmarried, so he works hard to earn his living. He wants to expand his commerce. And so he's enquiring with WAGES to ask for his first loan, which will be used to buy phone cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recharge phone cards

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba N. is forty-six years old. She is married and has five children, three boys and two girls. She says all of them are still in school – junior high and primary schools. Aba’s husband is a farmer, while she is in the palm oil production business. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents of this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, is good for farming. 

Aba procures palm fruits from the local farmers to prepare the palm oil. She distributes it to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She also sells to food vendors in her community. Aba would like a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. It is her dream to help her husband give their children the best education they can afford, since it is the best legacy they can leave them.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience D. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She says with the help of God, all her children attend school. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits, and baby products like napkins, feeding bottles, etc. in her neighborhood. She lives in Dome in the Ashanti region of Ghana. With her nine years of experience and through this business Patience has supported the family. Fortunately, her business is positioned at a strategic location within the town where she lives. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Patience belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa,’ which means ‘Pray for Life’. She hopes to receive 900 GHS to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Nanding Diarra

texts.fr: Nanding Diarra Sané est mariée avec 01 personne à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Niaguis Néma depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de la pâte d’arachide, du jus de citron et de l’huile de palme. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce et améliorer la scolarité et l’habillement de ses enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Nanding Diarra Sané is married and has one dependent. She has been a member of the Niaguis Néma village bank for seven years. She buys and sells peanut paste, lemon juice and palm oil. She wants to bolster her business and pay for her children's tuition and their clothing. The loan she is asking for will be repaid in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell peanut paste, lemon juice and palm oil

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: VIRGEN D. FATIMA  se encuentra situado en el B/ 24  D. SEPTIEMBRE. El grupo  esta en su 3° ciclo.Esta compuesto por 16 personas. En el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. cosmeticos ,comida ,abarrote y venta D. ropa , mermeladas.  son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos, las reuniones del grupo se llevan acabo los dias jueves  a horas15:30 PM en la casa D. la señora Tesorera .Ruth Negri Rodriguez  A .Las Sra:estan conformes D. trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, ademas que comparten entre ellas.
La Sra Delicia V. M. es Presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 ciclos D. antiguedad como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento.La Sra Delicia nacio el 11 D. Junio  D. 1973 en el Beni .Ella se dedica al rubro D. venta D. cosmeticos ,tambien se dedica a los   tejidos D. carteras ,bolsos,monederos ,ect. Es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas.La Sra Delicia con los ingrersos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su hogar, ella tiene dos hijos pequeños, que estudian en el nivel primario .
texts.en:
The "Virgen D. Fatima" entrepreneurial bank is in its third cycle, and consists of 16 people. The group includes women who sell cosmetics, food, groceries, clothing and jams. These activities require quick credit. The group meetings take place on Thursdays at 3:30 PM in the home of the treasurer, Ruth Negri Rodriguez. The partners are committed to working with Emprender; they have learned to save and they have a lot of responsibility, which they share with each other. Delicia V. M. is the president of the group, and has been for three cycles. Delicia was born June 11, 1973 in Beni. She works selling cosmetics, as well as fabric wallets, handbags, purses, etc. She is very responsible and accomplished in the group. She is also one of the leaders of the group and ensures that everyone makes their payments. Delicia helps sustain her family with her income--she has two small children in primary school.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and piola for macrame

loans.name: Sedenko

texts.fr: Née en 1943 à Havé Doumé dans la Zio au Sud du Togo, Mme Sedenko A. est une femme veuve et mère de six (06) enfants. Elle a comme activité la vente de produits de premières nécessités et de produits vivriers. Cette activité lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge et de faire face à certains besoins de sa famille. Toutefois, elle est confrontée à un manque crucial de fonds de base. Elle est dans l’incapacité de renouveler son stock régulièrement. Pour y remédier, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de constituer un stock suffisant de marchandises afin satisfaire ses clients et dégager de bénéfices importants.
texts.en:
Born in 1943 in Havé Doumé in Zio in the South of Togo, Mrs. Sedenko A. is a widow and mother of six children. She sells staple goods and foodstuffs. This allows her to make enough money to support herself and some of her family's needs. However she is faced with a critical lack of funds and is unable to renew her stock regularly. To solve this, she is asking for a loan which will allow her to restock enough merchandise to satisfy her customers and make sustantial profits.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple goods and foodstuffs to retail

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes N. started her trading business thirty-five years ago in Dome, a suburb of Mampong where she lives. Agnes prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality smoked fish, and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She also sells fresh vegetables like carrots, green peppers, onions, etc. on a table in the community. She is now 50 years old and married with ten children. Four are currently in school. Her husband is a farmer. She has not had enough funds to make progress with her business. She would like to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fishes and vegetables to create increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. She hopes to receive 900 GHS to improve her business by restocking her inventory. Agnes belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa,’ which means ‘Pray for Life’.

loans.use: To buy more fish and vegetables

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora tiene la venta D. artesanias (ropas, plata, joyas etc),  en zona turística D. San Francisco D. la ciudad D. La Paz, hace 15 años, trabaja D. lunes a domingo, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, es separada por lo tanto es la unica que trabaja para los gastos familiares ya que el esposo no le ayuda en ningún gasto, es cliente D. nuestra institución hace bastante tiempo demostrando puntualidad en sus créditos, viven en alquiler en unos cuartos en la misma zona con sus tres niños.
texts.en:
Ms. Teodora sells crafts (clothing, silver, jewelry etc.) in the tourist area of San Francisco in the city of La Paz and has for 15 years. She works from Monday to Sunday, has 3 school-age children, is separated and consequently is the only one working to proviD. for the family expenses because her husband does not help her with any expense. She is a client of our institution and has for some time demonstrated punctuality in her loans. She lives in rented rooms in the same area with her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the rent for her business

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric F. is 33 years old, married, and a father with two children. His children are in school.  Eric has sold frozen foods in the local market in Dome for 2 years now. He is very supportive at home, especially in the upbringing of his children. 

However, he says income from the business is very low because he pays high rent on the store he operates from and the electricity cost is also high as he shares his power with another shop nearby. He would like to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable him to raise enough income to build a permanent store for himself. He also wants the loan to buy items to stock his inventory before the Easter season. Eric belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa,’ which means ‘Pray for Life’. He hopes to receive 800 GHS to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy frozen foods

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame N. is 46 years old. He is married and has four children, one male and three females. He says all of them are still in school: senior high, junior high and primary school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers in this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, good for farming.
Kwame is into the business of selling soft drinks. He owns a drinking spot in his community where he sells the soft drinks. He has, in stock, soft drinks such as Coke, Fanta, Sprite, etc. Kwame buys from the distributors who supply him in their vans. He has run this business for 15 years and wants a loan to procure crates of soft drinks in bulk. It is his dream to support his children in school.

loans.use: To procure crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mme Awa O. est née le 15 décembre 1969. Elle est mariée et est mère de sept (07) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de piment rouge séché. C’est un des ingrédients très utilisé et bien apprécié dans l’art culinaire chez nous. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour stocker en quantité importante du piment séché pendant la période d’abondance et le revendre en temps de soudure (saison des pluies où le ravitaillement devient très difficile). Les revenus de cette vente serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa O. was born on December 15, 1969. She is married and the mother of seven. Her main work involves selling dried red chili peppers. This is one of the much used and highly appreciated ingredients in the culinary arts where we live. She's therefore requesting financing to stock a sizable quantity of dried chilis when abundant and to resell them when scare (the rainy season, when restocking becomes difficult). The income from her sales will be used to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell dried red chili peppers

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина работает в собственном свадебном салоне. Ей исполнилось 35 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж на заработках в России. Работа в салоне интересная, так как каждый день встречаешься с различными людьми, при этом когда наряжаешь невесту – это доставляет особое удовольствие. Парвина не имеет специального образования, но приобрела профессионализм от каждодневной работы. Парвина ранее нигде не кредитовалась, но недавно узнала про Микроинвест и решила получить свой первый займ. Она собирается добавить в свою коллекцию новые свадебные платья.
texts.en:
Parvina works at, and is the owner of, a wedding salon. She's 35, married, and has three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She finds her work in the salon interesting, as every day she meets with different people, and working with brides gives her particular pleasure. Parvina does not have a specialized education, but acquired a professional sense from her work. Before, Parvina never took out a loan; however, she recently heard about Microinvest, and decided to take out her first loan. She intends to add new wedding gowns to her collection.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of new wedding gowns

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina F. is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of nine children. Currently, three of them attend the community basic school. Georgina believes in hard work and dedication, which is the secret of her success. She lives with her family at Dome, a suburb of Mampong, in the Ashanti region. She has owned and operated a local restaurant and sold local foods like banku and abetie for the past ten years. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She needs the loan to enable her to inject more capital into her business so she can purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava dough, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She says the cost of raw materials is very high now. She also wants to save part of her proceeds to provide a better education for her children. Georgina belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Pray for Life’. She hopes to receive GH¢900 to make her business progress, by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer que en su vida ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante, a sus 50 años ha logrado tener su casa propia, en la cual vive sola, ya que nunca tuvo hijos con su pareja, D. la cual se divorció. Ella es una artesana muy hábil, utiliza la totora para crear piezas artesanales hermosas y llamativas, los cuales luego venD. a sus clientes a un buen precio, aunque no pudo terminar D. estudiar su primaria, por no contar con el dinero necesario, no se desanimó y siguió con sus planes D. tener una vida digna y conseguir las cosas que siempre soñó. Ha luchado mucho por forjarse una buena vida y sabe que todavía lo tiene que seguir haciendo, tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es que pueD. realizar diseños nuevos y creativos, lo cual hace que sus ventas mejoren, pero lo más difícil es realizarle los pequeños detalles a sus artesanías, para que se vean más bonitas. En el fututo espera tener una tienda donD. pueda vender sus artesanías con mayor comodidad y tranquilidad. Es el primer préstamo D. Maria con MFP y está muy feliz D. la oportunidad, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre tiene un concejo para dar a las demás socias. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más lana, alambres, adornitos, pintura, etc, para mejorar los diseños y la calidad D. sus piezas artesanales.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who has worked hard in her life to get ahead. At 50, she has managed to have her own house. She lives by herself since she never had children with her ex-husband, who she divorced. She is an adept artisan and utilizes the bulrush (a wetland plant) to create beautiful and striking artisanal pieces, which she sells to her customers at a good price. Although she did not finish primary education due to the lack of necessary funds, she was not discouraged. She followed her plans to have a dignified life and to continue with the things she has always dreamed of doing. She has fought hard to forge a good life. She knows that she still needs to continue making jewelry. She has spent 20 years in this business. What she likes the most is that she can make new, creative designs which result in improved sales. What she finds the most difficult is to make the small details to her pieces to make them more beautiful. In the future, she dreams of having her own store where she can sell her pieces with the most comfort and tranquility. It is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy for this opportunity. She understands that she must pay the loan on time and is determined to do so. The communal bank is very beloved, as it always provides council for the other members. With the money she requests, she will buy more wool, wire, ornaments, paint, etc. to improve her designs and the quality of her artisanal pieces.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her artisanal pieces

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis A. is 33 years old. He is married and has two boys. He says both of them are still in school; one is in senior high school and the other is in junior high school. He lives with his wife, a trader, and their children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Hweakwae in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers in this community is farming. The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, good for farming. Francis produces palm oil for sale. He procures palm fruits from nearby farms and from his community to prepare the oil. He distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. He has been in business and wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that he can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to his increasing number of customers. Francis aspires to sponsor his sons to make it to the university.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha D. started her fish sales 26 years ago in Dome, a suburb of Mampong, where she lives. Martha prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 40 years old and married with four children who are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of various fish to increase sales and income to support her children's education and grow the business. She mostly travels to Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region to purchase her dried and smoked fish in bulk. She would be grateful for the assistance. Martha belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Pray for Life’. She hopes to receive GH¢600 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 27 años, es una madre soltera muy dedicada a sus hijos; Ana de 10 y Aníbal de 6, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es darles una buena educación a sus queridos niños. Eligió ejercer la actividad de su familia, que es la crianza de truchas, desde muy temprano en la mañana rema a través del lago Titicaca, para llegar hasta sus jaulas, donde se encuentran las truchas en espera de ser alimentadas. A Sonia le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disfrutar de los hermosos paisajes que se forman en el lago, espera poder incrementar el número de jaulas que tiene, ya que actualmente no le son suficientes para cubrir la demanda de trucha que le llega. Lleva 12 años en este negocio y lo que menos le gusta es que hay días, en que el clima es muy frío para ir a alimentar a sus truchas, pero igual tiene que hacerlo, porque sabe que la economía familiar depende de la buena producción de truchas que tengan. Este el primer préstamo de Sonia con MFP y planea pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy participativa y querida. Con la cantidad que solicita ampliará sus criaderos de truchas para que pueda tener una mayor cantidad y con el resto de dinero comprará más comida para sus peces.
texts.en:
Sonia is 27 years old, and is a single mother who is very dedicated to her children, Ana (10), and Aníbal (6). She lives with them in her own home and what she wants more than anything is to give them a good education.

She chose to perform her work, which is to raise trout, in the early morning, when she travels to the cages she has in Lake Titicaca where the trout are waiting to be fed. Sonia likes her work very much, as she enjoys the beautiful scenery formed by the lake. She hopes she can increase the number of cages she has, as currently they are not enough to keep up with the demand that she has encountered. She has been in this business for 12 years, and what she likes least about it is that there are days when it is very cold when she goes out to feed the trout, but she knows she still must do it, because her family's income depends on the production of her trout.

This is Sonia's first loan with MFP (a Kiva Partner), and she plans to pay back all of her installments on time, as she does not want to jeopardize the members of her communal bank, with which she is very involved and invested. With the loan she seeks, she will increase the number of fisheries she has so she can have a larger number of trout, and with the rest of the money from the loan, she will buy more food for her fish.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of trout cages

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is 32 years old, married and the mother of four children who are in school. She has been a food vendor for two years. She prepares and sells kenkey (a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups). It is a delicacy many Ghanaian enjoy every day as breakfast, lunch or dinner. She sells at the main business center in Dome. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operation to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to purchase more maize grains, vegetables, rice and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family's well-being. She would be very grateful for the assistance. Her photo was taken when we visited her. Agnes belongs to a village bank called
 ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Pray for Life’. She hopes to receive GH¢600 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Née en 1968 au GHANA, Mme Mariam O. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Avec son petit commerce des produits de premières nécessités qui lui réussissent bien grâce à son dynamisme et sa bonne gestion, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en grande quantité en marchandises. Les bénéfices lui serviront à mieux s’occuper de sa famille et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1968 in GHANA, Ms. Mariam O. is married and the mother of five. With her small-scale commerce in staple goods, which is successful, thanks to her energy and good management, she's requesting financing to acquire large quantities of merchandise. The profits will be used to take care of her family better and to ensure her children's education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell essential goods

loans.name: Baffour Kwasi

texts.en: Baffour Kwasi Tuffuor is 21 years old. He is single and loves work. He is in his final year of senior high school and he is writing his mock exams. He has been a general photographer for the past five years. He is reading general Arts in school and next month he will be taking his final exams. He owns a photography and video shop called ‘Cobby’s photo’ where his clients pose for their photographs. He also goes to occasions like parties and concerts to take photographs of his clients. He is requesting a loan to buy additional tools and materials like a camera, flash, video camera etc. to expand his operations. He belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Pray for Life’. He hopes to receive GH¢800 to make his business progress.

loans.use: To buy additional tools and materials like a camera, flash, video camera, glass etc.

loans.name: Comite De Sante Cite Niakh Group

texts.fr: Le Comite de Sante Cite Niakh est un groupe de médecins qui a une pharmacie.  Avec ce crédit ils vont acheter des produits pharmaceutiques pour le poste de sante de cité Niakh.  Les médicaments sont vendus à moindre cout pour aider les pauvres.  Ce crédit est le troisième qu’ils ont reçu et ils ont bien rembourse tous les autres.
texts.en:
"Comite de Sante Cite Niakh" is a group of doctors who have a pharmacy. With this loan, they will buy pharmaceutical products for the health station of Cite Niakh. The medicines are sold at low cost in order to help the poor. This loan is the third one they've received, and they've repaid all the other loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha B. is 56 years old. She is divorced and the mother of seven kids. Two are currently in school. She operates a shop and sells women's items like blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags. She has been selling in the various communities during their market days. Agatha sometimes sells through hawking and has been trading for the past 2 years. It is her desire to provide quality education for the children to secure them a better future.

Agatha is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. Agatha belongs to a village bank called "Naomi." She hopes to receive $575 (800 GHS) to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase women's items like blouses and skirts, slippers and dressing bags.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Agée de trente sept (37) ans, Mme Akou D. est née à Dalavé où elle pratique la culture maraîchère (légumineuses). Compte tenu de la demande de plus en plus importe, elle sollicite un financement pour élargir sa surface cultivable pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle pourra mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thirty-seven years of age, Mrs. Akou D. was born in Dalavé where she grows vegetables. Because she is faced with greater and greater demand, she is asking for a loan to expand the area she has under cultivation in order to satisfy her customers. In this way she will be better able to support her family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow more vegetables

loans.name: Boko

texts.fr: Mr Boko A. est né en 1938 à Atakpamé. Marié et père de onze enfants. Agriculteur depuis très longtemps, il est bien connu dans sa localité pour la qualité de ses produits champêtres notamment la culture du haricot. Afin d’agrandir son champ et augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un financement. Les profits tirés de ses activités lui permettront d’améliorer sa situation sociale et celle de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Boko A. was born in 1938 at Atakpamé. Married and father of 11 children. Farmer for a very long time, he is well known in his area for the quality of his produce, notably for his beans. To increase his arable land adn increase his revenue, he is asking for a loan. Profits from his activity will enable him to improve his social situation and that of all his family.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow beans

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilda López C., hace tres años decide abrir una librería con la ayuda del esposo en la zona de Chasquipampa, iniciando con material escolar básico, la librería se encuentra ubicada al lado de un colegio y frente a otro colegio de la zona, es así como llega a tener un gran crecimiento de mercadería, de clientes y un movimiento en época de clases continuo. 
Tiene la ambición de adquirir otro local a futuro donde tenga mas espacio y logre ofrecer una gran gama de productos escolares.
Junto a su esposo son personas muy trabajadoras y muestran seriedad en las funciones que realizan demostrando capacidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Three years ago, Hilda López C. decided to open a book store, with the help of her husband, in the Chasquipampa zone. They began by selling basic school books. The store is located next to a school and across from another school in the zone, so Hilda has been able to grow her merchandise and customers, and during the school season, this trend continues.

She hopes to acquire another location in the future so that she can have more space and offer a wider range of school products. Both she and her husband are very hardworking people, and they take their jobs seriously and execute them with skill.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bookstore

loans.name: Kwami Apélété

texts.fr: Monsieur  G. kwami apélété  réside le quartier d’adidogomé, il est   célibataire, il exerce comme activité la vente de perches, claie et poteaux, il fait ce commerce depuis 2006 au marché local d’adidogomé, il s’approvisionne à tsévié. Voulant rehausser son stock  il sollicite  un crédit auprès de wages  pour acheter la claie, des perches et des poteaux afin de pouvoir mieux vendre et satisfaire sa clientèle. cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et d'aider certains membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr G. kwami apélété lives in the neighborhood of d’adidogomé. He is single and his main activity is to sell poles, racks and posts. He is in this business since 2006 in the local market of adidogomé, and gets his supplies at tsévié. In order to replenish his stock, he is asking for a loan from Wages to buy poles. racks and posts in order to better sell and satisfy his clients. This activity enables his to better meet his needs and to help his family members.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poles, racks and posts

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel  inició el negocio ya que  era empleado de un taller mecánico, tenía varios años trabajando allí y su sueldo era muy bajo, y su familia iba creciendo, así que se decidío a poner su propio negocio. Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1987, fue gracias a un primo le ofreció en venta un carrito para la elaboración de Hot-Dogs y se lo compro. Desde el primer día le empezó a ir muy bien y actualmente tiene tres carritos, su hija mayor se encargaba de uno y el se encargaba de otro. Actualmente ya vende solo los fines de semana ya que entre semana se esta dedicando a la venta de productos  naturistas y sale a poblados cercanos a repartir.
 

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para comprar materia prima lo que le va a servir para comprar materia prima y desechables para poder seguir elaborando hot-dogs y hamburguesas y darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes teniendo todos los ingredientes necesarios.
texts.en:
Daniel began his business while he was employed in a mechanic's shop. He had been working there many years and his pay was very low and his family was growing. So he decided to open his own business. He began the business in March of 1987, thanks to his cousin who offered to sell his Hot Dog cart. From the very beginning, it went well, and currently Daniel has three carts. His oldest daughter is in charge of one, and he takes care of the others. He currently only sells during the weekends, as during the week he sells natural products in nearby towns. He needs this loan for MXN 4000, which he will repay in 10 installments, to buy raw materials and disposable products so that he can continue to sell his Hot Dogs and hamburgers and in order to give better service to his customers by having all the necessary ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben  inició el negocio porqué quería independizarse y tener su propio negocio y no estar asalariado, ya que en ese tiempo estaba proximo a casarse y como la familia comenzó a crecer, también los gastos se fueron haciendo cada vez más grandes. 
Comenzó el negocio en el año de 1981 empezo  a trabajar en la venta de artículos para el hogar desde muy joven como ayudante de un hermano que era vendedor ambulante, pero después, a partir del año de 1981 fue cuando se independizo e inicio su propio negocio y le empezó a ir muy bien, lo cual le permitió adquirir una camioneta donde actualmente transporta sus productos.

Poco a poco comenzò a extenderse a poblados cercanos, lo cual le permitió aumentar el número de sus clientes y así también aumentar sus ganancias.

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar más artículos para el hogar y tener una mejor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ruben started the business because he wanted to become independent and to have his own business and not be an employee, given that at this time, he was about to get married and as the family started to grow, the expenses were also getting bigger and bigger .He started the business in 1981. He started to work in selling merchandise for the home since he was very young, as assistant for his brother who was a street vendor. But latter, since 1981, he started his own business and things started to go really well, which enabled him to get a truck where he currently transports his products. Little by little, he started to expand to nearby towns, which enabled him to increase his client base, and also his revenues. He needs a loan for MXN $4,000 which he will pay in 10 installments to buy more merchandise for the home and to have more variety to offer his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Somialo

texts.fr: Née le 30 mai 1975 à Adjengré, Mme Somialo A. est marée et a trois personnes à charge. N’ayant pas en la chance d’aller à l’école, faute de moyen financier, elle entreprit le petit commerce de vente de sandalettes devant sa devanture. Très soucieuse de son avenir, elle sollicite un financement pour ouvrir une boutique et mieux s’installer. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter son revenu et veiller à la survie de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on May 30, 1975 in Adjengré, Mrs Somialo A. is married and responsible for 3 people. Not having had the chance to go to school, given a lack of financial means, she started a small business to sell sandals on her stand. Very mindful of her future, she is asking for a loan to open a shop and establish herself better. She will therefore be able to increase her revenue and ensure the survival of all her family.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sell shoes

loans.name: Matlubahon

texts.ru: Матлубахон не имеет постоянной работы. Ей 52 года, воспитала 2 детей. Муж работает, но зарабатываемых денег недостаточно для полноценной жизни. У Матлубахон есть швейная машинка и поэтому она принимает заказы на шитье национальных платьев. Шитье одного платья стоит от 10 до 50 сомони (3-15$), и если есть постоянные заказы, то можно хорошо заработать. Матлубахон старается шить качественно, чтобы привлечь и удержать постоянных клиентов. Сейчас ближе к весне наступает сезон праздников и свадебных мероприятий и Матлубахон собирается закупить ткани и фурнитуру. Для этого она обратилась в Микроинвест за получением займа.
texts.en:
Matlubahon doesn't have steady work. She is 52 and raised two children. Her husband works, but doesn't earn enough to support the family. Matlubahon has a sewing machine and therefore takes orders to sew national dresses. Sewing one dress costs about 10-50 somoni (US $3-15), and if she has regular orders, she can make good money. Matlubahon aims to do quality work, so that she can attract and maintain a steady clientele. Now, as spring draws near, and the season for holidays and weddings begins, Matlubahon seeks to stock up on cloth and accessories. To do so, she has come to Microinvest with a request for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: acquisition of cloth and accessories

loans.name: Efio

texts.fr: Mme Efio B. est née en 1938 à Agoè. Mariée, mais devenue veuve depuis quelques années, elle a du mal à joindre les deux bouts. Malgré son âge un peu avancé, elle est toujours courageuse et très dynamique. Elle entreprend de faire du petit commerce de produits alimentaires (tomate, piment, gombo, aïl, poisson, banane) mais manque cruellement de fond. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour redémarrer son commerce et s’approvisionner régulièrement. Avec les bénéfices, elle assura sa survie et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs Efio B. was born in 1938 at Agoè. Married, but widow since a few years ago, she is having trouble making ends meet. Despite her age, she is still courageous and dynamic. She intends to have a small business of food products (tomatoes, hot peppers, gombo, garlic, fish, banana) but is desperately in need of funds. She is therefore asking for a loan to start her business and to replenish the stock regularly. With the benefits, she will ensure her survival and improve her living condition.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling food products

loans.name: Manzalo

texts.fr: Mme Manzalo A. est née en 1943 à Lassa Lawou. Elle est marée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes en charge. Son commerce de céréales (maïs, haricot) lui réussit très bien. Etant de plus en plus recherchée par sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement pour disposer d’un stock considérable et satisfaire constamment ses clients. Les bénéficies tirés de ce commerce lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Manzalo A. was born in 1943 at Lassa Lawou. She is married and the mother of five (5) children and taking care of two (2) other people. Her cereals business (corn, beans) is going very well. Being more and more turned to by her clients. she is asking for a loan to have a considerable inventory and to satisfy her clients on an on-going basis. The benefits from this business will enable her to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling cereals

loans.name: Têko

texts.fr: Né en 1954 à Anfoin, Mr Têko A. est marié et est père de huit (08) enfants. C'est un agriculteur très réputé dans sa localité, il a toujours fait preuve de bravoure et courage. Très déterminé, il sollicite un financement pour agrandir sa surface cultivable, acheter des fertilisants et assister sa femme dans son commerce de vente de farine de manioc (gari). Les revenus permettront à cette famille de mieux faire face aux charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Anfoin, Mr Têko A. is married and the father of eight (8) children. He is a farmer with a high reputation in his area, and has always shown courage and determination. Very determined, he is asking for a loan to increase his arable land, buy fertilizer, and assist his wife in her business of sale of manioc (gari). The revenues will enable this family to better meet the needs of the household.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land, fertilizer, and manioc

loans.name: Vianey

texts.es:
Vianey  inició el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado las ventas, desde muy chica vendía Avon, luego se caso y siguío vendiendo actualmente tiene muchas actividades comerciales, ahora hasta una miscelánea. Comenzó el negocio en mayo del 2006 cuando una comadre de su mama la invito a vender por catalogo productos cosmeticos, hace muchos años, después se caso y dejo de hacerlo, pero la volvieron a invitar ahora de forma directa y en este momento es distribuidora.


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 6 catorcenas para  comprar  mercancía, también tiene pendiente un pedido de zapatos que tiene que sacar de la compañía distribuidora para seguir con el comercio.
texts.en:
Vianey started his business given that he always liked selling. Since he was very young he sold Avon. Then he got married and continued to sell. He currently has many commercial activities with a wide variety. She started the business in May 2006, when a friend of her mom invited her to sell cosmetic products through a catalog, many years ago. She then got married and stopped doing it, but she was invited again to do it directly and she is now a ditributor. She needs a loan for MXN $3,000 that she will pay in 6 installments to buy merchandise. She also has a pending order of shoes that she needs to get from the distributing company in order to continue with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Padawo

texts.fr: Agée d’une quarantaine d’année, Mme Padawo P. est mariée et est mère de sept (07) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de charbon de bois qu’elle achète de l’intérieur du pays et le revend à Lomé, elle sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices tirés de ce commerce serviront à l’éducation des enfants et à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
About 40 years old, Mrs Padawo P. is married and the mother of seven (7) children. Her main activity is to sell charcoal, which she buys in country and sells in Lomé. She is asking for a loan. The benefits from the loan will help finance the education of her children and to improve the living conditions of the family.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sell charcoal

loans.name: Franck Koévi

texts.fr: Né en 1966 à Anfoin, Mr Franck Koévi D. – A. est marié et à en charge cinq (05) personnes. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école faute de soutien et de moyens financiers, il s’est lancé dans l’exploitation et la vente de graviers utilisés dans la construction des maisons. Afin de mieux rentabiliser son commerce, il sollicite un financement pour assurer un ravitaillement constant et satisfaire ses fidèles clients. Les profits tirés l’aideront à couvrir les charges de famille et améliorer les conditions de vie de l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Anfoin, Mr Franck Koévi D. – A. is married and responsible for five (5) people. Not having has the chance to go to school given a lack of financial means, he got into the business of mining and selling gravel needed in the construction of houses. In order to better increase the profitability of his business, he is asking for a loan to ensure a constant supply and satisfy his clients. The profits from the sales will help him cover the family costs and improve teh living conditions and the education of the children.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mining and sales of gravel

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Муяссар 26 лет, она замужем, имеет 2 детей. Работает в местном колхозе. Муж подрабатывает на разных работах. В дополнение к своей заработной плате Муяссар содержит дома домашний скот. В этом ей помогает ее свекровь (на фото). Каждую весну она получает от своих коров приплод, который и является ее доходом от животноводства. Чтобы увеличить количество скота она решила обратиться в Микроинвест. На полученный займ собирается купить корову.
texts.en:
Muyassar is 26, married, and has two children. She works at the local collective farm. Her husband takes on odd jobs to supplement the family income. Muyassar supplements her income by raising domestic cattle at home. Her mother-in-law (in the photo) helps her out. Every spring, she gets cows and makes money from raising their offspring. To increase the number of cattle, she decided to get a loan from Microinvest to buy a cow.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow cassava and corn

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Née en 1985 à Hahotoé, Mme Yawa N. est mariée avec trois (03) personnes en charge. Par faute de soutien financier, elle a vite abandonné les études pour se consacrer à l’agriculture (légume, maïs). Afin d’augmenter son revenu, elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir sa surface cultivable et acheter des intrants. Avec les revenus de son activité elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Hahotoé, Yawa N. is married and has three dependents. Due to a lack of money, she left school early to farm vegetables and corn. In order to increase her revenues, she is asking for a loan to increase the area she has under cultivation and to buy inputs. With the revenues from her farming she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and take better care of herself.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil inputs and increase the area she has under cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Poultry raising

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Mme Philomène K. est née le 18 mars 1967 à Sotouboua où elle exerce le commerce de légumineuse (adémè, gombo, épinard, aubergine, piment vert). Avec quatre (04) personnes en charge, elle est la seule à faire face aux charges du ménage. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour renforcer son commerce afin de mieux subvenir aux charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Ms. Philomène K. was born on March 18, 1967 in Sotouboua, where she does commerce in vegetables: adémè (a local leafy green), okra, spinach, eggplants, and green chili peppers. With four people to support, she is the only one coping with household expenses. She's therefore requesting financing to bolster her business, so as to provide for her household better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell vegetables

loans.name: Manzalo

texts.fr: Née en 1964 à Kara, Mme Manzalo N. est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce de vente de chaussure (sandalettes). Elle veut augmenter son chiffre d’affaire mais manque cruellement de fonds de base. Elle sollicite un financement pour renouveler son stock de marchandises afin d’attirer plus de clientèles. Les revenus tirés de son commerce serviront à soulager les charges de la famille et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Kara, Ms. Manzalo N. is married and the mother of seven. Her main work involves selling shoes (flip-flop sandals). She wants to increase her sales figures but is terribly short of working capital. She's requesting financing in order to renew her stock of merchandise, so as to attract more customers. The income derived from her commerce will be used to alleviate the burden of family expenses and to improve the family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mamata

texts.fr: F. mamata est une femme mariée et qui a 02 enfants, elle réside dans le quartier de kégué et exerce comme activité le commerce de friperie et de tissus traditionnels. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer aux charges de sa famille. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 1993 et en a une parfaite maîtrise. Son stock étant épuisé elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 25 tissus traditionnels et un balle de friperie.
texts.en:
F. Mamata is a married woman with two children. She lives in the neighbourhood of Kégué and sells second-hand clothing as well as traditional clothes. This business allows her to contribute to the household expenses. She has been in this line of business since 1993 and has mastered it. Because her stock has run out, she is asking WAGES for a loan to restock with 25 lengths of traditional cloths and one bale of second-hand clothing.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Djaharatou

texts.fr: Madame S. exerce comme activité le commerce de bijoux, ce commerce est très rentable et est pratiqué par beaucoup de femmes à Lomé, elle a commencé à faire ce commerce en 2007, et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et aussi à Cotonou parce que dans ce pays certains bijoux sont chers. Voulant agrandir son commerce elle sollicite au près de WAGES un premier prêt en vue de s’acheter des bijoux. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, son mari est un revendeur et avec ce qu’elle gagne dans son activité elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
S. sells jewelry, a very profitable business which many women are involved in in Lomé. She started in this business in 2007 and gets her stock from the main market of Lomé as well as from Cotonou because in this country some jewelry items are expensive. Wanting to grow her business, she is asking WAGES for this, her first loan, in order to buy jewelry. She is married and the mother of three children; her husband is a merchant and with the money she makes from her business she helps her husband pay the household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different types of jewelry

loans.name: Modjévi

texts.fr: Madame W. modjévi et une femme mariée et a 03 enfants, elle réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè assiyéyé, son mari est un retraité. Cette dame exerce comme activité  la vente de tissus, elle a associé à cela la vente des objets de piété. Avec le revenu de son activité elle contribue énormément aux charges de sa famille. Actuellement elle est en rupture de stock, elle demande un crédit afin d’acheter de l’encens, de l’huile sainte et des tissus.
texts.en:
Modjévi W. is a married woman who has three children. She lives with her family in the neighbourhood of Agoè Assiyéyé. Her husband is retired. She sells cloth as well as selling religious objects. Thanks to the revenues from her business she makes an enormous contribution to paying the household expenses. She is currently out of stock and is asking for this loan in order to buy incense, holy oil and cloth.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, holy oil and incense

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es: Coralia R. de 39 años de edad reside en la colonia San José en el departamento de Ahuachapán, junto a su madre de edad muy avanzada. Ella trabaja en su propia pupusería en donde vende café, chocolate para beber, sodas y pupusas (estas ultimas son un platillo muy típico salvadoreño, el cuál es muy parecido a una tortilla, la cual esta hecha de maza de maíz revuelta con queso, frijoles y chicharrón). Dicha pupusería esta ubicada frente al Seguro Social de Ahuachapán, Coralia tiene la suerte de tener muchos clientes, ya que su negocio esta ubicado muy cerca de la terminal de buses. Coralia es conocida por ser una mujer muy dedicada, responsable, la cuál pone todas sus ganas a su trabajo, ya que ella es la única que trabaja en su hogar y debe obtener el dinero necesario para sustentar las necesidades de su madre y de ella misma. Es por esto que Coralia solicita un préstamo a través del cuál logre invertir más en su negocio y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Coralia R. is 39 years old and resides in the San José neighborhood in the department of Ahuachapán, together with her elderly mother. She works in her own restaurant that specializes in pupusas where she sells coffee, chocolate for drinking, sodas and pupusas (the latter is a very typical Salvadoran dish, which is very similar to a tortilla, made from corn dough with cheese, beans and fried pork rinds). This pupusería is located in front of the Social Security building of Ahuachapan. Coralia is fortunate to have many customers because her business is located near the bus terminal. Coralia is known for being a very dedicated and responsible woman who gives her all to her work since she is the only one who works in her home and she should get the money needed to sustain the needs of her mother and herself. This is why Coralia is applying for a loan through which she can invest more in her business and obtain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business productivity

location.town: Colonia San José, departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El sr. Walter es un cliente antiguo de la institución, muy responsable y puntual, trabaja con movilidad desde que era muy joven, sus hijas le colaboran con los gastos de la casa, y él esta al pendiente de su sra. Madre. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un motor con caja 5ª, para mejorar su herramienta de trabajo. El Sr. es propietario de casa en vila Litoral una popular zona de la Ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Walter is a long-time client of the institution, very responsible and punctual. He's worked in transportation since he was very young, and his daughters help him with household expenses. He also takes care of his mother. He will invest the loan in the purchase of a motor to improve his work vehicle. He owns a house in Villa Litoral, a popular area of the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: DIVINO NIÑO  fue fundado el 10 D. Noviembre del 2008, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras .El grupo  esta en su 2° cilco, compuesto por 10 personas,como presidenta tenemos a la señora Alejandra M. S. , tesorera Maria del carmen F. D. J. D. secretaria, Maria C. A.. En el grupo Divino Niño hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. cosmeticos ,comida ,abarrote,ropa y artesanias . Son actividades que nesecitan creditos rapidos, las reuniones del grupo se llevaran  acabo los dias Viernes   a horas15:30 PM en la casa D. la señora Alejandra M. .
La Sra Alejandra M. S. es Presidenta del grupo, tiene 2 ciclos D. antiguedad como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento.La Sra Alejandra  nacio el 11 D. Agosto   D. 1978 en Santa Cruz  D. la Sierra. Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida y a labores D. casa. Es una persona cumplida y responsable,ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas.La Sra Maria  C. A.  ella es la secretaria del grupo,se dedica a la venta D. perfumes en la cual desempeña la funcion D. directora dentro D. Yanbal ,ella nacio el 25 D. septiembre  D. 1971 en el departamento D. Chuquisaca.  tiene 3 años D. antigüedad  en el rubro , trabaja 5 dias a la semana y 8 horas al dia ,su trabajo es mayormente  es atender a la gente . La Sra es fundadora  en el grupo.
texts.en:
Lending Institution: Divino Niño was founded on November 10, 2008 by a group of women. The group is in its second loan cycle. The group is maD. up of 10 people, and its officers are: President Alejandra M. S.; Treasurer María del Carmen F. D. J.; and Secretary María C. A.. Within the group's membership are women who sell cosmetics, food, groceries, and clothing, as well as artisans. These are all activities that require quick access to capital. The group's meetings occur every Friday at 3:30 pm in Mrs. Alejandra M.'s home.

Mrs. Alejandra M. S. is the group's President, and has been for two loan cycles. She was born August 11, 1978 in Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. She sells clothing and takes care of her home. She is a very responsible and punctual woman, and as one of the group's leaders, makes sure everyone makes their loan payments on time.

Mrs. Maria C. A. is the group's secretary, and sells perfumes, carrying out the duties as director insiD. of Yanbal. She was born September 25, 1971 in the department of Chuquisaca. She has been at this for three years, works 8 hours a day 5 days a week, and her job consists mainly of taking care of customers. She is also the group's founder.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for her store (rice, noodles, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de un plato típico de su zona, conocido como lechón, que es cerdo al horno, y para ello recorre las principales calles de su localidad y eventos festivos, muchas veces en compañía de sus hijos, que la ayudan a vender este exquisito plato, preferentemente en las mañanas. Lo que le gusta a Elvia de su trabajo es que también puede apreciar los parajes y las actuaciones que hay durante las celebraciones, lo que no le agrada es el clima lluvioso porque le impide trabajar cómodamente, pese a esto, seguirá vendiendo este plato porque le es muy rentable, tiene mucha demanda, por lo que está pensando aumentar sus ventas. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las más activas de su banco comunal, pues siempre gusta de ser la que impulsa la organización de su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de más cerdos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Elvia is 35 years old and lives with her two children in her own house. She sells a dish typical of her region known as "lechón", which is baked pork. She sells in the main streets of her town and at holiday events, often in the company of her children, who help her sell this exquisite dish, preferably in the mornings.

What Elvia enjoys about her work is that she can enjoy the places in which these festive events take place, and the activities that go along with the celebrations. What she doesn't like so much is the rainy weather because it makes it difficult for her to work. In spite of this, she'll continue selling lechón because it is very profitable for her and it is in great demand, so she is thinking about increasing her sales.

This is the fourth time she will get a loan with MFP, and she is one of the most active members of this communal bank. She likes to be the one who gets her group organized. The money that she asks for is to invest in the purchase of more pigs, and ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs to be able to cook more lechón

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia tiene 51 años, vive sola en su propia casa. Hace 20 años realiza viajes para vender productos alimenticios típicos de su zona (quesos y truchas) para llevarlos a otra ciudad. Viaja sola todos los fines de semana para llevar en sus baldes herméticos estos productos a los principales mercados de la ciudad capital y luego venderlos de manera ambulante. Trabajar de esta manera le permite a Eulogia tener los ingresos económicos para su sustento, y siempre obtiene las ganancias que ha planificado para la semana. Para el futuro desea tener en su casa una tienda de abarrotes y establecerse en su localidad con la venta de los alimentos. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es considerada como persona de confianza en el tema de los créditos y le gusta ser parte de un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal. Eulogia solicita esta cantidad de dinero para invertirlo en la compra de más productos alimenticios para potenciar su capital de trabajo, de esta manera tendrá más ganancias.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 51 years old and lives alone in her own home. For 20 years she has been travelling to other cities to sell foods typical of her region (cheeses and trout). She travels alone every weekend to the capital city with her products in airtight containers, so she can sell them in the main markets. Working this way permits Eulogia to have the income to support herself, and she always manages to earn what she expected to get through the week. In the future she wants to have a grocery store in her house, and establish herself in her neighborhood with grocery sales.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is considered a very trustworthy woman in regards to loans, and she likes to be part of the work in solidarity of her communal bank. Eulogia asks for this amount of money to invest it in the purchase of more products to improve her working capital, and this way will earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de alimentos precocidos en el mercado principal de su ciudad junto con a su hija que siempre la apoya en este negocio, lo viene haciendo desde hace más de 5 años y vende desde muy temprano en las mañanas hasta que agote su mercadería, diariamente durante todos los días de la semana. Jacinta disfruta de vender sus productos, porque generalmente vende todo lo que lleva, además le genera buenas ganancias. Lo malo de este negocio es que por ser ambulante e informal, en algunas oportunidades los policías municipales los expulsan y les quitan la mercadería por lo que Jacinta ha pensado seriamente en arrendar un puesto en el mercado.
