Es la tercera que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta por ser parte de su banco comunal porque ha encontrado buenas amigas. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de menestras por sacos, ya que son la materia prima para vender sus productos precosidos, comprará principalmente pallares, lentejas entre otros.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. She sells precooked foods in the main market in her city along with her daughter, who always helps her with her business. She has been working at this for more than 5 years, and begins selling very early in the morning until her merchandise is all gone, every day of the week.

Jacinta enjoys selling her products, because she almost always sells everything she brings with her and, besides, she earns quite a bit of money. The downside of this business is that, because it is on foot and informal, sometimes the municipal police kick her out of the market and take her merchandise. This is why Jacinta is thinking seriously about renting a more permanent stall in the market.

This is the third loan Jacinta will be getting with MFP, and she is very happy to be part of this communal bank because she has made good friends there. The money she is asking for is to invest in vegetables by the sack, because it is the primary ingredient in the precooked foods that she sells. She will mainly be purchasing butterbeans and lentil, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of principal ingredients for the food products she sells

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 18 años, vive con su esposo y su bebé. Se dedica a la venta de panes que elabora su esposo en un horno artesanal, este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace un año, sale muy temprano por la mañana a repartir los panes en las tiendas y bodegas de su barrio y lo que pueda quedar lo vende en una esquina de su casa, de esta manera garantiza los ingresos económicos para su familia. El trabajo es sacrificado porque su esposo elabora los panes durante la noche y ella siempre se levanta a las 4 de la madrugada para repartir, pese a ello, Lilia sabe que su negocio es rentable, porque el pan es un producto comestible que siempre se vende. Para el futuro Lilia y su esposo esperan aumentar su producción y expandir su mercado. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y la primera vez que lleva un trabajo en grupo con el banco comunal que actualmente integra, ella fue invitada a integrarse cuando el banco ya estaba formado, por ello se compromete a  ser activa en las actividades que realicen. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de harina y manteca en grandes para abastecerse de estos productos y prevenir pérdidas en caso del alza de precios.
texts.en:
Lilia is 18 years old, and lives with her husband and baby. She sells breads which her husband makes in an artisan oven. She has been doing this for about a year, and goes out very early in the morning to deliver the bread to the stores and markets in her neighborhood, and whatever is left over she sells on the corner of her street. This is how she makes sure her family has an income.

The works is a big sacrifice because her husband cooks the bread at night, and she always gets up at 4:00 in the morning to make the deliveries. In spite of this, she knows that the business is profitable, because everyone needs bread, and it always sells. In the future, Lilia and her husband hope to increase their production and expand their market. This is the first time she has asked for a loan with MFP, and the first time that she participates in a group that is currently forming in the communal bank. She was invited to join when the group was already formed, and she has promised to be an active member. The money that she is requesting is to buy sacks of flour and butter at wholesale, to be able to stock up on this produects and avoid losses in case prices rise.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of flour

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 27 años y vive en casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año brinda el servicio de taxi con un auto que alquila, trabaja durante todo el día para generarse sus propios ingresos, su trabajo consiste en brindar este servicio a cualquier ruta que le soliciten y de acuerdo a las distancias cobra. Miguel reconoce que se debe ser hábil en esta actividad para conseguir clientes y le agrada mucho conversar con ellos durante el viaje. Además, cada día puede ver las ganancias de su trabajo, lo que lo anima a continuar  en su esfuerzo para que en un futuro cercano tenga su propio carro que se convertirá en su propia herramienta de trabajo. Es la primera vez que Miguel está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ha sido invitado por uno de los miembros de su banco comunal y por consentimiento de todos fue admitido en el grupo porque conocen de su responsabilidad. La cantidad que requiere en este momento es para el mantenimiento del auto, que consistirá en el cambio de filtros y arreglo del ambiente interno.
texts.en:
Miguel is 27 years old and lives at home with his parents. He has been working as a taxi driver for one year now with a car that he rents. He works all day long to generate his own income. In his work, he provides service by whatever route his customers request and charges them based on the distance. Miguel recognizes that he has to be capable and smart in this work in order to get customers, and he appreciates that he has the chance to talk with his customers during the rides. What's more, every day he can see the results of his efforts in his income. This motivates him to continue working hard so that in the near future he'll be able to afford his own car instead of renting one. This is the first loan Miguel has requested with MFP. He has been invited to participate by one of the members of the communal bank and with the consent of all the members because they know he is a responsible person. He will use the loan to do maintenance on the car, including changing filters and fixing the interior.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do maintenance on his taxi and fix the interior

loans.name: Irma Concepcion

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Bancomunal Las Rosas del valle.
Irma es casada tiene 60 años, dos hijos que son mayores.
Irma desD. joven se dedico a coser aprendió empíricamente, por la necesidad económica que había en casa, pero con los años  lo dejo por su edad, y empezó hacer para vender chocolatería, triples los reparte por las tiendas por su barrio, también se dedica a la  venta artesanía D. trupan, los coloca en  las tiendas, ofrece a sus vecinas.
DesD. que está en Finca aprendió a ahorrar, recibió charlas que le han ayudado  a mejorar su negocio, le gusta el compañerismo que hay entre las socias del Bancomunal.
Irma necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, para comprar pinturas, pinceles, resinas, barnices.
El sueño D. Irma es poner una tienda bazar, para estar más tranquila, y no estar correteando D. casa en casa.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the communal bank called Las Rosas del Valle. She is 60 years old and has two grown up sons. From the time she was young, Irma has worked as a seamstress to earn income. But over the years as she got older, she stopped sewing and began sellling handicrafts to the local shops and to her neighbors. Since she has been working with the communal bank, she has learned how to save more money, receiving education that has helped her improve her business. She likes the comraderie between the members of the bank. Irma needs a loan to buy paints, resins, varnish and other materials needed to make her handicrafts. Her dream is to be able to set up a small shop so she can run her business without having to sell door to door.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paints, resin, varnishes and other materials needed to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Doris Amalia

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Bancomunal señor de los Milagros.
Doris es conviviente, tiene 21 años, tiene  dos hijos gemelos de 9 meses.
Doris termino el colegio y se puso a trabajar en una imprenta  por un año, le iba bien, pero salió embarazada,  su amiga le ofreció para que vendiera zapatos, que ella confecciona, entonces Doris vio la oportunidad que necesitaba y ahora se dedica a la venta de zapatos en su casa.  
Desde que está en Finca Doris aprendió a ser responsable, puntual con sus pagos, ella ve en el Bancomunal que las socias son solidarias entre ellas.  
Doris necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de zapatos, sandalias 
El sueño de Doris es tener una tienda de calzados en su casa.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the communal bank called Senor de los Milagros. She is 21 years old and married with twin 9 month old babies. Doris finished highschool and went to work in a printing shop for a year. The job was good, but she needed to leave once she was pregnant. A friend suggested that Doris start selling shoes that she was making. And so Doris saw the opportunity she needed and now she sells shoes from her house. Since she has been working with the communal bank, she has learned to be responsible and she is timely with her payments. She sees that there is a lot of solidarity between the bank's members. Doris will use the loan to purchase shoes and sandals. Her dream is to one day have her own shoe shop set up in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and sandals which she sells from her home

loans.name: Cariñositas Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: CARIÑOSITAS se encuentra en su  1° ciclo, compuesto por 11 personas,como presidenta tenemos a la señora Elizabeth J. M. y tesorera Sandra E.P. J. y D. secretaria, Elena Y. Malale, el grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades como ser a la venta D. cosmeticos ,comida ,abarrote y venta D. ropa son actividades que necesitan capital D. trabajo. Sras:estan conformes D. trabajar con Emprender porque con el credito otorgado lograran incrementar sus ganancias.Las Sras. les gusta compartir con sus amigas vecinas  cada quincena.
La Sra Elizabeth J. es Presidenta del grupo, es su primer ciclo D. antiguedad; ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes tieniendo 3 años D. antiguedad en el negocio. AtienD. 7 dias a la semana y 12 horas al dia ,su trabajo requiere D. un incremento D. capital  , su meta es incrementar su capital D. trabajo para surtir mas su tienda y invertir en la compra D. mas productos D. primera necesidad. La Sra.Sandra Elizabeth P. J. ella es la tesorera del grupo ella es empleada D. una  clinica, tiene 3 años D. experiencia en el rubro. Su meta es el D. seguir con emprender y al mismo tiempo sacar un credito mas granD. y poder invertir en un negocio propio que consiste en la compra D. celulares y tener su propia tienda algun mercado popular.
La Sra.Elena Y. Malale ella es la secretaria del grupo,ella tiene su punto D. llamadas lleva 3 años trabajando. Su trabajo es mayormente  es atender a la gente que va por su punto D. llamadas, su meta es D. poder abrir otro punto D. llamadas para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lending institution: Cariñositas is in its first loan cycle, maD. up of 11 people. Its President is Mrs. Elizabeth J. M., its treasurer is Sandra E. P. J. and its secretary is Elena Y. Malale. The group participates in a variety of economic endeavors, such as sales of cosmetics, food, groceries, and clothing. These are the activities for which they need working capital. They are working with Emprender because, with the loans they receive they increase their earnings. The women enjoy getting together to share with their friends and neighbors every two weeks.

Mrs. Elizabeth J. is the group's President, and this is her first cycle with this responsibility. She has been selling groceries for three years. She works 7 days a week, 12 hours a day. Her work requires a little extra capital, and her goal is to increase that capital to be able to stock her store up better and invest in buying more staple goods.

Mrs. Sandra Elizabeth P. J. is the group's Treasurer and works in a clinic. She has been working there for three years. Her goal is to continue with her work, and obtain a larger loan to be able to invest in her own business, which will consist of purhcasing cell phones and have her own business in a popular public market.

Mrs. Elena Y. Malale is the group's Secretary, and has her own phone center, which she has been doign for three years. Her job consists mainly of attending to costumers who go to make calls at her center. Her goal is to be able to open up another of these centers to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up their businesses

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: El sr. Bernardino trabaja con nosotros desde el año 2006, tiene su movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi, vive con su esposa Andrea , quien se dedica a vender empanadas en el centro de la ciudad, la mayoria de sus hijos son mayores e independientes, pero aun tiene hijos 3 hijos menores a los que hace estudiar en la escuela y la universidad. Invertirá el crédito en la compra de una nueva movilidad, vendiendo la actual porque ya le esta dando algunos problemas mecanicos. Es un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. Bernardino has been working with us since 2006. He works as a radio-taxi driver, and lives with his wife Andrea, who sells empanadas in the city center. Most of their children are grown and independent, but they still have three younger children who go to school and university. He will use the loan to buy a new car, selling the one he has now because he's having mechanical difficulties with it. He is a responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in a new car for his taxi business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA EXCELENTE CLIENTE QUE INGRESA A EMPRENDER UN 8 DE MARZO DEL 2004 EN EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO UNIVERSO LUEGO DE UN TIEMPO DECIDE SACAR UN CREDITO EN FORMA INDIVIDUAL, LA SEÑORA ESTA EN LA SECUENCIA NUEVE DE SU CREDITO INDIVIDUAL, ELLA SE DE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MUEBLES EN SU PUESTO EN LA POPULOSA ZONA DE JESUS DEL GRAN PODER, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA CARPINTERIA QUE ACOMODA POR MAYOR EN LAS DIVERSAS FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO,  LA PAREJA TIENE CUATRO HIJOS QUE JUNTOS EDUCAN CON DEDICACION Y AMOR, SON CLIENTES DE MUY BUENA ACTITUD QUE TIENE EL ANHELO DE SUPERARSE Y TENER UNIAS MEJOR FUTURO PARA SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Ms. Cristina C. M. is an excellent client who joined Emprender, with the Universe Solidarity Group, on March 8th, 2004. After some time, she decided to request an individual loan and is in her ninth loan cycle for individual loans. She sells furniture at her site in the densely populated zone of Jesus del Gran Poder. Her husband is a carpenter and works in wholesale at markets in the city El Alto.

The couple has four children and they raise them with dedication and love. They are applicants with excellent attitudes, and a desire to excel and create a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a turner for carpentry

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela began her business to take an activity and in some way help with household expenses. She started the business in June 2005 when a friend lent her some catalogs, and she told her the profits earned with the sales. So, Marcela began to sell shoes by catalog. She started selling to friends, then neighbors and relatives who made it possible to grow her sales. 

She needs a loan of $3,000 MXN that she will repay in 6 installments. With this credit, she is going to buy merchandise and deliver orders of shoes that are pending.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Josefa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA EXCELENTE CLIENTE QUE INGRESA A EMPRENDER UN 25 D. MARZO DEL 2002 EN EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO JERUSALEM LUEGO D. UN TIEMPO DECID. SACAR UN CREDITO EN FORMA INDIVIDUAL, LA SEÑORA ESTA EN LA SECUENCIA OCHO D. SU CREDITO INDIVIDUAL, ELLA SE D. DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CALZADOS EN SU PUESTO UBICADO EN LA AV. 16 D. JULIO EN LA CIUDAD D. EL ALTO, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION D. CHAMARRAS QUE ACOMODA POR MAYOR EN LA FERIA 16 D. JULIO, LA SEÑORA Y SU ESPOSO TIENEN CUATRO HIJOS LOS CUALES AUN CURSAN LA ESCUELA PRIMARIA. NECESITAN EL CREDITO PARA SURTIR EL NEGOCIO CON CALZADOS D. NUEVOS MODELOS.
texts.en:
Ms. M. D. L. is an excellent client who joined “Emprender”, with the Jerusalem Solidarity Group, on March 25th, 2002. After some time, she decided to request an individual loan and is on her eight-loan cycle for individual loans. She sells shoes at a stand on Av. 16 D. Julio in the city El Alto. Her husband makes (chamarras) coarse, heavy jackets and sells them, wholesale at the market, 16 D. Julio.

The couple has four children who are still in primary school. They need the loan to stock new styles of shoes in their store.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock new style of shoes

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas quienes cursan estudios superiores. Para incrementar sus ingresos económicos tuvo que irse de su país a forjar un futuro prometedor, pero la crisis económica le obligó a regresar a Perú y en poco tiempo implementó un restaurante, el cual apenas tiene 6 meses de funcionamiento, pero ya tiene gran cantidad de clientes, lo cual es resultado de la exquisita sazón que posee la esposa de Jaime, pues ella es la autora de los diversos platos que ofrecen, mientras que él es quien atiende a los clientes y lo realiza con mucha alegría y respeto. Así trabajan juntos todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, tiempo que disfrutan compartiendo sus actividades como pareja. Los sueños de esta familia es tener un auto para realizar sus compras y en los tiempos libres Jaime pueda trabajar haciendo taxi con la finalidad de tener ingresos adicionales. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contento por la oportunidad y confianza brindada, pues este dinero le da la posibilidad que crecer en su negocio. Con la cantidad solicitada comprará algunos utensilios y mesas para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Jaime is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters who attend university. To increase his income, he left his country trying to forge a more promising future, but the economic crisis forced him to return to Peru. Soon after, he opened up a restaurant that, even though is only six months old has attracted a large number of costumers. This is mostly due to the seasoning that Jaime’s wife makes. She is the one who prepares the delicious meals and Jaime attends to the costumers with respect and joviality. They work together every day from 8am until 10pm, sharing the work as a couple. One of their dreams is to have an automobile to carry the supplies they purchase for the restaurant and, during Jaime’s free time, to use it as a taxi to generate additional income. This would be the first loan with MFP and Jaime is very happy for the opportunity and trust. The loan would give them the chance to grow along with their business. He will use the loan to buy utensils and tables for the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils and tables for his restaurant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.es: Melchor es una persona alegre y responsable, sobre todo con su rol de padre, pues junto a su pareja trabajan arduamente para satisfacer las necesidades de su última hija, quien tiene muchos anhelos de estudiar. Esta familia vive en una pequeña casa construida con mucho esfuerzo desde hace 10 años. Sus ganancias como músico, hace 20 años, le sirvieron para mantener a sus cinco hijos mayores, quienes ya son independientes, más ahora para cumplir los sueños de su menor hija tiene que trabajar el doble, pues la situación económica no es igual que antes y le obligó a buscar nuevas alternativas de trabajo. Desde entonces, por las mañanas se dedica al reciclaje y en las tardes ayuda a su esposa en la atención de su bodega, la cual viene funcionando desde hace cuatro años y hasta ahora ha ido creciendo notablemente, pues en sus inicios solo vendía algunas bebidas, pero ahora tiene gran variedad de productos y sus vecinos están acostumbrados a realizar sus compras en la tienda de don Melchor. Sus más próximos anhelos es techar su casa para ampliar su tienda y ambientarla con nuevos exhibidores que llamen la atención de las personas. Este es el 13avo préstamo que tiene Melchor con MFP y el tiempo de permanencia le sirvió para adquirir nuevas técnicas de negocio y conocer a las personas de su grupo con quienes comparte momentos gratos de reunión. Desea invertir 1500 soles en la compra de mercadería para su negocio de reciclaje, así como aumentar el capital de inversión para su tienda.
texts.en:
Melchor is a happy and responsible man, especially in his role as a father. Together with his wife, they work diligently to take care of the needs of their youngest daughter, who has dreams of studying. This family lives in a little house built with a lot of effort 10 years ago. His earnings as a musician, which he has done for 20 years, helped him take care of his five older children, who are now all grown up. But now, to be able to fulfill the dreams of his youngest daughter, he has to work double since the economic situation is not as good as before, which means he has to seek out other employment alternatives.

In the mornings, he works at recycling and in the afternoons he helps his wife run their store, which has been in business for four years and has grown considerably up until now. At the beginning they only sold drinks, but they now have a variety of products and their neighbors have grown accustomed to buying in Mr. Melchor's store. Their next dream is to put a roof on their house to be able to create more space for their store, and install new display cases that will call the attention of their customers.

This is the 13th loan Melchor will have with MFP, and his longstanding status has helped him acquire new business techniques and get to know the people in his group, with whom he shares pleasant moments in their meetings.

He would like to invest 1500 soles in the purchase of merchandise for his recycling business, which will in turn increase the available capital to invest in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add to his merchandise

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl tiene 33 años, es una persona muy amable y atenta, lo cual le hizo que se ganase el cariño de sus suegros, quienes lo acogieron en su casa junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Desde joven tuvo la iniciativa de emprender su negocio propio y con el apoyo de sus suegros instaló hace 2  años un pequeño espacio dentro de su hogar donde compra y vende repuestos y accesorios de segundo uso. Su trabajo consiste en comprar, durante un mes, grandes cantidades de objetos usados o de papeles de reciclaje por kilos. Luego va seleccionando todos los objetos y cada fin de mes los vende a las grandes fábricas que solicitan estos artículos en grandes cantidades. Raúl tiene fábricas donde siempre vende, sin embargo, han aumentado sus clientes y hay nuevos lugares qué visitar para ofrecer sus artículos. Para el fututo desea tener un depósito de reciclaje para abastecer la demanda del mercado. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP y recuerda que en sus inicios eran personas muy dependientes de su asesor de crédito, más ahora son personas desenvueltas y agradecen la oportunidad de conocerse, aprender y trabajar en equipo. Invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de mercadería, pues han habido días en que por falta de capital no pudo adquirir lo que necesitaba.
texts.en:
Raúl is 33 years old, and is very friendly and attentive, which has endeared him to his in-laws, who have accepted him into their house with his daughter and their two children. Since he was young he has had the initiative to start his own business, and with the help of his in-laws, two years ago created a little space inside their home where he buys and sells secondhand and refurbished goods. His work consits of buying, during a month, large quantities of secondhand items and recycled paper by the kilo. Next, he chooses the best items and, at the end of the month, sells them to the big factories that look for these kinds of items in large quantities.

Although Raúl has repeat customers, factories where he always sells, he has increased his customer base and there are new places that he visits to offer his goods. For the future, he would like to have a warehouse for his recycling, to be able to meet the market demand. This will be his 9th loan with MFP, and he remembers that at the beginning the clients were very dependent on the credit advisors, but now they are confident people who are thankful for the opportunity to know each other, to learn, and to work as a team. He will invest the loan money in the purchase of merchandise, because it's been a while since he could buy what he needed, owing to a lack of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jorge Sergio

texts.es: El sr. Jorge es un cliente muy puntual, trabaja con su movilidad, vive en una habitación muy sencilla, tiene dos hijos que viven en el Brasil con su mamá, lo visitan muy poco, ya que ellos estudian allá. Se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar la casita donde actualmente vive, y la está comprando, el crédito será para cancelar el saldo pendiente. Es una persona muy responsable. Por la zona donde vive, Pampahasi, es muy conocido; por ello siempre tiene contratos de transporte de personas.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge is a very punctual client, working with his automobile. He lives in a very simple room, has two children who live in Brazil with their mother, and who visit him very infrequently because they are now studying there. The opportunity to buy the house he is living in has presented itself to him, and he is buying it. The loan he is asking for is to pay off the remaining balance on the house. He is a very responsible man. He is very well known in his neighborhood of Pampahasi, and for this reason his taxi service always has business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off the loan on his house

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.es: La señora Tarcila tiene 50 años, es casada y vive con sus tres hijos quienes apoyan a su madre en los gastos de su casa. Como toda madre, anheló bien educar a sus hijos, lo cual fue su prioridad y por lo que cada mañana salía a trabajar, pero con el paso del tiempo su hijo mayor vio la necesidad y las ganas de trabajar de su madre y al graduarse utilizó los ahorros de su trabajo para instalar en su casa unas cabinas para el servicio de Internet, dando a su madre la oportunidad de administrar su propio negocio; negocio que ya tiene 6 años y en el que atiende muy alegremente. Pero su espíritu  emprendedor la impulsó a instalar también un locutorio al costado de sus cabinas, el cual se convirtió en una ayuda de comunicación para sus vecinos y el incremento de sus ganancias económicas. Para el futuro Tarcila desea seguir ampliando sus servicios y anhela instalar una botica en la esquina de su casa, ya que sus hijas estudiaron farmacia y sería un servicio más que pueda brindar a sus vecinos. Hace 4 años que trabaja con MFP, este es su octavo préstamo, se siente muy contenta en formar parte de su banco comunal, pues ahí encontró el respaldo de la institución y de sus compañeras que unánimemente trabajan para el bienestar del todo el grupo. Con la cantidad que está solicitando comprará algunas computadoras, además, las que ya tiene  requieren de mantenimiento e invertirá en cada una 100 soles. Con esto espera mejorar el servicio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Tarcila is 50 years old and married, and lives with her three children, who help their mother with household expenses. Like every mother, she longed to give her children a good education. Since it was her top priority, she went to work every morning. But over the course of time her eldest son became aware of the need and was eager to work. When he graduated he used his savings from his work to install some internet stations in their house, giving his mother the opportunity to run her own business. The business is 6 years old now and she manages it happily. But her entrepreneurial spirit inspired her to install telephone booths beside the computers, which has helped her neighbors with their communications and increased her earnings. In the future, Tarcila would like to continue expanding her services, and would like to install a pharmacy in the corner of the house, since her daughters studied pharmacy and it would be an additional service to provide her neighbors. She's been working with MFP for four years, and this is her eighth loan. She feels very happy to be part of her communal bank, since she receives support from the organization and from the other members, who work together for the good of the whole group. With the requested sum, she will buy some computers, and will also invest 100 soles each in the maintenance of the computers she already has. She hopes in this way to improve the service she offers her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers and maintain the ones she has

loans.name: Nelson Cecilio

texts.es: El sr. Nelson es un cliente, soltero, muy responsable, es un joven muy trabajador, tiene su servicio de Internet, con máquinas que él  mismo ensambló, tiene también juegos de play station. Esta ubicado en la popular zona de Pampahasi, en la avenida principal. Con este trabajo sustenta sus estudios, que ya está por terminar, y ayuda también en los gastos de la casa. Cliente de la institución desde el año 2007, invertirá en la compra de material para el ensamblado de nuevas computadoras ya que piensa abrir un nuevo local en otra zona.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson is a young single man who is very responsible and hardworking. He has an Internet cafe with computers that he assembled himself, and he also has PlayStation games. His business is located in the popular part of Pampahasi, on the main avenue. He uses income from his business to pay for his studies, which he has almost completed, and also to help pay for the household expenses. A loan customer since 2007, he will invest in the purchase of materials to build new computers so that he can open up a second location in another area.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to build computers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen C. T. ingreso a la institución hace un año, por la necesidad de tener un crédito para la compra de mercadería al por mayor, para la venta en su puesto ubicado en la C/ Max Paredes, zona del Rosario a media cuadra de la plaza Garita de lima y además tiene planes de agarrar un anticrético para su vivienda quien actualmente vive en la casa tía y desea superarse y no tener que depender de la misma , dejando de pagar el alquiler.
La Sra. vive con sus hermanos menores, en edad escolar, quien se encarga de ellos con todos los gastos familiares que tiene que cubrir con las ganancias de puesto.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen C. T. joined the organization a year ago because she needed a loan to buy wholesale merchandise, so she could sell it in her stall on Max Paredes Street in the Rosario neighborhood. She also plans to snag an "anticrético" to live in, since she's now living with her aunt and would like to get ahead and no longer depend on her aunt or pay rent. (An "anticrético" is a type of living arrangement in Bolivia in which a contract is signed with a property owner to be able to live in a house for a period of time for an established sum of money up-front. At the end of the period, if the house is still in good shape, all the money is returned to the occupant, or the occupant gets to keep the property.) She lives with her younger brothers, who are of school age, and takes care of all the family expenses with her earnings from her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to increase her business capital

loans.name: Estrellitas De Huancaro Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “ESTRELLITAS DE HUANCARO”; estos socios son un grupo de 13 miembros, 3 varones y 10 mujeres, es un grupo muy dinámico y divertido, ellos viven en el barrio de Huancaro alto, en el distrito de santiago.

Nuestros socios compartes sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, ellos forman un grupo de comerciantes y 2 de ellos tienen sus tiendas de abarrotes, ellos se dedican a comprar y vender granos (trigo, maíz, habas, pallares), frutas, choclos; Para lo cuál requieren del préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de sus granos, frutas y abarrotes.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado y se ratifican en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones y cancelar su préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “ESTRELLITAS DE HUANCARO”; it is a group of 13 members, 3 men and 10 women. It's a very dynamic, fun group. They live in the Huancaro Alto neighborhood, in the district of Santiago. Our members participate in both domestic and commercial activities. They are a group of merchants. Two of them have their own grocery stores where they buy and sell grains (wheat, corn, broad beans, butter beans), fruits, and corn. They need the loan in order purchase grains, fruits, and dry goods. The members appreciate and value the loan offered, and promise to fulfill their obligations and repay the loan in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains and supply grocery store.

loans.name: Annie

texts.es: Annie, de profesión profesora de primaria, tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en todo, la casa donde viven es propia. Se dedica a la venta de ladrillos, su negocio lo realiza en un local que alquiló porque se encuentra en una zona comercial. Lleva aproximadamente 9 años con esta actividad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es el encargado de administrar el negocio, porque a veces ella tiene que viajar muy lejos debido a su carrera profesional como docente. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es un negocio tranquilo y conoce a muchas personas, además lo considera rentable porque es un producto que tiene demanda diariamente y le genera buenos ingresos. Posteriormente Annie quiere tener su local propio y dejar atrás el gasto por el alquiler. Este es su préstamo número 15 con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su grupo del banco comunal porque son muy organizados. La cantidad que solicita la invertirá en aumentar la cantidad de ladrillos que vende, ya que ella los compra y no los fabrica.
texts.en:
Annie, a primary school teacher, is 38 years old and she lives with her husband who supports her in everything. They own their own home. She dedicates herself to selling bricks, and she does this from a store she rented because it is in a commercial area. She has been doing this for around 9 years, and her husband supports her by being in charge of all the business' administration because she sometimes has to travel very far due to her professional career as a teacher. She really likes her job as it is a peaceful business and she gets to know a lot of people. As well as this she considers it to be profitable because she sells a product that is in daily demand and thta generates high earnings. In the future, Annie wants to have her own store, leaving behind rent payments. This is her 15th loan with MFP and she likes to work with her communal bank group because they are very organised. The solicited amount will be invested in increasing the amount of bricks she sells as she buys them and does not make them.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Asteria

texts.es: Asteria tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos quienes le ayudan mucho. Se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo en un puesto de uno de los mercados de su ciudad, en esta actividad ya lleva un periodo de 18 años, y su trabajo siempre lo desempeñó sola, ya que no cuenta con ayudantes. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que sus clientes confían mucho en ella y en la calidad de la carne que vende, además le es muy rentable porque aparte ofrece presas de pollo sazonadas y listas para la parrilla a algunos recreos turísticos de su zona, y está contenta con su negocio porque le va muy bien. En el futuro Asteria quiere tener un local propio y vender tranquilamente como hasta ahora, pero ahorrando el gasto por el alquiler de su puesto. Este es su 11avo préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque tienen mucha comunicación y los problemas que se presentan siempre se resuelven con diálogo y siguen adelante. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos, además de pagar algunos gastos de la educación de sus hijos, a quienes quiere ver profesionales.
texts.en:
Asteria is 45 years old, a single mother who lives with her two kids who help her a lot. She dedicates herself to selling chicken from a stall in one of the markets of her city. She has been doing this for 18 years and she has always done it alone as she does not have any assistants. What she likes about her work is that the clients trust her and the quality of meat that she sells a lot, as well as the fact that it is profitable because she also offers seasoned chicken pieces ready to be grilled in the touristy area, and she is happy because her business is going well. In the future Asteria wants to have her own store and to sell at her own pace as she does now, but saving up the money she would be spending on rent. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she likes working with her communal bank group because they communicate a lot and the problems that come up are always resolved by speaking about them and moving forward. She will invest the solicited money in buying chicken in bulk, as well as paying some of her kids' educational costs, as she wants them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es: La señora Dulia tiene D. 64 años, vive junto a su esposo y su hija quienes siempre están con ella en todo momento. Su casa es propia, gracias al esfuerzo D. muchos años D. trabajo. Se dedica a vender carne D. pollos D. chacra (criados sólo a base D. maíz) en un puesto del mercado D. su zona, esta actividad la viene realizando desD. hace 20 años y cuenta en este su negocio con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien es el encargado D. ir a comprar los pollos para que Dulia los venda. Lo que le agrada D. su trabajo es que se siente útil, además que le es muy rentable porque los  pollos que ella venD. son D. muy buena calidad y tienen mayor demanda por su valor nutritivo y buen sabor que poseen. Para el futuro, Dulia quiere tener una tienda en su casa, donD. además venda abarrotes y sería menos cansado. Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, pertenece a un banco comunal llamado “Mujeres Talentosas” y le gusta mucho porque son unidas y coordinadas. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará la cantidad que D. pollos venD. y con otra parte comprará materiales D. construcción para arreglar algunas estructuras D. su casa.
texts.en:
Dulia is 64 years old and lives with her husband and daughter who are always there for her. They own their own home thanks to the effort of working for many years. She dedicates herself to selling corn-fed chicken from a stall in the market in her area, an activity she has been doing for 20 years. She counts on her husband's help with her business as he is in charge of going to buy the chickens so Dulia can sell them. What she likes about her job is that it makes her feel useful, as well as being profitable because the chicken she sells are of good quality and are in high demand due to their nutritious content and great flavor. In the future, Dalia wants to have a store in her home from where she can sell groceries and it would be a lot less tiring. This is her 11th credit with MFP and she belongs to a communal group called 'Mujeres Talentosas' ('Talented Women'), and she likes it because they are united and coordinated. With the solicited money she will increase the quantity of chicken she sells and she will also buy building materials to fix some problems in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of chicken she sells/Incremento de la carne de pollo que vende

loans.name: Lila

texts.es: Lila es madre de 2 hijos que están estudiando, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus padres y su esposo que la apoya en todos sus objetivos. La casa donde viven es de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas en un espacio que acondicionó en la fachada de su casa. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 9 años atrás y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo, le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y le es rentable porque ya cuenta con su gama de clientes. Adicionalmente, por las tardes, trabaja en un restaurante especializado en pollo al carbón con papas fritas, muy típico D. país, mejor conocido como “Pollería”, Lila lleva los pedidos a domicilio. Posteriormente quiere tener un minimarket donde no falte ningún producto, por eso es que trabaja duro para cumplir su propósito. Esta es la primera vez tiene un préstamo con MFP, es una experiencia nueva trabajar en un banco comunal, y le gusta porque observó desde un principio que existe mucha unión y solidaridad entre todos. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Lila is the mother of two school-aged children. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband, who supports her in all her goals. Their family lives with her parents. Lila spends her time selling groceries, sweets and beverages out of a space at the front of the house. She has run this business for the past nine years and enjoys the unconditional support of her husband. Lila likes her work because she is acquainted with a lot of people and it is profitable due to the range of customers. Additionally, in the evenings she works at a restaurant, better known as "Pollería," that specializes in grilled chicken and fried potatoes, a traditional dish in her country. Lila delivers the orders to the customers' homes. In the future Lila wants to open a minimarket that carries just about everything, and she is working hard towards that goal. This is her first loan with MFP, and her first experience working in a community bank. She likes it because from the beginning she noticed the degree of unity and solidarity amongst the members. With the money that she has requested, Lila will buy groceries, sweets and beverages to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandize

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy es madre soltera, tiene 56 años de edad y vive con su único hijo que es estudiante. Se dedica a la venta de productos de pasamanería (adornos personales, aretes, collares, etc.) en un puesto de un mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 3 años y le va muy bien ya que no hay un día que deje de vender. Le gusta su trabajo porque le hace sentir útil y sobre todo se relaciona con muchas personas, además le es rentable porque los artículos que vende son de buena calidad y sus clientes confían mucho en ella. Para el futuro, Lucy quiere implementar su negocio en su casa y adicionar la venta de ropa y zapatos. Este es ya su 12avo préstamo con MFP. Su banco comunal se llama “Mujeres Talentosas”, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque siempre se apoyan entre todas y son solidarias. Invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de productos, y de sus pasajes, porque ella compra su mercadería en otra ciudad donde puede obtenerla a un precio más barato.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 56 year old single mother, and she lives with her only son, who is a student. She sells jewelry in a stall in a market near her home. She has been doing this for 3 years, and it's going so well for her that there's not a single day she doesn't go to work. She likes her work because it makes her feel useful and, above all, she gets to interact with many people. Besides, it is profitable for her because her articles or of good quality and she has the trust of her customers.

For the future, Lucy wants to move her business to her home and add sales of clothing and shoes. This is her 12th loan with MFP. Her communal bank is called "Mujeres Talentosas" (Talented Women) and she likes to work with her group because they always support each other in solidarity. She will invest the money she's asking for in the purchase of merchandise and her tickets for travel, because she always makes her purchases in another city where she can find better prices.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. La casa donde vive es de los padres de su esposo, los mismos que se encuentra radicando en otro lugar. Ella y su esposo se dedican a fabricar y vender accesorios útiles para las carpinterías, como cancamos, que son ganchos de fierro que se usan para atrapar la madera, también elaboran cables, combas y otros objetos del mismo rubro. Llevan 25 años en esta actividad, su esposo es su compañero de trabajo porque es él quien fabrica estos materiales y Nelly los ofrece y vende. Posteriormente quieren alquilar un local donde puedan tener bien distribuido sus materiales y productos terminados. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todas sus integrantes son mujeres y son responsables y unidas. La cantidad que solicita es para la compra de fierros para que su esposo siga fabricando los materiales a vender y con un monto menor invertirá en el arreglo de algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children. The house where she lives belongs to her husband's parents, who currently live elsewhere. She and her husband make and sell carpentry items, such as "cancamos", which are iron fastenings that are used to join pieces of wood, and they also make cables, ropes, and other such items. They have been doing this for 25 years, and her husband is her business partner because he makes these things, which she then sells. In the future they would like to rent a stall in the market where they can distribute these materials and finished products successfully.

This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she likes to work with her communal bank because all the members are women and they are responsible and united. The amount she is asking for is to buy iron for her husband to continue making their products to sell, and with a smaller part of it she will invest in some home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of metal to use in their shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que trabajan y lo apoyan mucho. Se dedica a vender carne de pollo en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 20 años, ganándose la confianza de muchas personas quienes ahora son sus fieles clientes, que acuden a su puesto porque saben que Rosa no les miente ni en el peso, ni en la calidad de su producto. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es satisfacer a sus clientes cortando los trozos de carne según el gusto particular de su cliente, sin cobrarles ningún precio adicional. Además, le es rentable, ya que no hay un día que deje de vender. Para más adelante Rosa quiere mandar a construir un galpón en su casa para criar sus propios pollos y obtenga mayores ganancias. Rosa viene trabajando con MFP, cerca de 6 años, esta es su solicitud de préstamo número 11, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque siempre existe comunicación y en cualquier percance todos colaboran para su solución. Con la cantidad que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de pollos, y una parte del dinero le servirá como capital de inversión para un nuevo negocio que desea emprender con su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and lives with her husband and their three children who work and support them very much. She sells chicken in a stall in a neighborhood market, which she has been doing for 20 years, earning the trust of many people who now are her loyal customers. They go to her shop because they know that Rosa doesn't lie to them about the weight or quality of her product. What she likes most about her work is satisfying her clients, cutting the meat to the particular tastes of each customer with no extra charge. Additionally, it is profitable for her, and there isn't a single day that she doesn't go to work. In the future Rosa wants to have a shed built at her house where she can raise her own chickens and obtain better profits.

Rosa has worked with MFP for almost 6 years, and this will be her 11th loan. She likes working with her group because there is constant communication and in case of any minor problems, they all work together to find a solution. With the amount that she is requesting she will buy more chickens, and a small part of the money will be used to invest in a new business she wants to start with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Sien's Group

texts.en:
P. is a leader of a group of borrowers that consists of four members. She is a widow mother of three children: the first one is married and lives separately and the other two are students. She has owned a small fashion shop in front of Angkor Villa hotel since 1996 and she can earn up to $5 per day. She is famous for her down-to-earth skill in designing modern clothes; also, her shop is located in the middle main street.

Lately, she has taken out a loan to renovate her house. The other group members are: T., 42, who owns a small shop selling groceries, is applying the loan to invest in her selling; S., 31, who is a paddy rice trader, is looking for the loan to buy more corn and rice to stock for a while because today is the harvest season; and S., 38, who sells soft drinks to tours, is applying for a loan to buy more products for her shop. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To renovate a house

loans.name: Huseinboi

texts.ru: Хусейн молодой парень, женат, но пока не имеет детей. Ему исполнилось 30 лет. Хусейн проживает в небольшом кишлаке и занимается выпечкой национального таджикского хлеба – лепешек. Работа тяжелая, так как приходится очень мало спать. Еще с поздней ночи ставится тесто, под утро начинается процесс раскатки теста и его выпечка  в печи. Уже в 7 утра есть готовые лепешки готовые к реализации. Хусейн активный клиент Микроинвест и займы получает для приобретения муки и угля. Свой очередной займ он также собирается потратить на муку.
texts.en:
Husein is a young man with a wife, but no children as yet. He is just 30 years old. Husein lives in a small village and bakes traditional Tajik flatbread, lepeshka, for a living. His work is hard, causing him to get very little sleep. Late at night he prepares the dough, and towards morning begins the process of rolling out the dough and baking it in the oven. Already by 7 in the morning, the baked bread is ready for sale. Husein is a current client of MikroInvest and the loans he has received were for the acquisition of flour and coal. He likewise plans to spent this next loan on flour.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: N., 36 years old, is a resident of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of four children: all of them are single and students. She is married to Cay, 37, who is a motor taxi driver. For more than a year, N. has owned a big field given by her parents, where she plants watermelon. She takes her watermelon to sell in the market by herself so that she can earn a good price; she always looks for an available field of watermelon to buy wholesale. If she could do that, she could earn a good profit. Because now is the harvest season for the upcoming Khmer New Year's Eve, N. is taking a loan of $250 to buy watermelon from the field at wholesale. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy watermelon at wholesale

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
The group loan from Kiva's partner HKL consists of three people. They are villagers living in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. Mrs. S., 30, has been selected to be the leader of the group by the members. She is a widowed mother who is responsible for two children. Both of them are single and help her with her work.

S. earns a living by making mats for sale. She buys the raw materials from village farmers as well as planting them herself. As another income source, she also cultivates a rice crop. She currently takes care of her old mother, who helps her in making mats. S. is seeking a loan in order to buy more raw materials and will use the remainder of the loan for growing rice.

The other two borrowers are: S., 24, a local mat maker who is requesting a loan to increase her capital for buying raw materials, and S., 31, who produces mats for sale and needs the loan to improve her business progress.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha C., 56,  is a housewife with nine children. She lives in Lopez Jaena Mis Occ. Her husband is an amakan (bamboo mat) maker. She also sells amakan for a living. The loan is for additional capital for their amakan business, which they sell to other towns. She hopes buy a vehicle for their business and build a house for her family someday.

loans.use: Additional capital for amakan (bamboo mat) business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresita S. is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner. She is married to Egmidio S. and has five children, two of whom are still studying. She is a resident of Roxas, Zambo Norte. Income from labor is her husband's major source of income.

During her membership, she has had five loans. The purpose of this loan is to buy piglets and feed. This will add to her existing pig-raising business to support her husband in generating household income. She dreams that her family will experience a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita P. is a resident of South Western Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has children. Her husband is presently working in Malaysia. She is engaged in the buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing.

She was one of the pioneering members of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, under the microfinance program. She is an active member of Morning Glory Center credit services and her highest loan was Php 10,000.00, which she used as additional capital for buying assorted dry goods. They were challenged with financial difficulties. Her business was affected and they had no other source of income aside from her business.

But despite those challenges, she’s trying to move on in order to recover. She’s now on her fourth loan amounting to Php 10,0000.00 to purchase additional items like t-shirts, shorts, pants, curtains, pillows and many other items. She is very thankful to Paglaum for giving her another chance.

Her hope and aspiration in life is to expand and have a stable business someday, and that all her children are able to finish their studies and have a decent living for their families.

loans.use: Purchase t-shirts, shorts, pants, curtains, pillows and many other items

loans.name: Vuong's Group

texts.vi:
Vương Thị Thúy Hảo sinh năm 1980, (Mã số: 010110080002 ). Chị Hảo hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ đang đi học. Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Chồng chị làm công nhân tại xưởng gỗ. Ngoài ra chi còn mua máy may công nghiệp và nhận hàng về nhà may gia công. Thu nhập của gia đình chị: 3.000.000 VND/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn chu kì này với mức là: 4.142.000 VND. Các thành viên trong nhóm rất tin tưởng chị và bầu chị làm nhóm trưởng. Trong nhóm còn có: 
 Nguyễn Thị Hà sinh năm 1984, (Mã số: 010110080001 ). Chị tham gia vay vốn chu kì này với mức vay là: 4.142.000 VND để chăn nuôi và đi chợ bán hàng.
 Trần Lệ Quyên sinh năm 1982, (Mã số: 010110080003). Chị tham gia vay vốn với mức vốn là: 4.142.000 VND để mua máy may công nghiệp và nhận hàng về nhà may.
 Nguyễn Thị Phương sinh năm 1962, (Mã số: 010110080004 ). Chị chủ yếu làm nghề nông nghiệp. Chị tham gia vay vốn với mức vay là: 4.142.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn và gà.
 Hà Thị Ái sinh năm 1970, (Mã số: 010110080005). Chị chủ yếu làm nghề nông nghiệp. Chị tham gia vay vốn với mức vay là: 4.142.000 VND để chăn nuôi thêm và mở cửa hàng may mặc tại nhà.
texts.en:
Mrs Vuong T. T. H. was born in 1980. She currently lives with her husband and two young children who are still going to school. Her main job is farming and raising cattL.. Her husband is a worker at a wood production factory. Mrs. H. bought a sewing machine and takes orders to make clothes at home. Her family monthly income is 3,000,000 VND (or 175 USD). This loan cycL. she would like to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 240 USD). Other members in Mrs. H. trust her ability and nominate her as the group leader. Other members in Mrs. H.'s group are: + Mrs. Nguyen T. H. was born in 1984. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 240 USD) to raise cattL. and sell stuff at the market. + Mrs. Tran L. Q. was born in 1982. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 240 USD) to buy a sewing machine and start taking orders to make clothes at home. + Mrs. Nguyen T. P. was born in 1962. Her main job is farming. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 240 USD) to raise pigs and chicken. + Mrs. H. T. A. was born in 1970. Her main job is farming. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 240 USD) to raise more cattL. and open a small tailor shop at home.

Translated from Vietnamese by P. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nong nghiep

loans.name: Do

texts.vi: Đỗ Thị T. Tâm sinh năm 1993, (Mã số: 010110080019). Chị chủ yếu làm nghề nông nghiệp. Chị tham gia vay vốn với mức vay là: 1.972.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà, vịt đẻ.
texts.en:
Ms. Do T. T. was born in 1993. Her main job is farming. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND to raise chicken and ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nong nghiep

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn G. is married with four offspring. She is currently engaged in selling fish caught by her husband and acquired from other fishermen. She asks for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 from Kiva's partner PMPC to finish building their new fishing boat and for additional capital in her fish-selling business.

She hopes that someday she can open a sari-sari (variety) store aside from her existing business to support the studies of her children. She said that Paglaum is always standing behind their financial needs.

loans.use: To finish building a new fishing boat

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita C. is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.  She is married and 62 years old. Her husband is a barangay, or village, councilor. She was attracted to the programs and services provided by Paglaum, Kiva's partner, and immediately applied for membership.  By being a member, one earns many benefits especially on insurance and access to loans. Recently, Mrs. C. applied for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and to obtain additional capital for her fish vending business. She hopes to earn extra income for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and to acquire capital for fish selling

loans.name: Pham's Group

texts.vi:
Phạm Thị M. sinh năm 1957,(Mã số: 010114150001). Chị sống cùng chồng và con gái. Chị chủ yếu làm nghề nông nghiệp, chăn nuôi và trồng trọt, ngoài ra chị cũng đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 VND/tháng. Chị là người có uy tín trong thôn nên được các thành viên trong nhóm bầu làm nhóm trưởng, cụm trưởng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn là: 5.886.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi và buôn bán. Trong nhóm chị còn có:
 Trần Thị Luyến sinh năm 1966,(Mã số: 010114150002 ). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, chăn nuôi và đi chợ. Thu nhập của gia đình chị là: 2.500.000 VND/tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn là: 5.886.000 VND.
 Nguyễn Thị Đào sinh năm 1965, (Mã số: 010114150003). Chị sống cùng chồng, chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, ngoài ra chị còn đi chợ. Thu nhập của gia đình chị là 3.000.000 VND/tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vay là: 5.886.000 VND.
 Nguyễn Thị Hường sinh năm 1984,(Mã số: 010114150004). Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và đi chợ. Chồng chị cũng đi chợ buôn bán sắt cùng với chị. Chị tham gia vay mức vay là 4.578.000 VND
 Hoàng Thị T. sinh năm 1963, (Mã số: 010114150005). Chị vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi và đi chợ. Chị tham gia vay mức vay là 4.142.000 VND.
 Nguyễn Thị Chiên sinh năm 1971, (Mã số: 010114150006). Chị vay vốn để chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ.Chị tham gia vay mức vay là 5.886.000 VND.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham T. M., born in 1957, lives with her husband and her daughter. Her main job is farming and raising cattle. Besides, she sells stuff at the market. On average, her family monthly income is about 2,500,000 VND (or 145 USD). Mrs. M. has good reputation in her hamlet, so other members in her group nominate her as their group leader and cluster leader. She'd like to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 342 USD) to raise cattle and fund her small business. Other members in Mrs. M.'s group are: + Mrs. Tran T. L. was born in 1966. Her main jobs are farming, raising cattle and selling stuff at the market. Her family income is 2,500,000 VND (or 145 USD) per month. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 342 USD). + Mrs. Nguyen T. D. was born in 1965. She currently lives with her husband. Her main job is farming. Besides, she also sell things at the market. Her family income is 3,000,000 VND (or 175 USD) per month. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 342 USD). + Mrs. Nguyen T. H. was born in 1984. She lives with her husband and two small children. Her main jobs are farming and selling scrap metal at the market. Her husband also helps her collect and sell scrap metal. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (or 267 USD). + Mrs. Hoang T. T. was born in 1963. She wants to have some funds to raise pigs and sell things at the market. That's why he wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 240 USD). + Mrs. Nguyen T. C. was born in 1971. She also wants to have some funds to raise pigs and sell things at the market. That's why he wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 342 USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by PH. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nong Nghiep

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
A 56-year-old widowed individual, Mrs. Agustina A. resides in Polanco, Zambo Norte. She is struggling in her own effort to survive together with her mother. She is blessed with seven offspring but all of them have their own families.

She's been an active member of Paglaum Coop. for almost four years and already has had six loans. Her present economic activity is the growing and selling of rice. Her latest loan is intended to cover the cost of labor during cultivation of her rice farm and for the purchase of fertilizers. She hopes that despite the absence of her late husband, she will be able to provide their basic needs.

loans.use: Labor for rice cultivation and fertilizers

loans.name: Esoria

texts.en:
Esoria M. is a resident of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zambo. Norte, in the Philippines. She is married, with one child.  Her husband is a postmaster for their municipality.  Mrs. M. is also a barangay, or village, treasurer for Magsaysay. She operates a sari-sari store at her family's residence as another source of income. She started her business with the family's own savings. 
She became a member of Kiva's partner, Paglaum MPC,  under a microfinance program known as PDP-LP last October 2008, without availing herself of its credit services.  A few months later she decided to seek a loan.  She will use the loan to purchase additional grocery items for her sari-sari store -- Php laundry and bath soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, oil and sesame and many others -- to answer the needs of her customers. 
Mrs. M. is looking forward to the benefits and services of Paglaum MPC.  She is hoping that Paglaum can help her develop and expand her business through its financial services.

loans.use: Purchase additional grocery items for sari-sari store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlinda P. is 53 years old and married, with 4 children. Two of her children are in college, one is at the elementary level and the other is already working. Her husband is currently employed by the Department of Public Works and Highways. The couple is operating a "carenderia," or small restaurant, at their residence. Mrs. P. started her business from her family's own savings. As she observed, her income is enough only to pay the lending, which is collected each day.

Mrs. P. applied for membership in Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, and was officially accepted in September 2006. She is seeking a loan from Paglaum in the amount of Php 11,000.00.

She hopes that her business will become a fast-food restaurant someday and that all her children can finish their studies and have stable careers.

loans.use: Additional Capital for Carenderia

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba S. is a medical nurse by professional background but the nurses' salary is too low to ensure her family live as required, so Matluba trades at a weekend bazaar with pantyhose, tights and socks. She has been trading for 10 years and she is skilled in the trade business. Matluba goes to Istaravshan for her assortment of goods and she buys her assortment 2-3 times per month.

Matluba has applied to Kiva with the request of a business support loan of 600 STJ for 4 months for importing the new seasonal assortment. Matluba thanks Kiva for its support and small business development.

loans.use: For importing the new seasonal assortment.

loans.name: Surayohon

texts.en:
Surayohon Z. is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children and she lives in Khujand. Surayohon first applied to MicroInvest in 2008 when she was in need of financial support for importing a new assortment of goods from China. Since that moment, Surayohon has applied permanently to the MicroInvest loan procedure as she trusts it and she is going to continue her co-operation to help in her small business development.

Surayohon trades in women's clothing, bathing suits, and night wear. Surayohon brings her assortment from China and Istaravshan. She has a good assortment and repeat customers. Surayohon has applied to Kiva with the request of a business support loan of 500 STJ for 5 months to increase trade outlet size.

loans.use: To increase trade outlet size

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
Mastura K. first applied to MicroInvest in 2008. She recommended herself as a reliable client. Mastura is engaged in commercial trade, and she trades in food products. She works with suppliers who brings her an assortment from Russian Federation and Uzbekistan.

Mastura has opened up to a new business direction with vegetable oil selling. She brings it from Istaravshan and sells in the local bazaar. Mastura wants to import a big oil order from Iran so she has applied to Kiva with the request of a business development loan of 3500 STJ for 2 months. She thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To import a big oil order

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
Iskandar A. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. He is a reliable client who has not had any loan repayment delays. Iskandar is 29 years old and he is married. Iskandar has achieved higher education but he does not work as a school teacher because the teacher salary is too low.

Iskandar trades in school accessories, stationery and books. He brings the assortment from Istaravshan and he has engaged in this business for 2 years. As he is an educated young man, he can recommend the required books, and he has repeat customers.

Iskandar wants to go to China and get a large scale stationery order. He applied to Kiva with the request of a business support loan of 800 STJ for 5 months to get the required documents and to go to China. He thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To get the required documents and to go to China

loans.name: Osim

texts.en: Osim A. was born in 1971 in the Khujand. He is married and has 2 children. Osim has the higher education qualification of "engineer", but he trades in the local bazaar with shoes that his brother brings from Uzbekistan and Istaravshan. Osim has been trading in shoes for 8 years. He has applied to Kiva for the financial support of 1000 STJ for one month to increase the trade outlet size.

loans.use: To increase trade outlet size

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
This is thirty-four years old Janeth M. from Mwanza. She is single with two children.  Janeth has run a tailoring resale business since 1996.  She works twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Janeth currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business.  She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy materials for making women clothes for resale.  In the future, Janeth plans to increase her stock. She thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the 
Future.

loans.use: Buy materials for making cloth and resale

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is forty-three-year-old Salma M. from Mwanza. She is married with five children, between the ages of eight and eighteen. She is also responsible for supporting a young girl who is an orphan. 

Salma has been running a poultry business since 2004. In her business she sells chickens as well as eggs. She works at the business for four hours a day, seven days a week with the assistance of two employees. Salma currently earns about $500 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more chicks which she will raise and resell. In the future, she plans to open another business. Salma thanks you for supporting her!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their business equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, which enables them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise and resell

loans.name: Mohy

texts.en: A. Mohy first applied to MicroInvest in 2003. She is reliable and responsible and has had no loan repayment delays. She is married and has three children. Mohy lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan and works in the local bazaar, selling children's shoes and clothing. She buys an assortment of goods from Istaravshan and Uzbekistan. Mohy has been selling shoes for fifteen years and she is a skillful trader. Mohy is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $225 for 3 months. The loan will allow her to buy a new seasonal assortment of shoes and clothing. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to buy new seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Mary G. from Mwanza. She is widowed with two children, aged nineteen and twenty-six. Mary has been running a tailoring business since 1999. She makes clothes and sells them to customers. She works at the business for twelve hours a day, six days a week and is assisted by one employee. Mary currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy a sewing machine and materials for making clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, which enables them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Mwatanu

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Mwatanu G. from Mwanza. She is married with five children between the ages of six and fourteen years old. Mwatanu has been running a beauty salon since 2008. At her shop you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, or blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at her business for twelve hours a day, seven days a week and is assisted by two employees. Mwatanu currently earns about $300 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase woven and long hair, as well as women's shoes and clothing. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mwatanu thanks you for supporting her!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. loans.use: to buy woven and long hair plus women's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Happyness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Happiness B. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, aged two and four. Happiness has been running a café called Café/Mama Lishe since 2007. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), and plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for twelve hours a day, six days a week and is assisted by two employees. Happiness currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase rice, wheat flour, eggs and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Happiness thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.
