One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use their business equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, which enables them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To  purchase rice, wheat flour, eggs and cooking oil

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is twenty-three-year-old Valeria M. from Mwanza. Valeria has been making furniture since 2003. She sells chairs, tables, beds and doors. She works for twelve hours a day, six days a week, and is assisted by her husband. Valeria currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy lumber for making more furniture. In the future, she plans to increase her stock. Valeria thanks you for supporting her!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use their business equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, which enables them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy lumber for making furniture.

loans.name: Afsona

texts.en:
D. Afsona describes herself as a hard-working, enterprising and happy married mother of two children. Her husband is a laborer. She decided to start a sewing business to help him with household expenses, since she wanted her children to get an education and that wasn't possible on her husband's salary alone. She started out helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop, and after she learned the trade she was offered a job. As time went on, the owner passed away, and Afsona always remembered how the owner had encouraged her to start her own business. So that's what she did, installing a small shop in her home. It has gone very well since then, and she has been able to grow the business. In addition to her tailoring business, Afonsa also provides a service teaching young girls. Because of that, she became very well-known in her community and has many orders. Currently, Afsona is requesting a loan of $ 3000 USD for a term of 12 months, which she will use to purchase anew sewing machine with computer-based embroidery so she can fulfill all her customers' requests. Afsona and her family are very grateful for your support in helping grow this business and move ahead. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which was ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine with computer-based embroidery

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira T. is twenty-four years old. She and her husband have a two-year-old son and a tremendous desire to build a solid home and fill it with harmony. They also show a great deal of optimism and confidence in their agricultural endeavors, putting all their effort in the farming of vegetables, which they later offer to wholesalers. All this effort is paying off because they have recently started the construction of their own house. This has been a great source of motivation for them and so they want to improve the quality of their products through better use of fertilizers and seeds. They are requesting a loan of $800 which will help them finish the construction of their dream house.

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mostapha

texts.en: Mostapha K. is a 26-year-old single man living in Katarmaya, in Mount Lebanon.  He started working with his father at the age of 16 in scrap car parts.  Today, Mostapha owns his own business,  He wants to borrow $1,200 in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Ahrorjon

texts.en:
Ahrorjon A. is a 32-year-old farmer. He is married with four children. His wife works in the home and this leaves him the sole breadwinner. He has been farming for the last fifteen years on his piece of land growing potatoes, tomatoes and wheat. Ahrorjon would like to adopt new farming technology to boost his agricultural yield. He needs to be able to meet the financial responsibilities of educating the four children who are all in school, and to maintain his family, but he lacks the capital. Ahrorjon needs a $1075 loan to be used for purchasing seed and fertilizer in order to grow a good crop of wheat. He is very responsible and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
B. Faizullo is 54 years old, married, and lives with his wife and adult son. He works very hard at cultivating wheat, an activity which he has practiced for five years. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature, and also because wheat sells very well in the markets and is valued within his community. Currently Faizullo needs a loan of $675 for his business. With this loan, he will buy seed and fertilizers to improve his farm and get a larger crop.

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.en:
K. Kodirjon is a diligent and tenacious farmer who strives to provide for his family. His wife does not work, so he carries the burden of meeting his family's needs alone through his farming income. He works on a one-hectare farm owned by his parents. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming supplies, seeds and fertilizer require more capital, which he doesn't have. Kodirjon is relieved that IMON International will help him get the loan he needs to improve his farm. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. Kodirjon is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes will yield better results than his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs, and if there is still some money left, he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi K.  est une dame mariée avec 03 enfants, son mari est un soudeur, elle-même fait le commerce de charbons de bois, le charbon de bois est très utilisé par ceux qui n’ont pas de moyens pour s’acheter du gaz pour la cuisson, elle vend en détail et en gros à ses clients. La demande actuelle de sa clientèle est grande,pour pouvoir y satisfaire convenablement elle sollicite un crédit auprès de WAGES pour l’achat de sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Amivi K. is a married women with three children. Her husband is a welder. She herself does commerce in charcoal, which is much used by those who lack the means to buy propane for cooking. She sells at both the retail and wholesale levels. The current demand from her customers is high. To satisfy them approrpriately, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
In the previous year’s growing season, Bahodir K. was diligent in his fertilizer and pesticide-selling venture. During that season, Bahodir acquired adequate income which was used to improve his home and saved for the children’s education expenses. Since during the season he was diligently selling fertilizer, his land is nearly derelict. The current rainy season is an appropriate time for planting. Bahodir has taken the initiative to resume working on his land while selling fertilizer. He requires funds to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Bahodir is optimistic his venture will be successful and all the effort he has expended will better the family’s welfare.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: K. Adjo exerce comme activité la vente de charbons de bois qui est utilisé pour la préparation des aliments à Lomé, elle vend des charbons en gros et en détail aux bonnes dames de son quartier, elle vend aussi à crédit et vient récupérer plus tard son argent. Elle veut rehausser son stock par l’achat de sacs de charbons de bois raison pour laquelle elle demande  à WAGES un crédit. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est enseignant, ensemble ils ont 02 enfants.
texts.en:
K. Adjo sells charcoal, which is used in preparing food in Lomé. She sells at the wholesale and retail levels to the good women of her district. She also sells on credit and come to collect her money later on. She wants to replenish her stock by buying sacks of charcoal, which is why she's asking WAGES for a loan. She is married to a gentleman who is a teacher. Together they have two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell charcoal

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
K. Sobirjon is 42 years old and the father of 3 children who are all attending the local school. His wife is a housekeeper. Sobirjon owns a 0.5-hectare field for cultivating rice in order to earn for living. On this plantation, Sobirjon now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for rice seeds. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy rice seeds to cultivate. He will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support his field. Sobirjon counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, in order to improve the living conditions of his family.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Madame A. est une résidente du quartier d’agoè un quartier nord de la ville de lomé, cette dame a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’huile de palme qui est stocké dans des bidons. Cette huile est très utilisée dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer des sauces telles que l’adémé, la sauce gombo, etc… elle s’approvisionne au sud du Togo où cette huile est produite. Les bonnes dames de son village s’approvisionnent chez elle. Elle veut rehausser son stock pour accroître ses bénéfices, elle sollicite de wages un crédit pour l’achat d’huile de palme. Elle est mariée avec 03 personnes à charge.
texts.en:
Ms. A. is a resident of Agoè, a district in northern Lomé. This is a lady who works to earn an income. She does commerce in palm oil, which is stored in drums. This oil is much used in the cuisine of Togo for making sauces, such as adémé sauce, okra sauce, etc.... She stocks up in southern Togo, where this oil is produced. The good women of her village get their supplies at her place. She wants to replenish her stock in order to grow her profits. She's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy palm oil. She is married and has three people to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
N. Ahmad is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has dedicated himself to farming wheat and vegetables for more than 10 years. He enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is the preparation of land for planting and protecting the crop from insects that spoil his harvest.

Fortunately for Ahmad, wheat is in high demand in his area and fetches high prices at the market. This is his first loan from IMON International. He will use the money to buy seeds and fertilizer for his plots. Ahmad thanks all who are supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Abrorjon

texts.en:
Abrorjon P. is a young man that has dedicated himself to the livestock industry from his childhood. He has been characterized as a very spirited and strong person whose successes are directly applied to his young family, composed of his wife and a small son. The work he does in this sector is raising livestock for sale. It is necessary to point out that this is the only income that supports his family that really needs it. Today Abrorjon looks for support from IMON International to obtain the necessary loan to purchase cows to raise. With this loan his beloved family will benefit as much as he will.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en:
T. Gulomjon was born in 1984 in the Spitamen district, where he now works as a farmer. He is married and has a little son. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family.

Gulomjon owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer. The loan will greatly improve Gulomjon’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 57 year old woman who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Fatima has owned a grocery store for ten years. She requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Fatima is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients can be anybody. When she first started, she didn't face any problems. However, after the 2006 war, her store was destroyed. In the future, Fatima plans to improve her store.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en:
T. Shuhratjon is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He grows vegetables and sells them in the market for income. He has been working in this kind of business for almost 20 years and has gained much experience. Shuhratjon has a large family considering that he is living with his parents. With his large family, Shuhratjon works almost every day to generate revenues to support his family. Because his family relies on his vegetable growing business, Shuhratjon needs a loan to purchase necessary supplies for his current harvest and, in that way, earn enough money to support his family. This will be his first loan with IMON International and Kiva, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Chames Dine

texts.fr:
Née vers 1984 à Houinmè, dans le 4e Arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. M. Chames Dine est célibataire sans enfant. Chames Dine est gérant d’une petite unité de fabrication de pure water(c'est de l'eau potable conditionnée dans de sachets de 500ml). Cette activité lui est rentable mais face à la demande qui ne cesse de s'accroitre, Chames Dine a besoin de plus moyens financiers pour arriver à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Chames Dine sollicite donc un crédit pour augmenter sa capacité de production.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Chames Dine M. was born in Houinmè around 1984 in the 4th arrondissement of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. He is single and has no children. He runs a small company that makes pure water (which is potable water packaged in 500ml bags). This business is profitable for him, yet due to the ever-increasing demand, Chames Dine needs more financial means so he can satisfy customer demand. Chames Dime is therefore asking for a loan to increase his production capacity. The meaning of ALIDé in Fon, the local language of Benin, is “a path always exists for the poorest.” Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria, where the GDP per person is $1,500. ALIDé offers special zero-interest loans to needy persons and is part of a group that will soon launch a micro-health insurance program for those who receive microloans.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags

loans.name: Nghiêm Thị Phượng Group

texts.vi:
Nhóm chị Nghiêm Thị P. Ms 020201050051 năm nay 50 tuổi. Chị là một giáo viên nên ngoài việc dạy học ở trường ra chị có nhiều thời gian để chăm sóc gia đình và làm kinh doanh. Vợ chồng chị sinh được 2 con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình, 1 con đang theo học đại học. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay 4.256.000VNđ để mua gạo nấu rượu và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chồng chị giúp chị trong việc bán hàng và công việc chăn nuôi lợn. Gia đình chị rất thích hình thức vay trả này, vì nó giúp gia đình chị có điều kiện tích luỹ tiền, đồng thời có kế hoạch lo cho con ăn học. Chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn hết 1 chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, chu kỳ này các thành viên trong nhóm của chị vay mức vốn như sau:
 Chị Lê Thị T. năm nay 33 tuổi Ms 020201050052 chị đăng ký vay mức 3.808.000VNđ để bán hàng tạp hoá.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị X. năm nay 27 tuổi Ms 020201050053 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để thêm vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng mộc của gia đình.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 44 tuổi Ms 020201050054 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn. 
 Chị Lê Thị S. năm nay 52 tuổi Ms 020201050050 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để buôn bán hàng phế liệu.
texts.en:
This year Mrs. Nghiem Thi Phuong is 50 years old. She's a teacher. Besides teaching time at school, she has a lot of free time to take care of family and do some small business. Her husband and she have two children, one of whom has got married and moved out, while the other is in college. For this loan cycle she'd like to borrow 4,256,000 VND (or 245 USD) to buy rice to make wine and raise cattle. Everyday, Mrs. Phuong's husband also helps her with her store and the small farm. Her family loves the model of microcredit, because it enables to have small payments while still have some savings and plan to pay for their children's schooling. Mrs. Phuong and her group has fully repaid their first loan cycle. This time other members in Mrs. Phuong's group want to borrow at levels listed below: + Mrs. Le Thi Tan, 33 years old, wants to borrow 3,808,000 VND (or 220 USD) to sell sundry goods. + Mrs. Nguyen Thi X., 27 years old, wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (or 270 USD) to invest in her family's carpenter's shop. + Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 44 years old, wants to borrow 4,256,000 VND (or 245 USD) to raise pigs. + Mrs. Le Thi Soi, 52 years old, wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (or 270 USD) to buy and sell scrap metals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy rice and raise cattle

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan T. is a 54 year old man living in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hassan has owned a school van for two years and is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to do maintenance work on his van and pay his daughter's wedding expenses. 

This is his third loan cycle and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him purchase a school van. When he began his business he had difficulty building a network and finding students. He decided to create his business to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on purchasing another van.

loans.use: Hassan will use the loan for maintenance work on the van and pay his daughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Solijon

texts.en:
Committed to his family and his business, U. Solijon, works very hard at ranching. His has his own herd of cattle and works in the field every day to earn a living to support his dear wife and two children. As every business requires investment, Solijon needs some young bulls, which will be raised and sold. For this reason, he turns to IMON International again, to obtain a loan which will allow him to acquire cattle and help him improve the standard of living for his beloved family.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Allakanson Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Allakanson (toutes mariées) ont en moyenne 34 ans,  3 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou Préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes qui font le commerce d’articles divers sont à leur premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec  Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce prêt leur permettra d’acheter, 500 kg de céréales (mil, mais, fonio, haricot) et 200 kg de condiments alimentaires composés surtout de légumes. 
Elles s’approvisionnent les jours de foire à Koumantou auprès des paysans producteurs pour les céréales et des forains venant de Sikasso pour les condiments alimentaires. La vente se fait en détail, au comptant et à crédit à Koumantou tout au long de la semaine avec une clientèle  composée exclusivement de femmes.
Les membres de Allakanson espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000 à 30.000 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face à certaines dépenses du foyer.
Les femmes espèrent continuer le partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir satisfaire leur clientèle et faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The women of the Allakanson group (all married) have an average age of 34, 3 children, and live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, Prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women sell various items and are on their first solidarity loan (group loan) with Soro Yiriwaso. This loan will permit them to buy 500 kg of cereals (millet, maize, "fonio"--a local grain similar to millet--and dried beans) and 200 kg of condiments, composed mainly of vegetables.

They buy their merchandise on weekly market days in Koumantou from farmers who produce the cereals and from merchants who come from Sikasso to sell at the weekly market fair, in so far as the condiments are concerned. They sell retail, for cash or credit, in Koumantou, all week long, to a clientele composed exclusively of women.

Each of the members of Allakanson group hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 to 30,000 F CFA with which they will repay the interest on the loan and pay certain expenses for their households.

The women hope to continue their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy their clientele and make more profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing various items for re-sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad M. is 23 years old, who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon. Mohamad has owned a mobile phone for four years. He sells and repairs mobile phones and sells phone accessories. Mohamad is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop.

This is his second loan and has always paid on time.Mohamad's previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He created his business to improve his financial situation and plans on expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Laidou de l’association Sabaly est constitué de deux veuves et deux célibataires qui ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants,    vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou Préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes sont au  début de leur partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso,  elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Le présent prêt servira à acheter, 200 kg de céréales, 25 kg de feuille de rônier, et de l’encre pour faire des paniers destinés à la vente en gros. 
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des agriculteurs des villages environnants. La vente est faite quotidiennement au marché de Koumantou et en gros aux forains venant des grandes villes. La clientèle est surtout composée de femmes.
De ces activités les membres du groupe Laïdou  envisagent gagner chacune en moyenne 12.500 FCFA par mois. Ce montant leur permettra de rembourser l’échéance mensuelle du prêt et satisfaire quelques dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group, part of the Sabaly association, is made up of two widows and two unmarried women, who have an average age of 36, 4 children, and live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, Bougouni Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women are at the beginning of their partnership with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso; they are on their first solidarity loan (group loan). This loan will be used to buy 200 kg of cereals, 25 kg of palm fronds, and ink to make baskets destined for wholesale.

They do their buying from farmers in the surrounding villages. They sell retail daily in the market of Koumantou and wholesale to itinerant merchants coming from the big towns. Their clientele is mainly composed of women. From their businesses, each of the members of the Laïdou group expects to make an average of 12,500 F CFA per month. This amount will permit them to make the monthly payment on the loan and cover some family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for sale and for crafts

loans.name: Koeut's Group

texts.en:
Koeut S. is 31 years old and a group leader for loan borrowers, consisting of 4 members. She is a mother of three children: all are students. She is married to Duong, 37, who works as a garden worker in the private sector. S. sells fish and vegetables in the market. She gets up early in the morning and goes to the riverside where fish and vegetables are sold in bulk and then hurries to the market to sell them for a good price. She is requesting a loan to buy hundreds of kilos of fish and fermented fish sauce (Khmer cheese) because this the fishing season. She has been selling in the market since 2000.

The other members are: Ork S., 47, who sells vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to buy fish and fermented fish sauce. Koeut S., 27, who sells fermented fish sauce and is needs a loan to buy more fermented fish sauce for her shop. And Horm K. S., 21, who is a local construction worker requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for his work. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy hundreds of kilos of fish and fermented fish sauce (Khmer cheese)

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad T. is 37 years old who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Asaad has been working as a car repair man for four years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his garage.

This is Asaad's first loan. Asaad does his work really well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage. Asaad decided to create his business because of his experience and plans on expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Narodje Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Narodje sont toutes mariées, avec en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants, elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes sont partenaires de Soro Yiriwaso depuis un an et demi. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et ont correctement remboursé les deux précédents prêts.
Le présent prêt est destiné à acheter, 100 kg de bananes et 150 kg de céréales (arachides, riz). Tandis que les vendeuses de bananes s’approvisionnent auprès des commerçants venant de Sikasso  les  jours de foire, les vendeuses de céréales achètent avec les agriculteurs des villages environnants.
De ces commerces les femmes du groupe Narodje espèrent avoir une marge bénéficiaire de 7.500 FCFA par mois. Cette somme leurs permettra de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de satisfaire à quelques dépenses liées surtout aux enfants (éducation, santé, habillement).
texts.en:
The women of the Narodje group are all married, with an average age of 37 and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, Bougouni Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for a year and a half. They are on their third solidarity loan (group loan) and have correctly reimbursed the two preceding loans.

This loan is intended to purchase 100 kg of bananas and 150 kg of cereals (peanuts and rice). Whereas the women selling bananas buy their goods from merchants coming from Sikasso on market days, the women selling cereals buy from the growers in surrounding villages.

From their sales, the women of the Narodje group hope to make a profit of 7,500 F CFA per month. This sum will allow them to make repayments on the loan and cover certain family expenses, especially relative to their children (education, health, and clothing).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 33-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hassan has been working as a car repairer for twelve years. He also sells spare parts. Hassan requested a loan of $1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase spare car parts for his garage. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan.
Hassan is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage. Hassan decided on doing this business because of his experience; he also needed to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts for his garage.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị N. năm nay 40 tuổi Ms 020201050061, vợ chồng chị sinh được 2 con, 1 con đang đi học lái xe và 1 con đang đi học cấp II. Hàng ngày chồng chị lái xe đi chở hàng thuê, còn chị đi chợ thu mua phế liệu, mua bao bì về may rồi bán. Chính vì vậy mà chị rất thích hình thức vay trả này, bởi nó phù hợp với điều kiện của gia đình chị có thu nhập nhỏ lẻ và thường xuyên. Chị đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để có thêm nguồn vốn đi chợ, tạo thêm thu nhập để có điều kiện nuôi các con ăn học
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. is 40 years old (ID: 020201050061). She has two children: one of them is learning to be a driver, and the other is at secondary school. Everyday, her husband, a truck driver, provides goods transportation service, and she collects scrap materials and buys packaging bags to sew to resell. She is interested in the installment repayment, because it suits her family's situation that has small but regular income.

She wishes to borrow VND 3,186,000 to have more working capital, to earn extra income to pay for the children's tuition and living cost.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for trading

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr:
D. Nathalie est née en 1963 à Porto-Novo, dans le 4e arrondissement de la capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Nathalie est mère de cinq (05) enfants dont quatre (04) scolarisés. Nathalie est vendeuse de maïs, une activité qu’elle mène passionnément pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, Nathalie mène comme activité secondaire la vente de l'huile de palme et sodabi-boisson alcoolisée fabriquée localement- qu’elle distribue à ses clients à domicile. Mais Nathalie ne dispose pas d'assez de moyens financiers pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus. Pour ce fait, Nathalie sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Nathalie D. was born in 1963 in Porto-Novo, in the 4th arrondissement of the administrative and political capital of Benin. Nathalie has five children, four of which are in school. Nathalie sells corn, a business in which she passionately participates so she can help her husband with the family expenses. In order to diversify her sources of income, Nathalie also sells palm oil and sodabi, a locally-made alcoholic drink, which she sells to her clients from home. However, Nathalie does not have the necessary financial means to effectively run her business and make money. To do this, Nathalie is requesting a loan to increase her working capital. The meaning of ALIDé in Fon, the local language of Benin, is “a path always exists for the poorest.” Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria, where the GDP per person is $1,500. ALIDé offers special zero-interest loans to needy persons and is part of a group that will soon launch a micro-health insurance program for those who receive microloans.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of corn and cansof oil.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont tous mariés, âgés de 32 ans et mères en moyenne  de 3 enfants. Ils vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tabacoro préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Unies par les liens du voisinage, ces femmes font le commerce d’articles divers.
Elles sont en partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis un an et demi et  sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Elles ont correctement remboursé tous les prêts précédents.
Ce prêt servira à acheter exclusivement, 200 kg de céréales (arachides, mais, haricot) auprès des paysans producteurs. Ces céréales sont ensuite vendues en détail et essentiellement au comptant  à une clientèle majoritairement composée de ménagères de Koumantou et de Tabacoro.
De cette activité les femmes espèrent gagnent en moyenne 10.000 FCFA par mois. Cette marge bénéficiaire leurs permettra de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et d’assurer certaines dépenses de la famille (éducation, habillement, santé).
texts.en:
The members of the Sabougnouma group are all married, have an average age of 32, and are mothers of, on average, 3 children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Tabacoro, Bougouni Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by ties of neighborhood, these women sell various items. They have had a partnership with Soro Yiriwaso for a year and a half and are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). They have correctly reimbursed all the preceding loans. This loan will be used exclusively to buy 200 kg of cereals (peanuts, maize, and dried beans) from the farmers who produce them. These cereals are then retailed, and essentially for cash, to a clientele mainly composed of housewives from Koumantou and Tabacoro.

From their businesses each of the women hopes to earn on average 10,000 F CFA per month. This profit will allow them to reimburse the loan and cover certain family expenses (education, clothing, health).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals

loans.name: Kadiatou  Bouaré

texts.fr:
Madame K.  Bouaré   est âgée de 35 ans,  veuve et mère de  5  enfants, elle vit  dans une grande  famille avec  sa mère,  ses frères et sœurs au  quartier Sécoura de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Informaticienne et transitaire de formation, K. est également commerçante. Elle a appris le commerce auprès de sa mère qui  est très versée dans les activités économiques  à Ségou. K. mène plusieurs  activités qui vont de la gestion d’une entreprise, au commerce de céréales et d’habits. C’est dans le commerce d’habits teintés qu’elle mène depuis 8 ans et dans lequel elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’une grande notoriété, qu’elle excelle le plus. Elle reçoit des commandes de la  Coté d’ivoire et de la  France.
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en France qu’elle  fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. En  relation avec cette dernière depuis 56 mois, après 8 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien  remboursés, elle est son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter 2 pièces de bazins riches et 10 couleurs de teintures. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui lui servira à subvenir à ses propres besoins et contribuer aux charges de la grande famille.
Son ambition est d’ouvrir un magasin pour faire le commerce de céréales sinon du ciment ou du fer à béton.
texts.en:
Ms. K. Bouaré, age 35, is a widow and the mother of 5 children. She lives in a large family with her mother, brothers, and sisters in the Ségou district (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A data processor and shipping agent by training, she is also a merchant. She learned commerce from her mother, who is well-versed in business in Ségou. K. works in several sectors, from enterprise management to commerce in grain and in clothing. For eight years, she’s been in the business of dyed clothing, in which she excels the most and enjoys many customers and fine distinction. She receives orders from Cote d’Ivoire and from France.

Concerned with satisfying her customers in France, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she has had an association with for 56 months. After 8 solidarity loans and 2 individual loans, all correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 2 bolts of rich damask fabric and 10 different colors of dyes. Supplies of essential goods are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali) and are sold to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will serve to provide for herself and her large family. Her ambition is to open a store to do commerce in grain, otherwise in cement or in iron rods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of damask fabric and dyes

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
S. T. is 21 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. He is a father of a young child. He is married to Len, age 23, who sells different kinds of sweets along the street in her cart. 

S. T. has been selling charcoal to the whole community for more than three years. He is famous for his service and his responsibility. He is taking a loan of $ 300 to buy hundreds of kilos of charcoal for his shop so that he can earn with a great retail price during the upcoming Khmer New Year eves. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy hundreds of kilos of charcoal for his shop

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри женщина в возросте 50 лет , мать четверых детей. Муж пенсионер, занимается уходом за скотом. Сама Мехри занимается бизнесом продажи красивых тканей, для пошива национальных платьев. Её оборотный капитал   составляет около 8000 сомони. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 15 лет, её источник доставки товаров город Бишкек.  Для очередной поездки за товаром её не хватает  денежных средств, для большего закупа весеннего товара, и Мехри подала очередную заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Mehri is a 50-year-old woman, the mother of four children. Her husband is retired, and raises cattle. Mehri herself has a business selling beautiful fabric for sewing traditional clothing. She only has 8000 somoni in working capital. She has been in this business for the past 15 years, and buys her fabrics in Bishkek. She does not have enough money to make her next trip to buy merchandise, a large purchase of fabric for spring, so Mehri has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariam   D.  est âgée de 51 ans,  veuve et mère de  5  enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame avec  sa coépouse et leurs enfants au quartier Pelengana Nord de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école prématurément, elle commença très tôt  les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui commercialisait les céréales. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités, elle finit par opter pour le commerce d’habits, de chaussures, de couvertures et de draps de lit. Elle mène ce commerce depuis 15 ans et jouit d’une grande popularité et célébrité  dans le quartier.
Dans le souci de renforcer et  diversifier son activité, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance avec qui elle est en relation depuis 30 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et  2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien  remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle  utilisera ce prêt pour acheter, 20 paires de couvertures et draps de lit, 10 paires de chaussures et 10 complets de pagnes brodés. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako ou au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et  de femmes.  
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100. 000FCFA  lequel lui permettra de payer les frais de scolarité et de mutualité de ses enfants. 
Son ambition est de construire son terrain nu en usage d’habitation
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam D., age 51, is a widow and the mother of 5 children. She lives in a polygamous family with her co-wife and their children in the Pelengana Nord district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having abandoned school prematurely, she very soon started working to earn an income. She learned this from her mother, who used to market grain. After having done several kinds of work, she ended up choosing commerce in clothing, shoes, blankets, and bed sheets. She’s been in this business for 15 years and enjoys much popularity and fame in her area.

Concerned with bolstering and diversifying her business, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she has had an association with for 30 months. After 3 solidarity loans (group loans) and 2 individual loans, all correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. She will use this loan to buy 20 sets of blankets and bed sheets, 10 pairs of shoes, and 10 outfits of embroidered pagnes. Supplies are gotten in Bamako or in Burkina Faso, and sales are made to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay the school costs and insurance for her children. Her ambition is to clear a plot of land for living on.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Aid

texts.en:
Aid is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in Southern Lebanon with his wife. Aid owns a bakery. He makes "mankoucheh," which looks like a folded pizza and is most often topped with zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it at anytime of the day but, somehow, it tastes better in the morning. 

Aid has requested a loan of $500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase raw material for his work. This is the first time that Aid has requested a loan.

Aid is distinguished in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. His clients are people from his area. Aid chose his business because he always wanted to open a bakery and has experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Aid will use the loan to purchase raw material for his work.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 23-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in Southern Lebanon. Marwan has ben working as an electrician for three years. He deals mainly with houses. Marwan has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Marwan has requested a loan.
Marwan is distinguished in his work because he does well. His clients are people from his region. When Marwan first strated his business, he didn't have the startup capital. He chose his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expan his business by working on bigger projects.

loans.use: Marwan will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru:
Сабоат , клиентка в Микроинвесте третий год. Она пунктуально погашает свои займы.
Её ассортимент состоит из материй. Каждый  свой кредит она использует целенаправленно, для расширения бизнеса, поэтому для закупа весеннего ассортимента 
Сабоат подала очередную заявку.
Её точка продажи расположена на рынке Худжанда, на Паншанбе.
texts.en:
Saboat has been a MicroInvest client for three years. She repays her loans on time. She sells material. She uses each loan purposefully to expand her business. She has submitted a loan request to buy inventory for spring. She sells her goods in Panshanbe market in Khojand.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabrics

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
D. Célestine est née en 1978 à Gamgban dans la commune d'Adjohoun. Célestine est mariée et a deux (02) enfants. Célestine habite avec son mari à Houinmè dans le 4e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Célestine est une coiffeuse et vend également des produits de coiffure. Pour s’approvisionner à temps afin de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle, Célestine a besoin de crédit. C'est pourquoi Célestine s'est dirigée vers ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Célestine D. was born in 1978 in Gamgban in the commune of Adjohoun. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in Houinmè in the 4th arrondissement of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. She is a hairdresser and also sells haircare products. Célestine is requesting a loan so she can purchase enough stock to effectively meet customer demand. This is why Célestine came to ALIDé.

The meaning of ALIDé in Fon, the local language of Benin, is “a path always exists for the poorest.” Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria, where the GDP per person is $1,500. ALIDé offers special zero-interest loans to needy persons and is part of a group that will soon launch a micro-health insurance program for those who receive microloans.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and various haircare products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad A. Z. is a 39-year-old married man with two children who lives in Shakra, in Nabatieh.  He used to work in a telephone and mobile shop since 1990, but in 2000 he opened his own shop.  Today, Mohammad wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy postpaid recharge cards.

loans.use: Buy postpaid recharge cards.

loans.name: Teb

texts.en:
S. is 27 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She is a mother of a young child. She is married to Vuthy, 30, who works in the harbor. 

S. sells different kinds of snack food along Mekong River harbor. She gets up in the early morning to prepare the food, such as bananas, cake, and children's sweets, which she always buys from the farmers. She is taking a loan of $150 to build a small shop for her busienss. The loan will help the family earn a good income. She dreams of having her child earn a degree.

loans.use: To build a small shop for her business

loans.name: Hikmatoy

texts.ru:
Хикматой женщина 38 лет , мать троих детей, муж работает на рынке поваром в столовой.
Пять лет назад Хикматой работала в детском саду няней.   из-за того, что зарплата очень низкая её сестра устроила у себя в магазине продавщицей. Хикматой уволилась с работы и начала работать вместе с сестрой. Два года  Хикматой работала на зарплату у сестры. После , её муж дал её финансы на открытие своего бизнеса. Хикматой вначале ездила за товаром вместе со своей сестрой. Научившись закупу, Хикматой теперь самостоятельно стала работать. Её  ассортимент состоит из женского  нижнего белья. Для увеличения весенне- летнего  ассортимента Хикматой решила попробовать взять кредит.
texts.en:
Hikmatoy is 38 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband works at the market as a cook in a cafeteria. Five years ago, Hikmatoy worked in a kindergarten as a childcare provider. The salary was very low, so her sister arranged for Hikmatoy to work with her in a shop as a saleswoman. Hikmatoy quit her job and started to work with her sister. For two years, Hikmatoy worked with her sister for a salary. Later, her husband gave her money to open a business. In the beginning, Hikmatoy went in on the business with her sister. Then, having learned about sales, Hikmatoy began to work independently. Her inventory consists of female underwear. Hikmatoy has decided to take out a loan to increase her inventory of spring-summer goods.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: women's underwear

loans.name: Musabe

texts.ru: Мусабе 34 летняя женщина , которая уже 10 лет как занимается продажей нижнего женского белья. Троих детей. Муж Мусабехон имеет  работает водителем городского такси. Сама Мусабе ездит за товаром в Бишкек. Её ларёк расположен на центральном рынке города Худжанда. Мусабе обратилась в Микроинвест за кредитом, для увеличения товарооборота. Проведя мониторинг было выяснено , что у Мусабе стабильная продажа и по моральному облику она подходит как клиент фонда.
texts.en:
Musabe is a 34-year-old woman who has sold women’s underwear for ten years. She has three children. Her husband is a city taxi driver. Musabe goes by herself to Bishkek to buy goods. Her market stall is located in the central market of Khojand. Musabe has approached MicroInvest for a loan to increase sales. MicroInvest’s research has discovered that Musabe’s sales are stable, and her strong moral fiber makes her a good fit for the program.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: women's underwear

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза 27 летняя женщина, мать двоих детей. Муж уже третий год на заработках в Российской Федерации. Шахноза сама занимается бизнесом откормом и продажей коз и козьей шерсти.У неё сейчас около 20 голов коз, белых как молоко. Шерсть белых козочек очень ценится на рынке, из них получаются очень красивые носки .  Шахноза сама прядет шесть и продаёт своим постоянным клиентам. Шахноза получив  займ,  хочет купить прядилку и несколько коз.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a 27-year-old woman, a mother of two children. Her husband is in his third year of working in the Russian Federation. Shahnoza works fattening goats and selling them and their wool. She now has around twenty goats which are white as milk. The wool of white nanny goats is very much in demand in the market since that wool makes very beautiful socks. Shahnoza spins the wool herself and sells it to her regular customers. When Shahnoza receives the loan, she would like to buy a spinning wheel and some goats.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling goats

loans.name: Pang

texts.en: Pang S., 29, lives in Siem Reap Province and is the mother of a young child. She is married to Vibol, 28, who works as an electrical repairer throughout the community. S. is employed as a cook in a restaurant because she is good at making a tasty cuisine. Whenever there is free time from her work, she always sells soft drinks like coke, pure drinking water, fruit juice, etc., to the villagers. She recently came up with the idea of having a small shop from which she could sell part time, so that she could earn more income. Hence, S. is looking for a loan of $200 to buy or build a small shop and to buy more products to sell. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy or build a small shop and to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Abbas has owned a tractor since 1990. He transports things for construction. He has requested a loan of $660 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase bigger tires for his tractor. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him do some maintenance work on his tractor. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn't have the amount of startup capital he desired. However, in the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase bigger tires for his tractor.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 42 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Abdallah has owned a home products shop for twenty years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Abdallah is speciA. in his work because he sells a wide variety of items and has a good relationship with his clients. His clients could be anybody. When Abdallah first started his business, he didn't have the startup capitA.. He decided on his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Хасанова Мавчуда , женщина в возрасте 44 лет, разведена имеет двоих взрослых детей. Один её сын на заработках в России. Другой учится в высшем учебном заведении. Сама Мавчуда имеет бизнес продажи мелкой продажи( носки , нижнее бельё, колготки, полотенца, и.т.д.)  За товаром ездит сама в Истаравшан. Мавчуда хочет увеличить оборотный капитал при помощи кредита. Для чего она обратилась в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Mavjuda H. is a 44 year old woman, she is divorced and has two grown children. One of her sons is earning money in Russia. The other one is studying at an institution of higher learning. Mavjuda has a business selling small items (socks, underwear, pantyhose, towels, etc.). She travels by herself to Istaravshan for her products. Mavjuda would like to increase her working capital with the help of a loan. This is why she turned to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr:
M. Clémentine est née le 23/11/1986 à Cotonou. Clémentine est mariée à  AHOUANDJINOU Ulrich. Clémentine n'a pas encore eu d'enfant , mais elle a la charge d'une cousine, apprentie couturière.  Depuis 7 mois, Clémentine vend des produits de mercerie. Initialement, Clémentine vendait des pagnes, des sacs de sortie et des chaussures. Cette activité, elle a fini par l'abandonner n'y trouvant vraiment  pas de profit à la hauteur de ses attentes. Ainsi, après avoir réuni un capital d'un million de francs CFA sur son compte épargne, Clémentine a ouvert sa boutique pour y vendre les articles de mercerie. Clémentine a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. Clémentine compte par ce troisième prêt qu'elle demande renforcer son activité  en constituant un stock plus important des divers articles qu'elle vend (entre autres: viseline, bouton, fermeture, popeline, etc.).

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
M. Clémentine was born on November 23, 1986 in Cotonou. She is married to AHOUANDJINOU Ulrich and doesn't yet have children. But she supports a cousin, an apprentice seamstress. For seven months, Clémentine has been selling sewing supplies. Initially, she used to sell pagnes (colorful West African cloth), handbags, and shoes. She ended up dropping that business because she wasn't really deriving enough profit to meet her expectations. So, after having accumulated a million francs CFA in capital in her savings account, she opened her shop for selling sewing supplies. She has already had two loans with ALIDE. With this third loan, she intends to bolster her business by building a bigger stock of various goods that she sells (including: viseline, buttons, zippers, poplin, etc.)

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 rolls of viseline, 10 rolls of poplin, 20 packets of zippers, 5 packets of trimming, 30 bags of buttons

loans.name: Mahkamboi

texts.ru:
Кенчаев Махкамбой  1967 года рождения имеет 3 детей. Он работает  в больнице медбратом и изза маленькой заработной платы он торгует  лекарствами в аптеке. Опыт  торговли 15 лет . С микроинвест начал сотрудничать несколько дней назад. 
Он получает кредит для расширения  ассортимента в  аптеке. Товар ему привозят поставшики, так ему выгодно потому что он не тратиться на дорогу.
texts.en:
Mahkamboi K. was born in 1967 and has three children. He works in hospital as a nurse, and because of the low pay, he sells medicines in a drugstore. He has fifteen years of sales experience. He started working with MicroInvest several days ago. He wants to take out the loan to expand the inventory in the drugstore. Suppliers bring him his goods, which is good for him since he need not spend time traveling.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Муаззам клиентка в Микроинвесте уже третий год.Она каждый займ использует для завоза товаров.Следующий займ она хочет погашать в течении 8 месяцев, т.к. её оборот на сегодня достаточен для частого пополнения.Она говорит, что при необходимости она даст заявку на параллельный займ.В течении трёх лет кредитования по словам Муаззам, ей удалось расширить свой оборот в несколько раз,у неё была одна точка , а на сегодня три, где торгуют её сыновья.Муаззам благодарна Микроинвест и KIVA за поддержку.
texts.en:
Muazzam is in her third year as a MicroInvest client. She uses her loans to procure goods. She wants to repay the loan in eight months. Her sales are good enough that she must restock often. She says that if necessary, she will request a secondary loan. During three years of taking out loans, according to Muazzam, she has managed to expand sales several times. She had one shop, and now she has three in which her sons work. Muazzam is grateful to Kiva and MicroInvest for their support.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: women's shoes

loans.name: Uitumen

texts.en: Uitumen C. requested a loan to purchase spare parts for his microbus.  He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, with his wife and nine year-old son, a third grade student.  His wife is a high school teacher. Uitumen started a small transportation business in 2006. He has been driving a small passenger microbus between two suburban areas: Denjiin Myanga and Uliastay.  Thanks to the success of his business, he has hired a bus conductor at 10,000 MNT a day ($1=MNT 1,600).  With his profit, he has been able to upgrade his microbus.  He is quite an entrepreneurial man and was trained as a lawyer at a younger age.   He hopes to one day build a house for his family on a small plot of land he owns.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his microbus.

loans.name: Chourouk

texts.en: Chourouk is a 22 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon.  Chourouk has worked as a hairdresser for four years.  She also sells beauty products.  Chourouk requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua to purchase products.  This is the first time Chourouk has requested a loan.  Chourouk is special because she knows how to deal with clients and is aware of the haircut fashions.  Her clients are women from the region.  When Chourouk first started her business, she didn't have start up capital.  She decided to go into business because she had experience.  In the future, Chourouk plans on open a beauty products shop.

loans.use: Purchase products for her salon.

loans.name: Hatanbaatar

texts.en:
Hatanbaatar Tuvshibayar lives with his wife and a three year old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their son goes to kindergarten.  The photo is of his wife, Munhsarnay at their family business.

With his wife, Hatanbaatar took over his parents' small fresh-vegetable retail business, in a food market in Sharhad, one of the most remote areas of Ulaanbaatar.  They have requested a loan to buy more vegetables and other food products.

Hatanbaatar always wanted an apartment with hot running water before his son was born.  Although it did not come true, he hopes to one day be able to afford an apartment for his family.  His wife, Munhsarnay dreams of running a bakery shop to increase the family income.

loans.use: Buy more vegetables and other food products.

loans.name: Chu's Group

texts.vi:
Chị Chu Thị B. H. năm nay 30 tuổi Ms 020206030001, chị tham gia vay vốn qua 1 chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt. Chu kỳ này chị lại đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để đầu tư vào việc kinh doanh thức ăn gia súc của gia đình. Còn chồng chị làm thợ cai xây dựng, 3 con còn nhỏ, nên ngoài việc kinh doanh ra chị còn luôn giành thời gian chăm sóc gia đình. Vợ chồng và các thành viên trong nhóm chị rất thích tham gia hình thức vay  trả này vì không phải trả 1 gánh nặng dồn vào cùng một lúc, đồng thời có điều kiện tích luỹ nuôi con ăn học.
 Chị Lưu Thị B. năm nay 36 tuổi Ms 020206030002 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000VNđ để mua cám chăn nuôi gà đẻ trứng.
 Chị Đinh Thị T. năm nay 59 tuổi Ms 020206030003 chị đăng ký vay mức 3.808.000VNđ  để mua cám chăn lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị V. năm nay 34 tuổi Ms 020206030004 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000 VNđ để đi chợ và nổ bỏng ngô.
 Chị Bùi Thị H. T. năm nay 23 tuổi Ms 020206030005 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000 VNđ để đi chợ và nổ bổng ngô.
texts.en:
Mrs. Chu Thi Bich Hang is 30 years old (ID:020206030001). She borrowed one loan and had a very good repayment record. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 4,704,000 to invest in trading livestock foods. Her husband is a construction supervisor. She has three small children, therefore apart from work she has to spend time taking care the family. She and other members are interested in the installment repayment mechanism as it does not require one large amount repayment, and it creates extra income to pay for the kids' tuition and board . Ms. Luu Thi Bac, 36 years old (ID 020206030002), wishes to borrow VND 4,256,000 to buy foods for hens. Ms. Dinh Thi Tap, 59 years old (ID 020206030003) wishes to borrow VND3,808,000 to buy foods for pigs. Ms. Nguyen Thi Van, 34 years old (ID 020206030004) wishes to borrow VND 4,704,000 for petty trade and selling porpcorn. Ms. Bui Thi Huyen T., 23 years old (ID 020206030005) wishes to borrow VND 4,704,000 for petty trade and selling porpcorn.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in trading livestock foods

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 22 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon. Hussein has owned a cassette, CD and DVD shop for a year. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan.

Hussein is special in his work because he is always aware of new releases. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When Hussein first started his business, he didn't have the startup capital. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Leader of the group of three members, C., 37, is the mother of three children: all of them are students. She is married to Soeung, 44, who is a local farmer. C. sells different kinds of vegetables such as cucumbers, salad, potatoes, etc., and has done so for more than one year. She obtains a good profit from her selling because her store is located in the busy market and because of her responsibility. She is taking a loan to hire a medium-sized plot of farmland for her husband to plant rice.

The other members of the group are: L., 37, who sells vegetables in the market, and is taking a loan to buy a field truck for her husband; and C., 49, who raises piglets, chickens, and ducks and is taking a loan to hire a truck for her husband’s farm work.

loans.use: To hire a plot of farmland for her husband to plant rice

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is Forty-nine year old Ashura M. from Mwanza. She is married, with four children between the ages of twenty two and twenty eight. Ashura has been running a restaurant and soft drinks business since 2006. The business sells food and soft drinks like Coca Cola, Pepsi, and water. She works at the business for sixteen hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by his husband. Ashura currently earns about 370 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Ashura thanks you for her support

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 29 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Maha has been selling canned food for ten years.  She requests a loan of $500 to purchase raw material for food production. This is the first time Maha has requested a loan. 
Maha is special because she produces the food and is known for good quality.  Her clients are friends, neighbors and others.  When she first started her business, she didn't know how to deal with markets and competitive prices.  In the future, Maha plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for food production.

loans.name: Chikita

texts.fr:
F. Chikita est née le 30/08/1976 à Cotonou. F. Chikita est couturière. F. Chikita est mariée à QUENUM Eric; elle a un enfant, Darick qui a 5 ans et est scolarisé. Chikita a ouvert son atelier de couture depuis l'an 2000. Parallèlement à la couture, Chikita vend de divers articles: les tissus bazins fabriqués et importés de Mali, un pays de l'Afrique de l'Ouest. Chikita vend aussi des chaussures. Chikita a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. Chikita a connu une amélioration de son commerce grâce à ces deux crédits. Chikita demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son étalage de tissus bazin qu'elle reçoit de ses fournisseurs maliens. Aussi Chikita veut parvenir à réunir les moyens financiers nécessaires pour aller s'approvisionner elle-même au Mali afin de fidéliser davantage sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
F. Chikita was born on August 30, 1976 in Cotonou. She is a seamstress and is married to QUENUM Eric. She has one child, Darick, age 5, who is in school. Chikita opened her sewing workshop in 2000. Along with sewing, she sells various items: damask fabrics made in and imported from Mali, a West African country. She also sells shoes. Chikita has already had two loans with ALIDE. She has experience improvement in her business, thanks to these two loans. She's asking for a third one for enhancing her display of damask that she receives from her Mali suppliers. She also wants to gather the financial means necessary for going to Mali herself to get supplies, so as to earn more loyalty from her customers.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 150 meters of damask fabric

loans.name: Saly

texts.fr: Madame Saly F. est une femme mariée.  Elle habite au quartier Medinatoul de Diourbel.  Elle mène le commerce des legumes, des fruits et des arrachides au marché de Diourbel.  Avec ce crédit elle renforce son activité dont les revenues vont servis à régler ses besoins sociaux et de soutenir son mari à entretenir sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Saly F. is a married women who lives in the Medinatoul district of Diourbel. She does commerce in vegetables, fruit, and peanuts at the Diourbel market. With this loan, she is bolstering her business. The profits from it will be used to meet her societal needs and to support her husband in caring for her small family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Chuluunbayar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar C. lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  His two children go to a local kindergarten.

Chuluunbaatar has a degree in software engineering from the Mongolian University of Information and Technology.  With the valuable knowledge he gained from his degree, he started a small retail business selling computers and computer-related accessories.  Since its inception in 2002, his business has been doing pretty well.  He now has a stable base of return customers.  He requests a loan to import cheap computers from neighboring China.  Chuluunbaatar dreams of one day having a large, full-service computer center. 

His wife also runs a retail business, in construction and development, with about 1,000,000 MNT of capital ($1=MNT 1,600).

Chuluunbaatar and his wife would like to expand their businesses, as far as their capital allows.  Their hope is to make sure they will be able to afford their children's college tuition.

loans.use: Import computers.

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr: Madame SAYE D. est une femme mariée qui habite au quartier Medinatoul de Diourbel.  Son activité principale est le commerce de céréales locales comme les arachides transformées en huile.  Avec ce prêt elle renforce ses marchandises qu’elle revend au marché de Diourbel.  Elle aide son mari à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. SAYE is a married woman who lives in the Medinatoul neighborhood in Diourbel. Her main business consists in selling local cereals, such as peanuts, transformed into oil. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock, that she sells at the market in Diourbel. She helps her husband to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local cereals

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein Y. is a 20 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon.  Hussein has been working as a floor polisher for three years.  He requests a loan of $1000 US dollars to purchase tools for work.  This is the first time he has requested a loan.  Hussein is special because he does his work well.  His clients come from the region. When Hussein first started his business, he didn't have start up capital. He decided to go into business because of his experience.  Hussein plans on expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase tools for work.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali M. is a 30 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children.  Ali has worked as a mason for ten years.  He requests a loan of $1000 to purchase tools for work.  This is his second loan and he has always paid on time.  Ali's previous loan helped him improve his business.  He is special because he does his work well.  His clients are people from the region.  When Ali first started his business, he didn't have start up capital.  He plans to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase tools for work.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 22-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Bilal has been working as a floor polisher for three years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Bilal has requested a loan.

Bilal is special in his work because he does it well and because of his punctuality. His clients can be anybody from his region. When Bilal first started his business, he didn't have the startup capital. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Elie

texts.fr:
A. Elie est né vers 1972 à Aguégué, un îlot encâblé dans le département de l'Atlantique au sud du Bénin. A. Elie est marié et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elie a commencé ses activités depuis 20 ans. Au départ, Elie était pêcheur: il allait à la pêche avec son jeune frère Isaac. Seulement cette activité de pêche ne lui est pas très rentable. Il y a de cela cinq ans, Elie a décidé d'associer une autre activité à la pêche. Elie s'adonne maintement à la vente de sable. Elie a en effet engagé des amis qui vont recueillir le sable dans la lagune de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin avec des barques.
