Elie a déjà eu deux crédits avec ALIDé, avec lesquels il a vu son niveau de vie s'amélioré. Elie demande présentement un troisième crédit pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire. La demande du sable de la lagune est actuellement forte, c'est pourquoi Elie a besoin encore de prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Elie A. was born circa 1972 in Aguégué, a small island in the Atlantic Department in Southern Benin. He's married and has four school-attending children. He's been working for 20 years. At first, he was a fisherman : he used to go fishing with his younger brother Isaac. However, this business was not very profitable and, 5 years ago, he decided to start another business in addition to fishing. He now also sells sand. Indeed, Elie contracted friends who go collect sand in the Cotonou lagoon with their small boats. Cotonou is the economic capital of Benin. Elie did already benefit from two loans from Kiva's partner Alidé, and, as a result, his standard of living improved. He's now seeking a third loan in order to increase his revenues. Lagoon sand is currently in high demand, which is why Elie needs this loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To collect 75 small boatloads of sand

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Haby Karembé a 53 ans mariée et mère de 7 enfants (5 garçons et 2 filles), elle réside avec son époux, ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants  à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Haby Karembé après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture au village, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente de calebasses et divers il y a maintenant dix  ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant trois  ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association Benkadi de Hamdallaye), elle est à présent à son premier prêt individuel.. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 4 colis de calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne à Tona région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative du Mali) avant de les revendre  en détail au grand marché de Sikasso près de la mairie centrale de la localité à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout des miniers.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Haby Karembé, age 53, is married and the mother of seven children (5 boys and 2 girls). She resides with her husband, her two co-wives, and their children in Hamdallaye, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work, she got introduced ten years ago to the business of buying and selling calebasses, (dried gourds used as cups, bowls, and basins) and various goods.

Concerned with doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After six solidarity loans (group loans) in a women’s association in her area (Association Benkadi de Hamdallaye), she is now on her first individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy four batches of calebasses. Supplies are gotten in Tona (Ségou region) and then are sold retail at the grand marketplace of Sikasso, near the central town hall of her area, to customers composed generally of women and especially miners.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batches of calebasses

loans.name: Goundo

texts.fr:
Née en 1962 à Bamako, Madame Goundo D. est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est vit avec son mari  et ses enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville  de koutiala (  Région de Sikasso ).  
Enseignante dans une école publique de koutiala ville, elle exerce également des  activités génératrices de revenus notamment  la vente de tissus, pagnes wax et autres articles depuis 15 ans.  Jouissant d’une bonne notoriété,  elle reçoit des commandes à travers les associations féminines lors des cérémonies et surtout à l’approche des fêtes telle le 8 Mars (journée internationale de la  femme).
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans.   Après 4 prêts solidaires ( prêt de groupe ) tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 6 ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt: 60 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Mme Goundo  effectue sa vente dans les différentes entreprises de koutiala et sur commande à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 160.000FCFA qu’elle  envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt,  subvenir aux besoins familiaux et élargir son activité.
 Animée de grandes ambitions, Mme Goundo a pour perspective d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de tissus et d’autres produits au grand marché de koutiala.
texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Bamako, Mrs. Goundo D. is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

She is a teacher in a public school in the town of Koutiala, but has also earned income selling fabrics, "wax pagnes" (high quality, colorful African print cloth), and other items for 15 years. She enjoys an excellent reputation and receives orders through women's associations for ceremonies and above all before such holidays as March 8 (International Women's Day).

In order to satisfy the needs of her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 4 solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly reimbursed, she is now on her 6th individual loan, the preceding having been repaid without difficulty.

With this loan, she plans to buy 60 lengths of "wax pagne" in Bamako (capital of Mali). Mrs. Goundo does her selling in the various companies in Koutiala and to order to a clientele made up of women and men, for cash or on credit.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 160,000 F CFA which she plans to use to reimburse the interest on the loan, cover family expenses, and expand her business. Inspired by great ambition, Mrs. Goundo hopes one day to open a shop selling fabric and other items in the big open-air market of Koutiala.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "wax pagnes"

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Sanata D. est âgée de  23 ans, célibataire sans enfant,  elle vit  avec ses parents dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de koutiala. Sanata n’a pas fréquenté l’école, elle aidait sa mère à faire la fabrication du Sounbala (un des condiments les plus importants pour les femmes dans la préparation des sauces en Afrique de l’ouest). Après 10 ans passés aux services de sa mère,  elle a commencé à évoluer à son propre compte dans le domaine de l’achat vente du Sounbala. Elle est très sollicitée dans le secteur et peut vendre plus de 5 gros paniers dans la semaine.  
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, Sanata a décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans.   Après 4 prêts dans le groupe ( prêt solidaire ) tous  remboursés correctement   elle est à son premier prêt  individuel. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 10 gros paniers de Sounbala avec des villageoises lors des foires hebdomadaires de la ville de koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente à Bamako à une clientèle  composée essentiellement de revendeurs,  comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qu’elle  envisage utiliser pour le  remboursement des intérêts  du prêt et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa maman.
texts.en:
Miss Sanata D., 23, single and without children, lives with her parents in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala. Sanata never attended school; instead, she helped her mother prepare "soumbala" (one of the most important condiments used by women in the preparation of West African stews). After 10 years spent apprenticed to her mother, she began to develop her own business, buying and selling "soumbala". She is very much in demand in this sector and can sell more than 5 big baskets per week.

To increase her working capital so as to expand her business, Sanata decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. After 4 group loans (solidarity loans), all correctly reimbursed, she is now on her first individual loan.

With this loan, she intends to buy 10 big baskets of "soumbala" from village women at the weekly markets of the town of Koutiala. She sells her merchandise in Bamako, to a clientele composed essentially of retailers, for cash and on credit. She expects to make a monthly profit of 80,000 F CFA which she expects to use in repaying the interest on the loan and contributing to improving her mother's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of Soumbala for re-sale

loans.name: Antoine

texts.fr:
G. Antoine est né vers 1982 à Cotonou. Antoine est marié et a deux enfants dont l'aîné seul est scolarisé; le second est encore un bébé. G. Antoine aidait ses parents à faire la pêche. Adulte depuis neuf ans , Antoine recueille avec l'aide d'un groupe d'amis, le sable de la lagune de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin et le revend à un autre exploitant qui, à son tour le revend aux convoyeurs de sable par camion. G. Antoine est à son troisième prêt avec ALIDé.  Antoine dit avoir connu une amélioration substantielle de son niveau de vie depuis qu'il a commencé par avoir de prêts à ALIDé. G. Antoine demande un troisième crédit pour acquérir dans les mois à venir une barque motorisée et commencer par ériger des appartements semi-durs qu'il mettra en location tout en continuant par mener son activité de vente de sable. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Antoine G. was born circa 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He's married and the father of 2 children, out of which only the elder one attends school, the younger one being still a baby. Antoine G. used to help his parents fish. He's been an adult for 9 years, and he now collects sand in the Cotonou lagoon with a group of friends. He then resells it to another man who, in turn, resells it to truck conveyers. Antoine G. is seeking his third loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé, in order to purchase a motorized small boat in the coming months, and to start building semi-rigid apartments for renting. He will also continue his sand selling business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two tons of cement and a motorized small boat

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: N. Jane is a business woman with a pharmacy business that she has been running for over 8 years. She is 36-years-old and a mother of 6 children, as she cares for 2 orphaned children. At her pharmacy, Jane works as a nurse as well as a midwife by offering treatments for sicknesses and minor surgeries, plus midwifery services to mothers. Since Jane works from her home, she is able to rear animals at home like cows, goats, pigs, and chickens under her close supervision. It is also helpful that she does not have extra rent costs. She needs a loan to restock her pharmacy with more medicines and to pay for people to take care of the feed for her animals.

loans.use: Buying more medicines for the pharmacy and paying for the care of her animals

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
T. Feruza lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She sells food products in market and in the week-end bazaar. She works with direct suppliers so she can sell at low prices and she has repeat customers. She sells sour milk products, meat, and oil.

Feruza is applying to KIVA for financial support in the form of a business development loan of 3200 STJ for 6 months for importing vegetable oil from Iran. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: importing vegetable oil  from Iran

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
K. Abdusattor has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. He is a responsible and trustworthy client who has not any loan repayment delays.

Abdusattor is married and has 3 children. He is a loving father and has the reputation of being a hard-working man. He has been selling vegetable oil that he gets from direct suppliers in Iran. It is good quality oil so a lot of customers come to buy to his stall.

Abdusattor also sells fruit in summer. He is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 10 months for opening a specialized trade outlet in one of the crowded bazaars that will permit him to increase business turnover. Abdusattor thanks KIVA for its support in small business development.

loans.use: opening a specialized trade outlet

loans.name: Bujor

texts.en:
I. Bujor has 2 hectars of vineyard of traditional Moldova grapes and 2 hectars of Magaraci grapes. On his arable land, Mr. Bujor grows cereals, a part of which he sells on the agricultural market; another part is used to feed his animals. The harvest of grapes allows to I. to sell a part to the big exporters of fruit and with the remaining grapes, he produces wine for sale.

Mr. Bujor plans to restore his vineyard and to improve the harvest. He took a loan from Microinvest to purchase seedlings and constructI. materials for grapevine supports. The business is profitable, but I.’s ambitI. is to increase it. His long-term plan is to plant 0.5 - 1 more hectares of vineyard.

loans.use: purchasing seedlings and construction materials for grapevine supports

loans.name: Mukadashon

texts.en:
For 8 years, I. Mukadashon has been working at the local central bazaar selling housecoats and sleepwear that she brings in herself from China and the Kyrgyzstan Republic. Mukadashon has good taste so her repeat customers also make purchase orders.

Mukadashon is married with 3 children and her oldest daughter helps her with her stall at the bazaar. Mukadashon is applying to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 2300 STJ for 6 months for importing seasonal wear. Mukadashon thanks KIVA for its support and wishes lenders all the best in future.

loans.use: importing seasonal wear

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur S. is a successful trader and dedicated son of his parents. He is single. Elnur began a small grocery store eight years ago with savings, which he earned as a carpenter, as his small capital. He was assisted by his parents who are on pension now and the only financial income in his family is this store. Today his clientele has grown and his grocery store has become more popular.

Elnur has a good loan history and usefully completed his loan from AqroInvest several years ago. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Elnur is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store

loans.name: Curcenco

texts.en:
M. Curcenco owns 6 hecatres of vineyard in Moldova, Muscat and Pino. In the arable land, M. grows cereals and vegetables that she sells at the wholesale market from the district. M. sells the grapes to the local producers of wine and to the exporters of fruits.

M. has run small businesses for more than 9 years. Together with her husband she also produces sheep and lambs that they sell in the third year. M. requested a loan to purchase building materials for the construction of a warehouse. The business is profitable because there is a high demand for agricultural products in that region.

loans.use: {urchasing building materials for the construction of a warehouse

loans.name: Huseynali

texts.en: Huseynali S. has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age that his family never went without their daily bread. He is married and has two children. Huseynali has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a loan from AqroInvest and his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise six years ago. He recommended himself as a trusted client. Today this has become a family business and his children and wife are engaged in the business. Today Huseynali needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase his range of goods for sale.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for sale

loans.name: Jemshid

texts.en: Jemshid A. is 32 years old. He is married with two children. Jemshid has been selling men’s and women’s shoes for 7 years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while, he realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop and establish himself in the local market of Imishli city. He is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. His business has profited from his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. He plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients. You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Today is your opportunity to help, have no doubt.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar J. is a low-income person. He is 40 and lives with his wife, two children and parents in one house. Yashar started his business more than 10 years ago and now Yashar has a small grocery and sells foodstuffs. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase its daily turnover. This loan will allow him to buy bigger amounts of goods for resale, to better provide for his family and save for the future education of his children. With your collaboration, he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: To purchase more food goods

loans.name: Ghencea

texts.en: Mr. Ghencea currently owns .36 hectares of vineyard and 2.5 hatares of arable land. On the arable land, Mr. Ghencea grows cereals which he sells in the agricultural market. The harvest of grapes he sells to the exporters of table grapes. A portI. of the grapes he brings home to produce wine that he sells during difficult financial periods. He has run such types of activity already for 8 years. He requested a loan from Microinvest to purchase seedlings. Business is profitable, but the applicant wants to increase the profitability through new seedlings.

loans.use: Purchasing seedlings for renovation works

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
The need to improve his income and provide an education for his 3 children are the reasons why Kamil V. is courteously requesting this loan. He is a very responsible and hard-working father who for many years has been dedicated to the business of buying and selling shoes. 
With the income he could earn with the help of a new loan, he would be able to educate his children as that is  most important for Kamil. Today he is requesting a loan of $1225 to expand his business so that he can generate more income. Kamil is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en:
Rakhila I.’s passion lies with her children. A married mother of three, Rakhila opened her business selling women’s clothing with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past three years, Rakhila has successfully operated her business at the market. With her profits, she not only has improved her children's living standards, she has been able to support her elderly parents as well.

Rakhila would like to restock her clothing inventory. An optimistic businesswoman, Rakhila plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothes

loans.name: Sciur

texts.en: Sciur I. lives with her husband and grandson, whose parents work abroad.  She has a booth at the local market where she sells clothing for women. Sciur brings goods in every two weeks from Odessa.  Although sales from December to February decreased compared with the same period last year, Sciur is pleased with the results.  The loan is to increase her assortment of clothing items for women in spring.  In the future she intends to work at the market and increase the variety of goods.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of clothing items for women in spring.

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en: Qurban A. is a 60-year-old, married father of seven children.  He has sold confectioneries in his grocery store for the last two years.  He provides for his family with the revenue generated by his store.  Qurban requests a loan of $1225 with a 15 month term to increase his stock of food goods.  He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goals of becoming a successful entrepreneur and supporting his children so they get a good education.  Aqroinvest Credit Union believes his perseverance and clear vision will ensure the success of his small business.

loans.use: purchase more food goods

loans.name: Mulkadar

texts.en: Mulkadar A. has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure that his family would never goes without their daily bread.  Mulkada has a general store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs.  With a loan from AqroInvest and thanks to perseverance and dedication, Mulkadar began this enterprise eight years ago.  He successfully completed his loan. Today he needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods.  With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1225 for a term of 15 months.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.  AqroInvest believes Mulkadar's perseverance and clear vision will become key to success in his small business.  Over time, Mulkadar believes his business will become a family business with his future children engaged.

loans.use: Purchase more food stuff

loans.name: Fenm Vayanor “Valiant Women” Group

texts.en:
The “Fenm Vayan” or “Valiant Women” Group is a made up of twenty-five male and female entrepreneurs, twenty of which are taking out a second loan.

After successfully repaying their first loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses.  Their businesses range from used clothing and jewelry, food sales, to charcoal production and sales.

Jina J. is one of four representatives of the group. She is married with two children, ages 7 and 1.5 years old.
She sells used footwear and used clothing that she buys in bulk from the Dominican Republic to sell in her local marketplace.  Jina used her first loan to increase her inventory because there is more of a profit margin when she buys in bulk.  She dreams of expanding her business to to sell in multiple cities and hire employees.  On behalf of Jina, Fenm Vayan, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: Buy used clothing, sandals, shoes, and jewlery.

loans.name: Hadijah's Group

texts.en:
N. Hadijah is the leader of the Bisoboka group in Lugazi. She is a business lady who sells bananas in a raw form, both in bunches and in heaps. She has been in this business for five years. When she had just started getting loans, her capital was too small to make it possible to save anything for her family and for business expansion. She says that her change in business is great with the use of loans plus her ability to manage her business. As a result, she has been able to buy a plot of land that she is currently using for farming, though on a small scale. She also bought two cows that give her milk for sale. She now needs a loan to help with the continuous running of her businesses by stocking more matooke (plantain bananas) for sale.

In the photo she is with M. Damalie, who has a pharmacy business in Buwundo.

loans.use: Buying more matooke (plaintain bananas) to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 6 hijos, que actualmente están viviendo en su casa. Desde su juventud se dedicaba a labrar la tierra donde sembraban plátanos, cítricos, café y Kion, pero hace 5 años atrás se introdujo en el negocio de la compra y venta de frutas y kion, con  la ayuda de su esposo, quien es el encargado de recorrer las chacras durante la madrugada para realizar las compras y después acumular los productos en su deposito, Doris se encarga de encostalar si es kion o de encajonar si es fruta, para tener lista su carga cuando llegue el camión que los transporta hasta un mercado de Lima. Doris está muy contenta con sus labores, y lo que más le agrada es la venta, la cual le permite estar en contacto con la gente y se olvida de algunos malestares físicos que tiene. En todo este tiempo su negocio le ha generado ingresos muy buenos que le han permitido cubrir la educación de sus hijos, por ello tiene esperanzas de progresar aun más con la agricultura. Doris está muy motivada por ser parte de este nuevo banco comunal, y se ha ofrecido para apoyar en las charlas educativas a su asesora de crédito, así como se comprometió a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de sus productos; el kion y toda fruta que se pueda comercializar, lo que le permita incrementar sus ganancias en bien de su economía.
texts.en:
Doris is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 6 children, who at present are living in her house. Since her childhood, she was working the land, where was sowing bananas, citrus, coffee, and kion, but five years ago, she started her business of buying and selling fruits and kion with the help of her husband, who is responsible for traveling to farmhouses in the morning to make the purchases. After accumulating the products in his warehouse, Doris puts the kion in sacks and puts the fruit in boxes, so that her cargo is ready when the truck that transports them to the market in Lima arrives. Doris is very happy with her work and what she likes most is selling, which lets her be in contact with people and lets her forget about some physical discomforts that she has. In all this time, her business has generated very good incomes, which have permitted her to pay for her children’s educations, which she hopes to continue even more than agriculture. Doris is very motivated by being part of this new community bank and has offered support in the educational talks to her credit advisor, and in this way, she promises to pay her installments punctually. The money that she is requesting is to buy her products, the kion and all the fruit that she can sell, which will allow her to increase her earnings for the sake of her well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: Fausta tiene 34 años, lleva viviendo con su pareja por más de 15 años, es madre de tres hijos, que actualmente viven en su casa. De niña no tuvo mucho tiempo para los juegos, su labor era apoyar a cultivar las chacras a sus padres, ya que eran numerosos hijos y les faltaba dinero para que puedan estudiar, ella se comprometió pensando que su situación cambiaría, pero nada de eso ocurrió. Cuando tuvo su propia familia se incrementaron sus labores, ahora se levanta a las 5.00am para preparar la comida para sus hijos, en seguida guisa el menú y horas más tarde va a la chacra con su esposo para apoyarlo en los cultivos de piñas. En aras de incrementar sus ingresos, hace 3 meses empezó a vender planta y flores para los huertos, cobrando entre 1 a 5 soles por cada una. Pero al margen de sus carencias económicas, Fausta es muy feliz con su familia, dice que cada sonrisa de sus hijos la motivan a trabajar en su chacra, aunque de joven esta labor no le gustaba. Ahora tiene muchas expectativas de trabajar con créditos, en su banco comunal, del cual tiene muchas ideas positivas, también se compromete a realizar sus pagos puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra plantas, de ese modo aumentar sus ventas, para que con el paso del tiempo pueda ir acumulando ganancias para su hogar.
texts.en:
Fausta is 34 years old, has been living with her partner for 15 years, and is the mother of three children, who at present live in her house. From childhood, she did not have much time for playing. Her work was to support her parents in cultivating their farms. Since there were many children, her family lacked the money for them to go to school. She committed herself to thinking that their situation would change, but this did not occur. When she had her own family, her work increased. Now she wakes up at 5:00am to make food for her children. She cooks and hours later, goes to the farm with her husband to help him cultivate pineapples. In an effort to increase her earnings, 3 months ago, she started to sell plants and flowers from the orchards, earning between 1 to 5 soles for each one. But apart from her financial struggles, Fausta is very happy with her family. She says that every day her children motivate her to work in the farm, even though from youth, she didn’t like this work. Now she has many expectations from working with the loans in her community bank, from which she has many positive ideas. She also promises to make her payments punctually. The money she requests is to buy plants and in this way to increase her sales, so that over time, she will be able to accumulate more earnings for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more plants to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 29 años, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos, que viven en su casa. Desde niña se dedicó a las labores agrícolas con sus hermanos que trabajaban todos los cultivos de frutos cítricos de sus padres, y en las épocas de cosecha hacían competencia entre hermanos para ver cual de ellos lograba juntar más naranjas y su padre les premiaba con muy buenas propinas. Lucy quiso emplear esa misma dinámica con su propia familia, pero a su esposo no le gusta la chacra, y prefiere trabajar como chofer en Lima. Pero con el apoyo de sus hermanos se inició en la compra y venta de frutas durante los fines de semana, además de cultivar sus propias frutas durante la semana, aunque en menor cantidad, pero igual se siente muy feliz de hacerlo, y esa alegría muestra a todos sus clientes ofreciendo sus productos con una bonita sonrisa. Ver acabar el día sin frutas y con ganancias la motiva a seguir trabajando para sus hijos, sin perder las esperanzas de comprarse un puesto en la ciudad; donde ella sería la encargada de vender y sus hermanos de proveer los productos. Lucy está muy contenta de pertenecer a este banco comunal, motivada por los ahorros que le permitirán guardar su dinero para cualquier emergencia. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir pagando sus cuotas en los días exactos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más frutas, negocio que le está resultando rentable, además de fertilizantes para sus propios cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucy is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 3 children, who live in her house. Since she was a child, she has done agricultural work with her siblings who were all cultivating citrus fruits with their parents. In the harvest times, there was a competition among the siblings to see which of them could pick the most oranges. Their father awarded them with good pocket money. Lucy wanted to employ this same dynamic with her own family, but her husband doesn’t like the farm and prefers to work as a driver in Lima. But with the support of her siblings, she started buying and selling fruit during the weekend, in addition to cultivating her own fruit during the week, although in smaller quantities. All the same she feels very happy to have it, and this happiness shows to all her clients since she offers her products with a beautiful smile. At the end of the day, when she is without fruit and with earnings, she is motivated to continue working for her children, without losing the hopes of buying a stand in the city, where she would be in charge of selling and her siblings of providing the products. Lucy is very happy to belong to this community bank and is motivated by the savings that will allow her to save her money for an emergency. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her installments on the exact days they are due. The money that she requests is to buy more fruit and fertilizers for her crops for her profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente hace 12 años, es madre de 4 hijos que viven con ella en su casa. Sus padres fueron agricultores y ella los apoyó hasta hace poco en las labores agrícolas, hasta que le regalaron unos terrenos para que cultive cítricos, plátano y kion de manera independiente. En consecuencia, Maria se levanta a las 5.00am para preparar los alimentos y una vez cocidos alista el menú en la vianda que llevará a la chacra. Esa es su rutina diaria, de la cual se siente muy contenta, dedicándole toda su atención a sus cultivos junto a su esposo. Después de haber trabajado y cultivado el kion, esperan cosechar de 3 a 4 meses y en seguida lo comercializan, en su zona los venden a 1 sol el kilo, pero en ocasiones que mejora el precio opta por enviar sus productos a los mercados de Lima para captar mayores ingresos, pero debe acumular más de 1.000 kilos para que pueda cubrir el flete (costo de transporte). En el pasado no trabajó con créditos por temor, pero ahora tiene muchas esperanzas con su banco comunal, este es su primer préstamo y se está comprometiendo en pagar las cuotas en las fechas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para la limpieza de sus terrenos, quitándole las hierbas y malezas que en esta época de lluvia crecieron muy rápido y hoy dificulta el desarrollo de las plantas, por ellos necesita sacarlas para no perjudicar sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old, has lived with her partner for 12 years, and is the mother of 4 children who live with her at home. Her parents were farmers and she helped them until very recently with their farmwork, so her parents gave her some land on which she and her husband can grow citrus fruits, plantains, and "kion" independently. As a consequence, Maria gets up at 5:00am every morning to prepare the food, and once it's cooked, she gets it ready to take to the farm. This is her daily routine, which makes her feel very happy, dedicating all her attention to her crops, together with her husband.

After planting and growing the "kion" they wait 3 to 4 months to harvest it and immediately sell it. In their region they sell it for 1 sol per kilogram, but in occassions in which the price is better they opt to send their products to the markets in Lima to increase their income. However, they need to gather more than 1,000 kilograms in order to be able to cover the cost of transportation to market. In the past they didn't take out any loans due to fear, but now they have a great deal of hope with their communal bank. This is their first loan and they promise to make their payments on the due dates.

The money Maria is asking for is to clear their land, taking out the weeds that have grown very rapidly due to the rain and are making it difficult for the plants to grow. They need to pull the weeds so they don't decrease the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clearing their farmlands

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 46 años, tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos viven fuera. En su juventud, sus padres sembraban numerosas hectáreas de cítricos y plátanos, ella se levantaba a las 4.00am para preparar el desayuno, porque a las 7.00am ya estaban cultivando sus chacras, entonces se quedaba para cocinar y luego llevar los almuerzos a la chacra, quedándose a apoyar en los cultivos. Actualmente, esta dinámica de trabajo la realiza solo en épocas de cosecha, el resto de su tiempo lo ocupa realizando manualidades en su casa, para cada uno de sus tejidos emplea todo su ingenio y creatividad, produciendo de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes. A Paulina le agrada mucho tejer, y le resulta más rentable; en este negocio invierte para la compra de los materiales como; conos de hilos de diversos colores, adornos, plantillas, etc., y por cada prenda gana entre 5 y 8 soles, estos ingresos le permiten aliviar sus necesidades básicas y urgentes de su casa. Paulina es una cliente muy alegre, es la encargada de arrancar las sonrisa de los demás integrantes de su banco comunal; este es su 1er préstamo con MFP, comprometiéndose a pagar todas las cuotas fijadas. El dinero solicitado lo empleará en la compra de materiales diversos para sus trabajos de manualidades, así podrá tejer más y con diversos colores y modelos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 46 years old and has five children, two of whom no longer live at home. In her youth, her parents planted many hectares of citrus fruits and plantains, and Paulina got up at 4:00am every morning to prepare breakfast, because at 7:00am they were already working in the fields. Afterwards, she stayed in the house to cook, to later bring lunch to the fields, then staying to help with the farmwork.

These days, this particular arrangement only takes place in the harvest season, and the rest of her time she spends knitting in her house. With each of her creations she employs all her ingenuity and creativity, producing to the exact specifications of her customers. Paulina really likes to knit, and it's very profitable for her. With her business, she invests money in materials like spools of yarn of different colors, adornments, knitting templates, etc. For each garment, she earns between 5 and 8 soles, and this income allows her to take care of her basic necessities and household needs.

Paulina is a very happy client who is charge of getting smiles out of the rest of the members of her communal bank. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all her payments. The money she is asking for will be used to buy diverse materials for her work, and in this way she'll be able to knit more garments, and in many colors and models.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of knitting materials

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: M. Betty is the leader of Tufube group in Jinja. She is a married lady with 5 children as she cares for many relatives. Betty is a poultry farmer rearing layer chickens whose eggs she sells to customers and shop owners in Wanyange and Jinja town. She has included the keeping of broilers just for the Easter season and she hopes to reap big profits from their sales. In addition to poultry, she is also a farmer growing food mainly for home consumption and this helps her not to spend so much on food for her family. Betty needs a loan to help with buying feed for her chickens, since this period is so important for their feeding.

loans.use: Buying more feed for her chicken.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda acaba de cumplir 42 años, está felizmente casada y es madre de 4 hijos. Con afán de progresar Yolanda y su esposo sembraban varias cuadras de cítricos y plátanos, pero con el pasar de los años sus cultivos no siempre le resultaban rentables, por ello que acordaron, hace 8 años, emprender otro negocio, que fue la venta de combustible. Entonces Yolanda sería la encargada de la atención en la venta de gasolina y petróleo, y por estar ubicada su casa en un lugar céntrico de la carretera este negocio sí les resulto rentable, pero lamentablemente fueron víctimas de dos robos consecutivos, donde se llevaron todo su dinero. Desde el segundo incidente no han podido recuperar su capital, y eso la mortifica mucho; pero igual permanecen sus esperanzas de seguir trabajando y progresando poco a poco. Sus miras a futuro son comprarse un terreno y construir una casa en un pueblo cercano, para evitar los robos y vivir en un lugar más seguro. Yolanda nos comenta su alegría de poder acceder a un primer crédito con MFP, y tiene muchas expectativas del trabajo en grupo, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar el capital de su negocio de combustible, y de ese modo ir recuperándose de las caídas económicas debido al robo.
texts.en:
Yolanda recently celebrated her 42nd birthday, and is the happily married mother of four children. With an eagerness to progress, Yolanda and her husband farm various plots of citrus fruits and plantains, but as time goes on their crops are not always profitable for them. This is why, 8 years ago, they started another business selling fuel. So then, Yolanda would be the one in charge of running the gasoline and oil sales, and because their business is located in their house, which is in a very central location along the road, this business is profitable. Unfortunately, Yolanda and her husband were the victims of two successive robberies, and had all their money stolen.

Since the second incident, they haven't been able to recover their capital, and this has been difficult. All the same, they have hopes of being able to continue working and moving forward, little by little. Their hopes for the future are to buy themselves a little piece of land to build a house on in a nearby town in order to avoid future robberies and live in a safer place.

Yolanda tells us of her happiness to be able to receive her first loan from MFP and she has a lot of expectations of working in a group, and she promises to make her loan payments punctually. The money she is asking for is to increase their working capital for their fuel sales business, and this way continue recovering from the economic hardship caused by the robberies.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital for their business

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida  es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Zoraida es conviviente, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos. Zoraida es Ingeniera Química, tiene empresa en su casa que se llama Santa Domingo se dedica a la producción de yogurt que lo vende a trabajadores de instituciones, amigos, al por menor y a pedido, también produce mermeladas, néctares y licores. Además Zoraida es agente vendedora de un producto natural llamado grano café.
Zoraida necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche (que la trae de Alpachaca).
El sueño de Zoraida es implementar mas su empresa y que su hijo se vaya a estudiar a España.
texts.en:
Zoraida is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. She lives with her partner, is 52 years old and has 2 children. Zoraida is a Chemical Engineer and she has a business in her house that is called Santa Domingo, which does yogurt production that is sold to workers, friends, retail and wholesale as well as by special order. She also produces marmalades, juices and liquors. In addition, Zoraida is a sales agent for a natural product called "grano café." Zoraida needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of milk (which she brings from Alpachaca). Zoraida's dream is to build her business more so that her son can go to study in Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Maria es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos. Maria M. tiene un taller de confección a medida en su casa. Además Maria los fines de semana prepara comida que vende en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas y para techar su casa.
Maria esta ahorrando para mejorar su casa.
El sueño de Maria es ayudar a sus 3 últimos hijos a que sean profesionales y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. Maria is married, is 37 years of age and has 5 children. Maria M. has a dressmaking workshop in her house. In addition, on the weekends Maria prepares food that she sells in her house. Maria needs a loan of 1750 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of fabric and to roof her house. Maria is saving to make home improvements. Maria's dream is to help her last 3 children so that they can become professionals and to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and to roof her house.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Juana es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos. Juana vende carne al por mayor, compra en ferias y luego los beneficia los animales en su casa junto con su esposo y lo vende en el mercado Chorro.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en comprar ovejas, chancho y res.
El sueño de Juana es construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. Juana is married, is 47 years of age and has 5 children. Juana sells meat wholesale as she buys animals at market, raises them in her home with her husband and sells them in the Chorro Market. Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of sheep, pigs and heads of cattle. Juana's dream is to build a house and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep, pigs and heads of cattle.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Mariela es casada tiene 43 años y 5 hijos. Mariela tiene un Hotel Restaurante “LA COLMENA”, actividad que realiza con el apoyo D. 10 personas. Además Maria tiene un recreo llamado “GIRASOLES” en la ciudad D. Lima, negocio que es administrado por su hijo mayor.
Mariela necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en un viaje a Argentina.
El sueño D. Mariela es sacar a sus hijos adelante y viajar a Colombia a establecer un Restaurante.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. Mariela is married, is 43 years old and has 5 children. Mariela has a Hotel and Restaurant called “LA COLMENA”, an activity that she carried out with the support of 10 people. In addition, Maria has a recreation area called “GIRASOLES” in the city of Lima, a business which is run by her oldest son. Mariela needs a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in a trip to Argentina. Mariela's dream is for her children to advance in life and to travel to Colombia to establish a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a trip to Argentina.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Felicitas  es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos. Felicitas tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, además tiene un puesto de verduras en el mercado 12 de Abril, mientras que su esposo tiene un taxi con el cual realiza transporte.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y mercadería para su tienda.
El sueño de Felicitas es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. Felicitas is married, is 38 years of age and has 4 children. Felicitas has a store in her house where she sells groceries and also has a vegetable stand in the 12 de Abril market. Her husband has a taxi with which he provides transportation. Felicitas needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and merchandise for her store. Felicitas' dream is for her children to advance in life.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mti Pesa Group

texts.en:
Abdulmagidi N., age 21  is single.  He has a welding business which he started in 2008, at Maji Matitu.  He works daily from 7am until 6.30pm. Abdulmagidi is able to earn a monthly profit of around $154. 

This will be Abdulmagid’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy four welding machines which were stolen on the same day.  Adbulmagid  (leave alone the disaster) has repaid the loans successfully.  He hopes for a third loan to buy a new welding machine. 
\t
Abdulmagid will share this loan with his loan group, Mti Pesa (Kiswahili, a tree is money) which totals 19 members.  The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.  In the picture, Abdulmagid is leaning on the table in a black t-shirt.

loans.use: Buy a new welding machine.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda a sus 56 años sigue con mucha vitalidad para continuar trabajando, y gracias a su hijo construyeron la casa donde ahora habitan tranquilamente. Ella siempre estuvo dedicada a la venta de diversos productos, esta actividad la vino realizando en las calles de su ciudad de manera ambulante y con el pasar de los años tuvo serios problemas de salud que impedían que siguiera en sus labores. Sin embargo, su hijo le apoyó en instalar un negocio en su domicilio, el cual viene funcionando hace dos años, desde entonces solo se dedica a la atención de su tienda, todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las once de la noche, pero las horas de trabajo es lo de menos, porque está dentro de su casa y ahí su actividad no es agitada. Pero sus proyectos no han terminado, Hilda tiene el anhelo de mejorar su tienda con nuevos congeladoras para sus bebidas y mejorar la apariencia de su bodega para atraer a nuevos clientes e incrementar sus ingresos. Este es su préstamo número trece, y todo este tiempo ha sido de aprendizaje y de cambios de actitudes de sus compañeras, pues no solo tuvieron la oportunidad de obtener un crético, sino también de desarrollar capacidades de organización. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, pero su prioridad es la adquisición de algunos mostradores para mejorar el ambiente de su bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda at her 56 years of age continue to work with much vitality. Thanks to her son they constructed the house where they now live peacefully. She has always sold a variety of products, an activity that came to her in the streets of her city as she worked in travelling sales. With the passing of the years she had serious health problems that impeded her abilities to carry on her work as a travelling saleswoman. However, her son supported her in constructing a store in her home; which she has been running for two years. Since then she has given all of her attention to her store, everyday from 6:00 in the morning until 11:00 at night. But her working hours are less because the store is in her home and her home activities are not disrupted. Her projects are not finished, Hilda has the dream to improve her store with new refrigerators for her drinks and to improve the appearance of her store to attract more clients and increase her income.

This is her thirteenth loan and all this time she has been learning and changing the attitudes of her companions; they not only had the opportunity to obtain a loan, but also they were also able to develop abilities in organization. The money that she solicits will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, but her priority is the purchase of some display cases to improve the environment of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: María

texts.es: Con muchos años de trabajo, María y su esposo lograron adquirir una casa donde vivir y un medio de trabajo con el cual solventarse, y a sus 68 años, sigue con la misma vitalidad de seguir adelante junto su familia. El empeño que siempre tuvo al realizar sus diversas actividades le ayudó a desempeñarse  adecuadamente en su trabajo actual, pues obtuvo mucha experiencia, y hace 3 años tuvo la posibilidad de adquirir dos motocarros, y desde entonces se dedica a la administración de los ingresos diarios del servicio de transporte de pasajeros que realizan. Sus hijos son los que trabajan manejando las motos y en algunas ocasiones las alquilan por día. Estar pendiente de este negocio no es muy difícil, pues solo tiene que controlar las horas de salida y servicio, y sobre todo ver si el vehículo está siendo utilizado cuidadosamente. Y para no sentirse inactiva, María también vende comida en la puerta de su cada, retomando sus habilidades como vendedora, sin dejar de lado la administración de sus motos. La permanencia de doña Maria en MFP es de 7 años y este es su treceavo préstamo, lo que la llena de alegría, pues el compartir con sus compañeras es grato, por el bonito grupo de trabajo que conforman. El dinero que solicita esta vez es para el mantenimiento de sus motos y para la compra de utensilios y víveres para retomar la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Through many years of work, Maria and her husband were able to have a house to live in and a means of employment to support themselves. At 68 years of age, she continues to have the same vitality to get ahead together with her family. The drive she always had to perform her different activities helps her to carry out her current work and she has gained a lot of experience. Three years ago she had the opportunity to acquire two motorcycles and since then has been administrating the daily income from their passenger transportation service. Her children are the ones who drive the motorcycles and occasionally they rent them by day. Keeping an eye on this business is not very difficult, as she only has to control the hours the vehicles leave and their service, and above all see that the vehicle is being used carefully. So that she does not feel inactive, Marian also sells meals from her front door, using her abilities as a saleswoman while not neglecting the administration of her motorcycles. Doña Maria has been with MFP for 7 years and this is her thirteenth loan. This makes her happy, as sharing with her fellow members is pleasant because they make a nice working group. The money she requests this time is for maintenance of her motorcycles and to buy utensils and supplies for the sale of food.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for motorcycles and investment in a food business

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es:
Eva Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Eva Maria es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos. Eva Maria viaja a las Ferias 3 veces por semana y vende pasamanería junto a su esposo. Además en su casa tiene una fabrica de buzos y los vende al por mayor y menor, también por campaña vende útiles escolares.
Eva Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
El sueño de Eva Maria es sacar profesionales a sus hijos y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Eva María is a member of the "Love and Truth" communal bank. She lives with her common-law husband, is 37 years old and has 4 children. Eva María and her husband travel to different markets three times a week and sell notions (tassels, braids, lace, etc.). In addition, they make sweatshirts at home and sell those at wholesale and retail. They also sell school supplies during the season. Eva María needs a loan for 3000 soles, which will be used to buy school supplies. Her dream is for her children to become professionals and to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana started her business in March 2005. She had been looking for a way to be productive, and one day she accompanied a friend to pick up some brochures. From that she had the idea to start her own business selling items from catalogs. She bought a few catalogs and has been having good results continuing and growing this activity. 

Adriana needs a loan for $3,000 that she will repay in 6 installments, she wants the loan to purchase merchandise and have variety of products for the new summer season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: M. Rose is the leader of the Ekirirwa Eira group in Jinja. She is a business lady with a retail shop that she has managed for eight years now. Rose says that before the loans, she always figured out what she would sell out to her customers, and this mostly happened because she did not have enough capital. Then there was not a lot of competition in her area. But the use of loans helped her to include more goods on her shop shelves and now she is happy that although there are bigger shops in her neighborhood, she can afford to sell and make a weekly profit of 40000 Ushs and save for her family and future developments. She needs another loan to help with restocking her shop.

loans.use: Restocking Rose's retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es: Martha Guadalupe Hernández T. tiene 44 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Martha es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de ocho años que se dedica a este negocio ya que desde que inicio este negocio ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y ha luchado fuertemente para obtener estos ingresos. Los propósitos de Martha para su negocio son de aplicar nuevas técnicas de pago para sus clientes ya si pueda obtener su dinero en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería en general como ropa, cosméticos y otros productos variados. Los deseos de Doña Martha son personales ya que le gustaría proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Martha Guadalupe Hernández T. is 44 years old and is single. Doña Martha sells clothing and cosmetics. She has been in this business for the past 8 years and since the beginning has been selling her products door to door and has struggled hard to earn an income. Martha´s goals for her business are to implement new payment plans for her customers so she can collect money on time. The loan she requests is for working capital to buy merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and various other products. Her dreams are personal, and she would like to make some improvements to her home. The amount she is requesting is C$ 6,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Ana

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Ana M. Tapia su edad es de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Rosa no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Rosa es una librería. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio. Dona Rosa inicio por la necesidad de no poseer un trabajo por que no poseía una manera de obtener una fuente de ingresos y con esto podría mantenerse. Los propósitos de Doña Rosa son de ampliar más su librería y así ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que así podrá comprar lápices, borradores, marcadores y cuadernos. El deseo de Doña Rosa es que tengamos estabilidad económica ya que cada día los precios de los productos básicos varían. La cantidad que solicita es de C$6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Ana M. Tapia is 51 years old and is single. Doña Rosa does not have children. She has a bookstore and has been working at this for more than five years. She started her business out of necessity as she had no work and no source of income and needed to support herself. Doña Rosa´s goals are to expand her store and offer a greater variety of products to her customers. This loan will be for working capital so she can buy pencils, erasers, markers and notebooks. Doña Rosa´s wish is for economic stability as every day prices for basic goods fluctuate. The amount she requests is for C$6,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence buys and sells kerosene in wholesale and retail form. She is also a party planner and supplies food and drinks for various occasions. She has been a LAPO client for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N150,000 to enable her to purchase more drums of kerosene.

Florence is 45 years old and married with four children. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drums of kerosene to sell

loans.name: Claudia Lissette

texts.es: Claudia Lisette B. Zapata tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es soletera. La Joven Lidia no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Claudia es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Claudia da inicio principalmente por que necesitaba cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente ella posee 2 trabajos labora como agente de ventas en una casa comercial y los fines de semana ofrece los productos de cosméticos. Los propósitos de Claudia son de invertir en nuevos productos para atraer la atención de sus clientes. Es por eso que decide visitar Fundación León 2000 para solicitar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que así podrá comprar productos como lápiz labial, sombra, rubor y nuevos perfumes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Claudia Lisette B. Zapata is 29 years old, and single. This young fighter has no children. Her main work is the sale of cosmetics, which she has dedicated herself to for more than 11 years. She began this work mainly because she needed to cover the expenses of her household expenses. She currently has two jobs: she works as a sales agent for a commercial firm and on weekends, she sells her cosmetic products.

Claudia intends to invest in new products to attract customer's attention. That's why she decided to visit Fundación León 2000 to request financing to be used as capital in her work. That way, she will be able to purchase products like lipstick, eyeshadow, blush, and new perfumes. She is asking for $300.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase new products for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Falode

texts.en: Falode A. styles hair and sells hair extensions, creams, etc.  She has been in business for the past eight years. She needs a loan of N150,000 to purchase more styling creams, extensions and drinks. Falode is 43 years old and married with four children.  She lives in Lagos state with her family. Falode says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more hair materials and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ameth

texts.fr: Monsieur Ameth A. est un boucher depuis 25 ans.  Il a une bonne expérience du milieu.  Parallèlement, il a deux dibiteries à travers la ville. Il fournit en général de la viande à certaines personnalités et des boites.  A cet effet, il réalise un bon chiffre d’affaires.  Ce prêt lui permet de renforcer mais aussi d’ouvrir un mini-marché devant la Seras.  Il est marié et il habite à Thiès avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ameth A. has been a butcher for 25 years and knows the ins and outs of this business. In parallel, he runs two grilled meat stands in the city. He usually sells meat to people and companies, and makes a good turnover. This loan will enable him to bolster his business and to open a mini-market. He's married and lives in Thiès with his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a mini-market

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo Máximino C. tiene la edad de 61 años, su estado civil es soltera. Don Rodrigo tiene 2 hijos. Don Rodrigo tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Hace más de siete años que se dedica a este dedica a este negocio. Don Rodrigo inicio trabajando a temprana edad buscando otra alternativa de ingresos. Los propósitos de Don Rodrigo son de mantener activo su negocio y también mejorar la calida de sus refrescos. El financiamiento que Don Rodrigo solicita es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita comprar maíz, posol, cacao y tiste. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Máximino C. is 61 years old and single. He has two children. He earns income by selling soft drinks, work which he has done for more than 7 years. Rodrigo began working at an early age seeking alternatives for earning money. He intends to keep his business active while at the same time improving the quality of his beverages. The money that Rodrigo is requesting will go towards capital that will allow him to buy corn, posol (another type of corn often used in soft drinks), cocoa, and tiste (a drink made from corn and cocoa). He is requesting $250.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase ingredients and beverages

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kikelomo

texts.en: Mama Tope as she is known (Kikelomo M.) has been in the kerosene business for the past eight years. She buys in drums from suppliers and sells out in retail size containers. With profits from this business, she has been able to assist her husband and improve her family's life style. Kikelomo is 49 years old and they have six children.  She needs the N150,000 loan to purchase more kerosene to meet customer demands.  Mama Tope says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Moussa Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa Ibrahima S. est un jeun marié qui fait le commerce des habits pour hommes, des chaussures, des montres de luxes, des lunettes, etc.  Il habite au quartier Kaossara Fall de Thiès, une grande ville environs 100 km de Dakar.  Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce dont les revenues vont servir à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Ibrahima S. is a young husband who trades men's clothes, shoes, luxurious watches, sunglasses etc. He lives in Kaossara Fall, a neighbourhood of Thies which is a big town about 100km away from Dakar. He is requiring this loan to strengthen his business, whose revenues will allow to support his family.

Translated from French by anne-laure behaghel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes

loans.name: Slra Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of the SLRA (Sierra Leone Roads Authority) Makeni. SLRA was established in 1993 by an Act of Parliament charged with the responsibility of constructing and rehabilitating all roads, bridges and ferries in Sierra Leone. It is a civil engineering institution. SLRA Makeni is responsible for roads, bridges and ferries in Bombali, Koindadugu, part of Tonkolili and part of Kambia districts, in northern Sierra Leone. SLRA Makeni has a total of twenty-one staff. Over the years, SLRA Makeni has been able to construct many roads in the township of Makeni, making the town accessible to vehicles.  

This will be the second loan members of SLRA Makeni are requesting from SMT. Previously, only nine staff members applied for a loan from SMT. With the success of the previous loans to staff, six new members of staff were encouraged to join their colleagues in applying for a loan this time around. With a loan, staff members will be able to invest it in something needed and out of their monthly salaries, they will repay the loan. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture like a bed or chairs, other will use theirs to invest in business, some will invest theirs in a house-building project and others will use the loan to pay for their children's schooling.

Anthony S. K. (first from left) is a member of the three-man loan recovery committee and also head of security for SLRA Makeni. Anthony was born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone. He is age fifty-five, married to a teacher and they have four children together. Two of his children are in class six, one is in class five and the last is in class two. Anthony will use this loan in a house building project, to buy house building materials.

loans.use: To buy house building materials

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
T. Madeleine est née vers 1976 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé à l'Est du Bénin. T. Madeleine est mariée à MIFFOKPO Bernard et a quatre enfants tous scolarisés. T. Madeleine est
dans le commerce depuis 20 ans. T. Madeleine achète le pétrole auprès de fournisseurs venant du Nigéria et le revend en gros ainsi qu'en détail.  T. Madeleine est à son troisième crédit avec ALIDé. Déjà, Madeleine est ravie de pouvoir bénéficier de prêt à ALIDé: cela lui évite tout souci de financement de son activité. Madeleine demande un troisième crédit pour acheter et stocker une quantité considérable de pétrole afin de satisfaire au mieux la demande du marché. T. Madeleine espère tirer assez de profit de son commerce pour concrétiser son rêve de se construire sa propre maison. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Madeleine T. was born in 1976 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé district in Eastern Benin. Madeleine T. is married to Bernard MIFFOKPO and has 4 children, all scolarised. Madeleine T. has been in business for 20 years. She buys oil to suppliers from Nigeria and sells it by wholesale as well as by retail. This will be her third credit with ALIDé. Madeleine is already very happy to be able to benefit from a credit in ALIDé: it avoids her any worry about financing her business. Madeleine is asking for a third credit to buy and stock a significant amount of oil so that she can better satisfy market's demand. She hopes that her businness will provide her with enough profits to be able to concretise her dream of building her own house. The meaning of ALIDé in Benin local language, Fon, is "a path always exists for the poorest". Benin is a small West African country next to Nigeria where GDP per capita is $1,500. ALIDé offers special credits at 0% interest rate for very vulnerable people, and is in a group that soon will launch a progarm of heath micro-insurance for the beneficiaries of a micro-credit.

Translated from French by anne-laure behaghel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 375 litres of oil

loans.name: Manuela Azucena

texts.es: Manuela Azucena C. A. tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Manuela tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Manuela es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Manuela inicio este negocio por una amiga y más tarde ella decide experimentar con este negocio vendiendo productos como ropa interior, cosméticos y bolsos. Los propósitos de Doña Manuela son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que es una de sus mayores fuentes de ingresos. Los deseos de Doña Manuela son de mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia. La cantidad que solicita es de C$20.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Manuela Azucena C. A. is 50 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom work. Her main work is the purchase and sale of general merchandise. She has more than 14 years of experience in this work. Manuela began this business through a friend, and later decided to experiment with it, selling products such as undergarments, cosmetics, and handbags. Manuela intends to keep moving forward with her business as it is one of her largest sources of income. She hopes to improve the quality of life both for herself and her family. She is requesting $1000.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of goods for resale

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.ru: Садриддин кредитуется в Микроинвест не в первый раз и показал себя образцовым клиентом. Получая небольшие займы он успевает получить хорошую прибыль. Его деятельность – это откорм скота дома. Он работает но по выходным обязательно посещает скотные рынки и если понравиться скотина то он покупает и, приведя, домой смотрит за ним. В этом ему помогает его жена и дети. Садриддин уверен, что если смотреть за домашней скотиной по всем правилам, то прибыль может превысит все ожидания. Сейчас цены на скот растут, и Садриддин собирается получить займ, чтобы приобрести маленького бычка.
texts.en:
This is not the first time that Sadridin H. is borrowing money from MicroInvest and he has shown himself to be an exemplary client. He takes out small loans and is able to make a good profit. His business is raising livestock at home. He works, but on weekends he always attends livestock markets and if he likes a specific calf, he purchases it and brings it home to raise it. His wife and children help him with this. Sadridin is certain that if you look after livestock and follow all the rules, then profits can exceed all expectations. Right now livestock prices are climbing and Sadridin plans to take out a loan in order to purchase a small calf.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: La señora María Antonia M. tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña María tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña María es venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio ella dio inicio por que necesitaba un trabajo, para sustentar a su familia y educar a sus hijos y decide establecer este negocio rentable en su vivienda. Los propósitos de Doña María son de mantener su clientela ya que tiene que mejorar cada día en la elaboración de sus productos. El financiamiento solicitado por Doña María es para la compra de materia prima como leña, cal y maíz. Sus sueños son de obtener un local para su negocio. la cantidad que solicita Doña María es de C$5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Antonia M. is 57 years old. She is married, and has six grown children, all of whom work. She earns her living by making and selling tortillas. She has been doing this for over 20 years, and she got into the business because she needed to find a way to earn a living from her home while she raised her children. Maris’s goals are to keep her existing clients while at the same time improving the quality of her products. Her loan will be used to buy raw materials for the tortilla production – such as corn, lime, and firewood. Her long-term goal is to have her own locale for her business. She is requesting C$5,000 Nicaraguan Cordobas [US $250].

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - raw materials

loans.name: Sda Primary School, Makeni Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SDA (Seven Days Adventist) Primary School, Makeni. SDA Primary school, Makeni was founded in 1978 by SDA Makeni to use education as a vehicle for spreading the Adventist message. They train young boys in the morals and ethics of the Adventist Mission. Presently, the school has a population of fifty-six pupils and a staff of twelve teachers.

Presently, SDA Makeni suffers a number of constrains. First, they lack a water-well. The tap-head of the well they used to have has been stolen, forcing the children to fetch drinking water from the neighborhood. Second, SDA suffers from lack of sufficient benches and classrooms. They used to have sufficient benches, but rebels used all of those benches as firewood. Then Plan Sierra Leone (an NGO) provided them with new ones, only for people around the neighborhood to steal all of them again. Thus the children have to carry their own benches from home every day to school.

However, with the change of administration three months ago, SDA Primary school is revitalizing, thanks to the new headmaster, Mr. Benjamin Kamara (not part of this loan). The new administration is able to buy benches for classes five and six through school fees subsidies and development funds. The school has also been able to hire two security guards to keep thieves at bay. And for the first time in the history of the school, they will be organizing athletics for the pupils. This will give popularity and fame to the school.

With this loan, some of these teachers will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.

Abdul K. K. (back row, second from right) is the leader of this group of teachers. Abdul was born in Mamamah, about 110 miles from Makeni. He is age forty-eight, married to a teacher and the two of them have two children. One of their children is in class four and the other is in class two. Abdul will invest his loan in business and he has been in business for over four years now.

loans.use: Invest in Business

loans.name: Ochahon

texts.ru: Очахон работает в колхозе. Сейчас сезон полевых работ и она постоянно на работе. Ей 46 лет, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Ее муж тоже работает в колхозе.
