What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has. She is able to see to her business, and at the same time she can take care of her home. What she does not like is how cold she gets every time she makes the ice cream. In the future, Gregoria would like to have her own ice cream parlor where she could sell her ice cream. She knows that the road to achieving her goals is difficult, but she is determined to meet the challenge. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always made her payments on time, and she expects to be able to do the same with this loan as well. She is very active in her community bank. With this loan Gregoria will buy ingredients to make her ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: La señora Claudia Carolina C. tiene la edad de 32 años habita en el barrio Dennis Larios. ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual  trabaja como comerciante, en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras al por mayor en el mercado de Masaya, ellos tienen dos hijos una niña de cinco años, la pequeña estudia y un varón de tres años que es enfermo de la vista, ella nos comentaba que lleva dos operaciones el niño nació casi sin visón , los planes hacia un futuro es poder ver que su pequeño con la ayuda de los médicos puedan darle una luz de esperanza para que su hijo no pierda la vista ; a pesar que doña Claudia se ha enfrentado con el problemas de su hijo es una señora muy trabajadora ella tiene ocho años trabajando en la agricultura  inicio su actividad agrícola con sus propios esfuerzos y la necesidad de cubrir las operaciones de su hijito , ella solicita éste crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo. A futuro es poder mejorar su casa para ofrecerles a su familia una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Carolina C. is 32 years old and lives in the neighborhood called Dennis Larios, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, with her husband who works as a storekeeper. She works buying and selling fruit and vegetables at wholesale in the market of Masaya. They have two children - the youngest a girl of five years who studies, and a boy of three years who has a vision illness. She told us the boy was born with almost no vision and has had two operations. Her hopes for the future for her young son are that, with the help of the doctors, they can provide a glimmer of hope that her child does not lose his sight. Even though Mrs. Claudia has faced the problems of her son, she is an industrious woman who has worked for eight years in agriculture. She began her agricultural activity through her own efforts and the need to pay for the operations for her son. She seeks this third loan to buy fertilizers to improve the crop. Her future hope is to be able to improve her house and provide her family a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to improve the crop

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 41 años, vive en su propia casa con su esposa y sus dos hijos; Sheyly de 19 y Yonat de 14, lo que más desea es darles buenos estudios superiores a sus hijos.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Cuando Miguel tenia 21 años, tuvo que dejar la universidad y buscar un trabajo, puesto que no tenía el dinero necesario para continuar con sus estudios, así fue que se dedico a trabajar en varias cosas y después de intentar en muchos trabajos, encontró el ideal. Miguel se siente feliz siendo taxista y no se puede quejar, ya que este trabajo le da el dinero necesario para mantener a su familia. Ya lleva 10 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es la libertad que tiene en su trabajo, ya que puede conducir tranquilamente su taxi por las calles de Puno en busca de clientes, pero lo que menos le gusta es arreglar su carro cuando sufre algún desperfecto. Miguel anhela tener un negocio más rentable, tal vez un restaurante o una bodega, aun no se decide, pero lo que sí sabe es que tiene que trabajar duro para lograrlo. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es el único varón y siente que tiene el compromiso de ser muy responsable. Con el dinero que solicita arreglará su auto para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their two children; Sheyly, who is 19 years old, and Yonat, who is 14. What he most desires is to give his children good higher education. When Miguel was 21 years old, he had to leave the university and look for a job because he didn't have enough money to continue his studies. After this he worked a variety of jobs and after trying many jobs he found the ideal one. Miguel feels happy being a taxi driver and he can't complain since this job gives him the money he needs to support his family. He has worked at this job for 10 years and he most likes the freedom that this job gives him, since he can calmly drive his taxi through the streets of Puno looking for customers. His least favorite part is fixing his car when there is something wrong with it. Miguel desires to have a more profitable business, maybe a restaurant or small grocery store, he still has not decided, but he does know that he has to work hard to achieve that. This is his first loan with MFP, he knows he has to repay it on time because he does not want to cause problems for the members of his community bank, of whom he is the only male and he feels he has the obligation to be very responsible. With the money he requests he will fix his car to be able to provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina es una mujer muy sincera y honesta, tiene 23 años y vive junto a sus dos menores hijos Gian Marco de 3 y Maricielo de 6 meses en su propia casa. Se dedica a vender papa en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Puno, (mercado muy conocido), ella es muy alegre y conversadora, por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren, trabaja junto a su madre, quien fue la que le enseñó este negocio. Ricardina disfruta mucho de conversar con sus vecinas de venta, mientras trabaja, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es que al terminar el día se encuentra muy sucia por la tierra de la papa. Ricardina desea tener en el futuro una tienda donde pueda vender su productos y otra cosas más, de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y darle a sus hijos buenos estudios superiores. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más papa, para incrementar la cantidad que vende diariamente en el mercado.
texts.en:
Ricardina is a very sincere and honest woman. She is 23 years old and lives in her own home with her two young children; 3-year-old Gian Marco and 6-month-old Maricielo. She works selling potatoes in the Mercado Central in the city of Puno (a well-known market). She is very happy and outgoing, which makes her customers prefer her. She works alongside her mother, who is the one who taught her this business. Ricardina very much enjoys talking with her neighboring salesladies while she works. She has done this job for 5 years and what she least likes is that at the end of the day she is very dirty from the dirt of the potatoes. In the future, Ricardina desires to have a store where she can sell her products as well as other things, and in this way improve her quality of life and give her children a good higher education. This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to make all the payments on time since she does not want to cause problems for her community bank, where she is beloved by the rest of the members. With the money she requests she will buy more potatoes to increase the quantity she sells daily in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rómulo

texts.es: Rómulo tiene 25 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. De muy joven dejó su natal Ananea (comunidad puneña ubicada en el límite con Bolivia) para buscar mejor suerte laboral en Juliaca, actualmente se encuentra en el negocio de la venta por campaña. Según la temporada del año decide qué productos venderá, ahora lo está haciendo con útiles escolares y su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que ha traído las últimas novedades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo a Rómulo, es que puede decidir qué cosas vender, pero lo que no es que tiene que estar en contacto con distintos distribuidores a la vez y eso le quita tiempo. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y espera en el futuro poner una librería, ya que es un negocio más estable. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad de obtenerlo y tiene la seguridad de poder pagarlo a tiempo. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita planea incrementar su capital de trabajo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para la campaña venidera.
texts.en:
Rómulo is 25 years old, and is a hard-working young man. He lives in a rented house with his wife and their two children, who are the motivation for all of his efforts. As a young teenager he left his native Ananea (small community located on the Bolivian border) to look for better luck working in Juliaca. He currently works as a salesman. He decides what he will sell according to the season of the year. Now he is selling school supplies and his stand is very popular since he has the lastest things. What Rómulo most enjoys about his job is that he can decide what to sell, but he dislikes having to be in contact with different distributors all at the same time as this uses up his time. He has worked at this job for 8 years and in the future he hopes to start a book store since that is a more stable business. This is his second loan with MFP. He is very happy for the opportunity to get the loan and he is confident he will be able to repay it on time. With the 800 nuevos soles he requests he plans to increase his working capital to invest more in the purchase of merchandise for future sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his next sales campaign

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofía a sus 58 años ha pasado por muchos sacrificios para mantener a sus dos hijos, Cesar de 21 y Bernardo de 19. A lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para poder brindarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias, actualmente está en el negocio de la venta de manualidades, realiza muñequitos, manteles, adornos, etc, de tela y los lleva a vender en su puesto ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Puno, al cual concurren todos sus clientes en busca de algo bonito y novedoso para ocasiones especiales. A Sofía le gusta mucho trabajar con tela y crear muñequitos y adornos decorativos, aunque le es difícil y demora armar sus manualidades parte por parte, en espera de que le queden muy bien. Lleva ya 10 años realizando esta actividad y desea que en el futuro su puesto de venta crezca y se convierta en una de las principales tiendas de la ciudad, donde pueda tener más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos para darle una vida más digna a su familia. Es el primer préstamo de Sofía con MFP y tiene mucha confianza en que podrá pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy tranquila y disfruta de trabajar en equipo con el resto de sus socias. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Sofia, 58, has gone through a lot of sacrifices to take care of her two sons, 21-year-old Cesar and 19-year-old Bernardo. Throughout her life she's worked hard to be able to offer her family all the necessary comforts. Currently she's in the business of selling handicrafts. She makes dolls, tablecloths, ornaments, etc., using fabric. She then takes them to sell in her stand located in downtown Puno, where all her customers converge in search of some pretty and original thing for special occasions. Sofia likes to work with fabric and to create dolls and decorative ornaments, though it's difficult for her and takes her a while to assemble her crafts piece by piece, in hopes that they turn out well. She's been carrying out this craftwork for ten years now, and she hopes to have more customers in the future and to improve her earnings to give a more dignified life to her family.

This is Sofia's first loan with MFP, and she's very confident that she'll be able to pay back all payments on time. She's very content with her communal bank and enjoys working as a team with the rest of her partners. With the requested money she'll buy a greater quantity of materials required to make her crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para sus artesanías

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es: Toribia de 27 años es una joven madre soltera, vive en su propia casa, la cual consiguió con mucho sacrificio. Tiene 3 hijos; Juan de 8, Sandra de 5 y Mónica de 3 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de triciclos, actividad que le ha servido de mucho para mantener a su familia y brindarle ciertas comodidades, compra triciclos usados que han sido dejados de lado porque ya no funcionan, los repara y los pinta dejándolos como nuevos. Lleva 8 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus triciclos y ver que están bien refaccionados, pero lo que menos le gusta, es que para arreglarlos realiza un trabajo muy pesado y cansado, que le toma mucho tiempo, aun así ella sigue adelante en espera de mejorar su vida. Toribia anhela tener un taller propio, donde pueda arreglar con mayor comodidad sus triciclos, ya que actualmente realiza esta labor en su casa. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que le da alegría a las demás. Invertirá los seiscientos soles que solicita en comprar más triciclos para arreglar y así incrementar la cantidad que vende.
texts.en:
Toribia, who is 27 years old, is a young, single mother. She lives in her own home, which she obtained through much sacrifice. She has 3 children she loves very much; Juan is 8, Sandra is 5, and Monica is 3. Her business is buying and selling tricycles. The business has really helped maintain her family and provide them with some comforts. She buys used tricycles that have been abandoned because they no long work. She repairs and paints them so that they look new. She has been in this business for 8 years. What she likes best about her work is selling the tricycles and seeing that they are refurbished well. What she likes the least is that it is hard, tiring, and requires a lot of time. Even so, she continues in the hope of improving her life. Toribia would like to have her own shop, where she could be more comfortable refurbishing her tricycles. She now does it in her house. This is her first loan with MFP. She fully intends to make her payments on time. She is a well thought of member of her community bank. She brings joy to others. She will use the loan of 600.00 PEN to buy more tricycles to fix and be able to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Eddy Antonio

texts.es: El señor Eddy Antonio Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 32 años habita en la Borgoña, junto a sus esposa la cual es domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos los cuales tienen entre 12 y 10 años actualmente estudian su primaria; los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que donde ellos habitan es un solo cuarto y en futuro quiere ampliar para que cada uno de ellos tenga su cuarto privacidad Don Eddy desde hace once años trabaja como agricultor y comerciante y sus limitantes ha sido la falta de financiamiento, inicio en la agricultora con el apoyo de sus padres que todo su vida se dedicaron a trabajar sus tierras. El financiamiento es para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Señor Eddy Antonio Gutiérrez is 32 years old and lives with his wife in Borgoña. They have two children, who are 10 and 12 years old, and who are in primary school. To help support the family, Eddy's wife works as a maid. Their plans for the future are to improve their family's quality of life. Currently, they live in one large room together and in the future, they would like to expand their home so that everyone can enjoy the privacy of their own room. For 11 years, Eddy has worked as a farmer and trader. He learnt how to farm from his parents, who dedicated their wholes lives to working in the fields. Unfortunately, Eddy has always been limited by the unavailability of working capital. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer and everything else needed for a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo Tomas y su hija de 15 años llamada Roxana, la cual es su principal apoyo en su negocio, ellos viven en su casa propia. Se viene dedicando a la venta de frutas desde hace 9 años en el Mercado Pachacutec, que está ubicado en cerca de donde vive, siendo ésta su principal fuente de ingresos; en este trabajo la ayuda su hija Roxana la cual atiende el puesto cuando su mamá sale a comprar más mercadería o se le presenta algún contratiempo. A Susana le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que siempre está en contacto con la gente y ha hecho muy buenas amigas con sus vecinas del mercado, además las ganas que le pone y la alegría con la que atiende logran que la venta sea buena y le arroje buenas ganancias. Pero como toda una microempresaria Susana quiere expandir su negocio y hacer que sea mucho más próspero para lo cual quiere ponerle un techo nuevo a su puesto. Susana ha trabajado con MFP, desde aproximadamente 3 años, siendo una cliente muy puntual y responsable en sus pagos, ahora tiene un préstamo individual, pero trabajó primero con un banco comunal con el cual estuvo muy feliz ya que hizo buenas amigas y todas eran muy responsables. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería y en arreglar su puesto para así brindar una mejor atención a su clientela, Susana está muy feliz y espera seguir progresando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Susana is 45 and lives in her own home with her husband Tomas and her 15-year-old daughter Roxana, who helps with her business. For nine years, Susana has sold fruit in the Pachacutec Market, located near her home, and her business is her primary source of income. Roxana minds the fruit stall while her mother goes to buy more merchandise or is called away for an unexpected problem.

Susana really likes her work, as she enjoys interacting with people and she has made many good friends among her neighbors in the market. Also, the effort she puts forth and the joy she takes in her work have resulted in more sales and therefore good earnings. But, like all small businesspeople, she would like to expand her business and be much more prosperous, and for this she would like to put a new roof over her stall.

Susana has worked with Microfinanzas Prisma for about three years, and has been punctual and responsible with her repayments. She now has an individual loan, but first she was part of a community bank, which made her very happy as she made many responsible friends.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise and in making improvements to her stall to provide better service to her customers. Susana is very happy and hopes to continue moving forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and make improvements to her stall

loans.name: Edita

texts.es: Edita tiene 41 años, es madre de Cristian de 11, Diego de 10 y Brenda de 4 años, con los cuales vive en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se ha venido dedicando a la venta de comestibles en su bodega, donde trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 u 11 de la noche, tiempo en el cual logra una gran cantidad de clientela, ya que su buen trato ha logrado que sea un negocio muy rentable. A ella le gusta mucho la atención porque casi todos sus clientes la conocen y son sus amigos(as), así que la venta se hace muy amena. Ahora en época de verano el calor hace que sea muy incómodo permanecer durante todo el día en su tienda, pero aún así ella está muy contenta y espera ampliar muy pronto su negocio. Ella es una clienta antigua en MFP y lleva varios préstamos, en los cuales ha sido muy responsable pagando todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita espera comprar gran cantidad de comestibles y abastecer su tienda con bebidas para esta época de verano.
texts.en:
Edita is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her children Cristian (age 11), Diego (age 10), and Brenda (age 4). For three years she has sold groceries in her shop, where she works from six in the morning until ten or eleven at night. Her hours have earned her a good number of customers and her good treatment of them has made her business very profitable.

Edita really likes working at the shop since she knows most of her customers and they are her friends. This makes selling things very pleasant. Currently, the summertime heat makes it very uncomfortable to remain in her shop all day, but even so Edita is very happy and hopes to further expand her business very soon.

She is an old client of Microfinanzas Prisma, has had many loans, and has always been responsible about being on-time with her repayments. With this loan she hopes to buy a lot of merchandise and to stock her store with drinks for the summertime.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth es una madre que afrontó sola el cuidado de sus dos niños; Sandra de 9 y José de 6 años, los cuales son su razón de vivir, todos viven en la casa de padre. Desde hace 8 años se ha venido dedicando a la confección de chompas que es el negocio familiar, al cual su padre le ha dedicado bastantes años de esfuerzo, es así que poco a poco y con hijos por los cuales velar, decidió volcar todo lo aprendido a su negocio propio. Su padre manifiesta que entre sus los negocios no hay competencia, ya que tienen muchos clientes los cuales alcanzan para los dos. Ruth está feliz por toda la ayuda que le brindó su padre y gracias a él ahora es independiente y puede solventar todos los gastos de sus pequeños. Gracias a su empeño el negocio crece cada vez más y requiere de mayor cantidad de personal; hasta el momento ella trabaja con una ayudante y aveces su hermana que le da una mano, pero en el futuro necesitará contratar a alguien y así aumentar su producción. Ruth le dedica mucho tiempo a su trabajo y deja de lado las labores de su hogar, ya que no le gusta la cocina, dejándole esa labor a su hermana que sí posee una buena sazón. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y también fue aconsejada por su padre de sacar un crédito para mejorar su negocio, él sí es un cliente con una gran trayectoria en MFP ya que fue muy puntual en sus pagos. Ruth quiere invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de lana y si es posible contratará a otra ayudante para aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother to two children, Sandra (age 9), and José (age 6). Her children are her reason for living, and she lives with them in her father's home. For eight years, Ruth has made sweaters. It is her family business, as her father has done the same work for years. So, little by little, with her children's interests at heart, Ruth decided to start her own business. Her father attests that there is no competition between their two businesses, since there are enough customers to keep them both busy. Ruth is happy to have had so much help from her father and is grateful that she is now financially independent and can cover all the costs of raising her children.

Thanks to Ruth's hard work her business keeps growing and requires more personnel. She currently works with one assistant and sometimes her sister also lends a hand. But, in the future, she will need to hire someone else to be able to increase production. Ruth devotes so much time to her business that she cannot keep up with household chores and no longer likes to cook, so she leaves these tasks to her sister, who has a flair for them.

This is Ruth's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She was advised by her father, a long-time, responsible member of MFP, to seek funding to improve her business. Ruth wants to invest the loan in the purchase of wool and, if possible, to hire another assistant to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool to make sweaters

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ruth del Carmen Z. tiene la edad de 30 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como transportista para poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos , una niña de once años que actualmente estudia y un varón de cinco años que estudia su tercer nivel de preescolar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio que es una pulpería para poder darles una mejor vida a sus hijos ya que a veces se le dificulta darle la atención que los pequeños necesitan , desde hace tres años tiene la pulpería en su casa de habitación , ella inicio con sus propios esfuerzos y la ayuda de nuestra financiera ya que este es su noveno crédito , y ha logrado establecer un poco su negocio , ella solicita financiamiento para incrementar mas su pulpería y poder vender tanto abarrotes , como carnes , cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Señora Ruth del Carmen Z. is 30 years old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood with her husband. He works as a driver in order to help her with the household expenses. They have two children to care for: an eleven year old daughter who is currently in school and a 5 year old son who is in the third level of pre-school. Her plans for her family are to improve the conditions of her business which is a grocery store in order to give her children a better life since at times it is difficult to give the little ones the attention they need. She has had the grocery store in her house for three years now. She began it with her own efforts and the financial assistance of AFODENIC. This is her ninth loan and she has succeeded in getting her business a little better established. She is seeking financing in order to expand her business a little and to be able to sell more groceries, such as meats and cosmetics, and offer her customers a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meats, cereals and cosmetic products

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Manuel Paíz, tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio la Francia N 0 2 , junto a su esposa la cual es ama de casa ella le apoya con las actividades del hogar , cuando hay producción ella de apoya en la venta de dicha cosecha . ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos uno de ocho años y el otro de seis los dos son varones , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus pequeños y aumentar la producción agrícola , don José desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento y el mal tiempo que eso le perjudico mucho ya que no vendió  la producción con resultados factibles , él inicio las labores agrícolas con el apoyo de su padre , el solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos y lograr una producción buena.
texts.en:
Mr. José Manuel Paíz is 36 years old and lives at N 0 2 in the La Francia neighborhood with his wife. His wife is a housewife and she supports him with the household activities and when there is a harvest she supports him in the harvest. They have two sons, one 8 years old and the other six years old. His future plans are to improve his family’s living conditions and increase his agricultural production. Since he was 15 years old José has been farming. His greatest challenge is the lack of financing and the bad weather damaged crops so he couldn’t sell his crops with optimal results. He began farming with his father’s support. He is seeking financing to buy supplies and fertilizer to improve his crops and achieve a good crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies to have a better production

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Julia del Carmen M. Cáceres tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Julia tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Julia es una pulpería. Hace más de diez años que tiene este negocio. Doña Julia inicio con fondos propios pero no eran los suficientes y decidió buscara ayuda con Fundación León 2000. Los propósitos que Doña Julia tiene para su negocio son de invertir cada día en nuevos productos porque sus clientes solicitan nuevos productos. El financiamiento es utilizado para capital de trabajo con esto podrá comprar granos básicos, golosinas, carnes y a la mismo tiempo en ropa para niños. Doña Julia tiene los sueños de que sus hijos reciban una educación superior para que el día de mañana sean grandes profesionales. La cantidad que Doña Julia solicita es de C$ 5.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
Julia del Carmen M. Cáceres is 44 years old and married. She has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Julia’s business is a pulpería (convenience store), and she has had this business for more than ten years. Julia started her business with her own money, but it was not enough and so she decided to seek help from Kiva partner Fundación León 2000. Her plan for her business is to invest in new products each day, since her customers are regularly asking for new products. The loan will be used as working capital so that she can purchase staple grains, candies, and meats, along with children's clothing. Julia’s dream is for her children to receive a higher education so that they will grow up to be successful professionals. The amount Julia is requesting is C$ 5.500 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reyna Lorena

texts.es: La Señora Reyna Lorena Q. López tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Reyna tiene 5 hijos todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Reyna es una pulpería. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y ha logrado extenderse por los financiamientos y anteriormente ofrecía productos como pan, refrescos naturales y golosinas. Es por eso que los propósitos de Doña Reyna son de mantener activo su negocio y así proporcionarle a su familia ingresos. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y comprar productos como granos básicos, golosinas y productos de consumo diario. Los sueños de Doña Reyna son de seguir luchando en la vida para darle a su familia todo lo necesario. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 22.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna Lorena Q. López is 45 years old and married. Mrs. Reyna has 5 children, all of whom study. Mrs. Reyna has run a local store for more than 17 years and has managed to expand her business through financing. Previously she offered products such as bread, natural beverages and candies. Mrs. Reyna’s intentions are to maintain her store and in turn provide her family with income. Her reason for the loan is to purchase working capital to satisfy the demand of her customers and buy products like basic grains, candies and everyday products. The dreams of Mrs. Reyna are to continue fighting in life to give her family all that it needs. The quantity that she solicits is C$ 22.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es: El Señor Harold Enrique Z. Berríos tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casado. La actividad económica de Don Harold es el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. El comenzó este negocio a la edad de 20 años ya que su Padre le enseño a manejar y mas tarde logro comprar un automóvil  y dedicarse a este negocio. Los propósitos de Don Harold  es salir adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que lo solicita para la compra de repuestos para su taxi. Sus deseos son de conseguir otro taxi y así proporcionarle a su familia esta fuente de ingresos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$15.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Harold Enrique Z. Berríos is 39 years old and married. He's worked as a taxi driver for more than 14 years. His father taught him to drive, and he was eventually able to buy a car and begin working. Don Harold's goal is to have his business grow. The loan is for business capital, which he is requesting in order to buy parts for his taxi. He would like to acquire another taxi and be able to offer his family that source of income. He is requesting a sum of C$15.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sukepen

texts.id:
Modal usaha yang didapat melalui lembaga yang ada didesanya lewat kerja sama dengan Yayasan Dinari sedang berjalan untuk yang kedua kalinya.Modal ini sangat dibutuhkan untuk menujang sarana dalam usahanya sebagai pembuat banten untuk sembayang adat Bali.

           Untuk memenuhi dan melengkapi bahan baku. Hampir setiap hari Ketut Sukepen belanja aneka macam  bunga, janur di pasar untuk keperluan usahanya.pengeluaran untuk usaha canang cari dalam satu hari mencapai Rp.50.000,- dan memperoleh pendapatan bersih sekitar Rp.20.000,- .dari usaha inilah Ketut Sukepen dapat membantu menambah pendapatan suaminya Komang Tersen yang sebagai seorang tukang bangunan.  Selain melayani acara sembahyang kecil yang dilakukan setiap hari,Ni Ketut Sukepen juga melayani pembuatan banten secara paket besar seperti odalan merajan,otonan,galungan dan kuningan.biasanya pesanan dalam pakaet besar satu bulan hanya dua sampai tiga kali,dan keuntungan dapat mencapai Rp.300.000 s/d Rp.500.000,-
texts.en:
Business funding received through the village agency by way of cooperation with Dinari Foundation is the second time around. This funding is necessary as a means in her business as ‘banten’ maker for the Balinese traditional prayer. To attain and equip with raw materials, almost everyday Ketut Sukepen buys a variety of flowers, young coconut palm fronds from the market for the business needs. Daily expenditure for the business is approximately Rp.50.000,- and the attainable net income is about Rp.20.000,- from this effort. Ketut Sukepen is able to supplement her husband’s, Komang Tersen, earnings as a construction craftsman. Besides serving small prayer ceremonies daily, Ni Ketut Sukepen also serves ‘banten’ making on the large package method for ceremonies/festivals like Odalan Merajan, Otonan, Galungan and Kuningan, usually the large package method orders are limited to two or three times a month, and earnings attained range from Rp.300.000,- to 500.000,-

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Ni Putu Wirati

texts.id: Melalui lembaga yang ada didesanya Ni Putu Wirati mendapat kepercayaan dan memdapatkan dana pinjaman dari Yayasa DINARI untuk periode ke dua. Dana tersebut dipergunakan untuk menambah dan melengkapi segala keperluan yang belum ada sehinga warung semakin lengkap dan lebih berfariasi barang dagangannya. Karena warung ada dirumahnya maka bisa buka saat pagi hari pada pukul 6.00 wita dan tutup pada sore hari pukul 7.00 wita Setelah selesai membuka warung barulah kembali meneruskan pekerjaan untuk keluarganya.Setelah itu barulah meneruskan menunggui warung yag ada dirumahnya dan sesekali mengambil pekerjaan rumahnya seperti membersihkan rumah ,halaman dan apa saja yang dirasa belum dikerjakan.Keuntungan bersih yang didapat mencapai Rp.20.000,- s/d Rp.30.000,- dalam sehari.dari keuntungan inilah Ni Putu Wirati dapat belajar mandiri dan memenuhi kepertluan kedua anaknya dan tidak selalu mengandalkan pendapatan dari pekerjaan suaminya yang sebagai aparat desa.
texts.en:
Through the village agency, Ni Putu Wirati found trust and received loan financing from DINARI foundation for the second time. The stated funding will be used to increase and equip all essentials still missing until the store is more complete and more assortment of merchandise. As the store is at the house thus it normally opens the moment sunrise at 6 am and close in the evening at 7 pm. After opening the store she returns to proceed to the household chores. After that proceed back to watch over the store and frequently taking on household work like cleaning house, yard and any thing else that needed attention. Daily net income attained of Rp.20.000,- to 30.000,-, from this income Ni Putu Wirati is financially independent and also fulfill her 2 children’s needs and does not always rely on her husband’s work income being the village agency.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Sayu Komang Artamiati

texts.id:
Melalui Lembaga di desanya Sayu Komang Artamiati mendapatkan dana yang ke dua dari Yayasan DINARI.  Dengan modal itu Sayu Komang Artmaiati sangat terbantu untuk menambah modal usahanya warungnya.usaha warung sudah rimulai sejak lama.barang dagangannya yang dijualan yaitu aneka macam snak makan ringan,keperluan sehari-hari,aneka macam alat tulis.
Barang dagangan didapat  dari pasar negara dan ada beberapa  produk yang sudah biasa diantar oleh pelanggannya.warungnya terletak dilokasi rumahnya jadi bisa diawasi dari rumahnya.Buka warungnya biasa setelah bangun pagi dan setelah bersih bersih rumah,marulah mulai aktifitas diwarungnya sampai sore,tap sesekali dapat ditinggal untuk mengerjakan pekerjaan sebagaiman ibu rumah tangga lainnya. 
 Penghasilannya memang tidak terlalu bersar,tapi cukup untuk memcukupi keperluan sehari-hari . keuntangan bersih antara R.30.000,- s/d 50.000,- dapat diterma dalam setiap harinya dari usaha inilah sayu komang Artmaiati dapat membatu pendapatan /penghasilan dari suaminya yang sebagia tukang.
texts.en:
Through the village agency, Sayu Komang Artamiati received second funding from DINARI foundation. That funding significantly assists Sayu Komang Artamiati to increase funding for her small store business. This small store business was started long ago, merchandise available for sale includes a variety of light edible snacks, daily needs, and a variety of writing instruments. These merchandise are obtained from the state market and the supplier usually delivers several of the products. Her small store is at her home thus always watchful over it while at home. The store is opened from after waking up in the morning and after cleaning the home; commence her store activities until late afternoon, except every now and then to carry out her other household chores. Earnings indeed are not very much, but are sufficient to cover daily need. Daily net earnings from this store of between Rp.30.000,- to 50.000,- Sayu Komang Artamiati is able to supplement her husband’s income/earnings as a craftsman.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ronabee

texts.en:
Ronabee N. sells fish, shrimp, and crab from her own stall at the Dalipe market in San Jose, the capital of Antique Province.

She has applied for this loan to buy more inventory for her business.  When Ronabee started selling fish, she was a street vendor; hard work and perseverance won her a place in the town's largest public market. 

Ronabee is 28 years old and has one child.  Her husband is a 'tricycle' taxi driver (motorcycle with sidecar), used to haul people and cargo.  

She hopes someday to become a "big time businesswoman" and dreams of being able to build a better house for her family and sending her child to college.

loans.use: Buy fish, crab, and shrimp for resale.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S., 39, sells fish in the local market of the Kampong Cham province. On average, she is able to make about $4 per day. Her husband stays at home and raises fish. Her husband usually provides fish for her to sell at the market and sometime he sells them to other fish sellers too. He typically makes $6 per day. This couple has five children: three are in school and two are too young to attend.

Mrs. Seng S. would like to request a loan to increase the number of fish to sell every day to meet her client’s demand. (She is pictured with her husband and her youngest son.)

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Chhy

texts.en:
Chhy R., 37, is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the local market of the Kampong Cham province. She is able to make about $2.50 every day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver and also acts as a dealer selling motorbikes. On average, he makes $3 of profit per day. This couple has four children: one is a student, two are too young to attend school, and one is a construction worker.

Chhy R. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to sell for extra profit to help raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to sell

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en:
Phourng T., 38, is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle so she can transport fish quickly to her customers.  She currently makes a living selling fishes in Kok Tlok Market and generates an income of $6.50 per day to help her family.  T.'s business is running very well and she has gained more profit.

She is married with three children who are teenagers who go to school.  Her husband, Mr. Preang, 40, is a local motorcycle taxi driver.  Overall, they have established a family with six members who live in Siem Reap province in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann S., 32, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She sells vegetables to earn a living, and she is able to make around US$2.5 every day. Her husband is a garment factory worker. On average, he makes US$5 per day. This couple has three children; two are in school and one is too young to attend. Vann S. would like to take out a loan so that she can purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market. This will reduce her daily transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S. is 24 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and two of her children. To earn a living, she sells vegetables in the local market, and she typically makes US$2.5 every day. Her husband operates a motor taxi business. On average, he earns US$3.5 profit per day. Mom S. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike so her husband can run a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ngy

texts.en:
Ngy N., 50, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband work collecting palm juice to sell and to refine it to sugar palm. Together they make about US$7 in revenue per day. They run a small stand selling palm juice, beer and meat. This couple has four children, two of whom are construction workers and two who are in school.

Ngy N. needs a loan to expand her business and make more profit to raise their standard of living. She will use the loan to purchase beer and meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase beer and meat.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S., 33, is the mother of two children. She has a business catching fish and selling it at the market, earning approximately US$5 profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, has been operating a motor taxi business since 2005 and makes US$1.5 per day. Touch S. is asking for a loan to purchase fishing tools. (Her husband pictured here because Touch S. was not available for picture)

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Maila

texts.en:
Maila R. is a 41-year-old mother and widow with one daughter. She started selling dried fish in the public market to sustain the education of her child four years ago when she join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Incorporated). She is applying for a loan to start a new venture; she wants to buy pigs for fattening. She will use part of her loan as additional capital for her dried fish vending business.

She hopes to earn a bigger income from her businesses in order to send her daughter to a university. She also dreams of having enough capital to expand her piggery.

loans.use: To buy pigs and dried fish.

loans.name: Leung

texts.en:
Leung C. is 45 years old and resides with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. Since 2005, she has had businesses making rice wine and raising pigs. On average, she makes $5 per day. Her husband stays at home and helps her with making the wine and raising pigs. This couple has seven children.

Leung C. is asking for a loan to purchase food to feed the pigs and rice to make wine.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and rice

loans.name: 15 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Quang Hung commune is located in Thanh Hoa province and is primarily comprised of professional traders and farmers tilling small fields. Each of the four members of Group 15 - Quảng Hưng are borrowing 3.079.800 VND (about $177) to invest in their businesses.

Ms. Hà Thị Huế is the group leader for Group 15 - Quảng Hưng. She is 37 years old and works selling vegetables that she grows in her field. She plans to use her loan to invest in her vegetable-sales business. Her husband is Mr. Lê V. Lựu who is a 41-year-old construction worker. They have two children. Their daughter, Lê Thị Nhạn, is 18 years old and had to quit school after grade 9 to sell clothes and help her parents support the family. Their son, Lê V. Hạ, is 11 and currently studying in grade 5.

Other members of the group: * Ms. N. Thị Đằm is 47 years old and borrows to invest in her vegetable resale business. * Ms. V. Thị Hà is 34 years old and wishes to invest in her carpentry workshop (specializing in wood furniture). * Ms. L. Thị Bình is 47 years old and will put her funds toward her phở breakfast restaurant (phở is a delicious rice-noodle soup dish commonly eaten for breakfast in Viet Nam). -------------------------------------------------- * Thôn 1 xã Quảng Hưng là một thôn nghèo thuộc tỉnh Thanh Hoá, sinh sống chủ yếu bằng nghề buôn bán nhỏ và làm ruộng. Chị Hà Thị Huế năm nay 37 tuổi,làm nghề buôn bán rau và làm ruộng.Chồng chị là Lê V. Lựu,41 tuổi,làm nghề thợ xây. Gia đình chị sinh được 2 người con:con gái đầu là lê Thị Nhạn, 18 tuổi,vì điều kiện kinh tế gia đình quá khó khăn nên Nhạn phải nghỉ học từ năm lớp 9 để đi bán quần áo thuê giúp bố mẹ đỡ vất vả hơn,con trai thứ hai là Lê V. Hạ, năm nay 11 tuổi đang học lớp 5. Chu kỳ này chị vay mức 3.079.800 VNĐ ~177 USD. Nhóm của chị gồm 4 tH.nh viên: * Chị V. Thị Hà năm nay 34 tuổi, chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào xưởng mộc. * Chị L. Thị Bình năm nay 47 tuổi, chị vay vốn để bán H.ng phở ăn sáng. * Chị N. Thị Đằm năm nay 47 tuổi, chị vay vốn để buôn bán rau.

loans.use: Investments in vegetable resale, carpentry, breakfast businesses

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. was born in 1980 and is a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, where she sells different kinds of vegetables in the local market to earn a living. Besides this, she is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals and cares for her two children in the family home. Her children are students in the secondary school.

Her husband, named Sothom, 39, pictured here, is a trailer-motorbike taxi driver (Tuk Tuk). He also provides his service to tourists who visit the area around the commune. Recently, he has not been able to provide as good a service as before because his motorbike has frequently broken down. To solve the problem, he talked with his wife and she has decided to request a loan of $800 to replace their broken motorbike.

loans.use: To replace their broken motorbike

loans.name: Bean

texts.en:
Bean L., 31, is a widowed farmer who resides in the Kampong Chhnang province. She raises pigs, grows rice and makes fermented fish. Every day, she earns approximately $10 of profit. She has three school-aged children.

To expand her business, she would like to take out a loan to purchase rice to sell and food for her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell and food for her pigs

loans.name: Chhou

texts.en: Chhou C. is 43 years old and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She is a local doctor and works in a grocery store, making approximately US$25 in revenue per day. Her husband is a mechanic and earns US$7 per day. This couple has three children and all of them are in school. Chhou C. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products. (She is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy more products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan S., 39, is married with five children and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She sells vegetables and grocery items and is able to make US$15 in revenue every day. Her husband stays at home and helps his wife sell groceries. Four of the children are in school. Tan S. is asking for a loan to diversify her grocery items and build a bathroom for her family.

loans.use: To diversify grocery products and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun S. is 30 years old and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She raises pigs and is able to make about US$5 every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a recycler and earns US$4 per day. This couple has three children and all of them are in school. Lun S. is asking for a loan for her husband to reinvest in his recycling business.

loans.use: To reinvest in the recycling business.

loans.name: Ey's Group

texts.en:
This small group is made up of three members, all residents in Svay DongKom Commune, Siem Reap Province. Mr. Ey Ei has been selected to be group leader by the group members.

Ey E., 37, is a family man who makes a daily income by providing a taxi service. He is married to Mom, 32, who sells a little breakfast food to neighbors in the village. The couple has one teenage child who is a student. Ey E. always used his popular motorcycle to satisfy his customers’ requirements. His clients are neighbors, passers-by, and tourists. He is applying for a loan to exchange his existing motorcycle since it often has broken down.

The other two borrowers are: S., a domestic taxi driver who has requested a loan to replace his old motorcycle; and T., who owns a car for providing a taxi service and needs a loan to repair his car. They hope the loan will provide them with an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To exchange his existing motorcycle

loans.name: Um's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Um V. is the leader of this three-member group. All of the borrowers live in Toul TaEk Commune of Battambang Province in Cambodia. V. has been in the business of selling groceries in the market for more than nine years. She is now a mother of two children who are students in the local school. To help meet the family's expenses, her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver.

Since V. has started her investment, she has gained more income and she has supported her family's food requirement sufficiently. Because V.'s investment is growing, she is requesting a loan to increase her stocks of groceries for sale.

The other two borrowers are H., 53, who sells cooked produce in the market and asks for a loan to expand her business, and T., 23, who is a local tailor needing a loan to buy clothes for her tailoring service.

loans.use: To increase her stocks of groceries

loans.name: Fall's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Fall S. F. is the leader of a three-member borrowing group.  They all live in Norea Commune of Battambang Province.

Fall S. F., 49, earns a living by selling fish.  She usually gets up early each morning and buys different kinds of fishes wholesale and sell retail, to gain income.  She is married and has given birth to six children who attend school.  Her husband assists her in selling fishes. To enlarge her business and earn additional income, Fall S. F. is asking for a loan to increase her capital to buy more fishes to sell. 

The other two borrowers are: Yoeu S., 32, who sells fishes inside the market.  He requests a loan to buy fishes to sell.  Sin S., 34, is a motorcycle taxi driver.  He seeks for a loan to run a grocery store.

loans.use: To increase more her capital for buying fishes to sell

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro D. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan.  She is married with two children.  Zuhro is very cheerful and full of enthusiasm, despite the difficult financial situation. 

She works hard to ensure a good future for her children.  Zuhro makes pastries and the traditional national bread known as “lepeshky.”   It is hard work.  She makes the special dough and bakes it in a special flamed place.  Zuhro is requesting a business development loan of 3000 STJ, for 4 months.  The money will buy and import flour from Kyrgyzstan, good flour for national bread making.

Her husband went to the Russian Federation but he could not find appropriate work because of the financial crisis.

loans.use: Buy and import flour.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S., 35, is a villager living in Battambang Province, Cambodia.  She is applying for a loan to increase her stock of grocery items for sale. Chan currently sells some products to neighbors in the village and she generates a daily income of $2.50. Chan is married to Mr. Ya, 47, who helps support the family by driving a motor taxi. The couple lives with two teenage children who attend school.  They hope the loan will help them attain a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Increase her stock of groceries for sale.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas D. applied first in 2002 for a business development loan. Thanks to previous loans, she could start her business making the national traditional bread. She works together with her sister, who makes the special dough and bakes it. Mukaddas sells it in the bazaar; she also makes the dough.

Mukaddas is requesting a business support loan of 3,600STJ (US$975) for four months to open a specialized trade outlet and purchase coal. She thanks Kiva for its support and small business development.

loans.use: To open a trade outlet and purchase coal

loans.name: Grenly

texts.en:
Mrs. Grenly Y., 52 years old, is married and lives at Poblacion Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She has four children; one is in college. Their source of income is from selling “lechon” (roasted pig, a Filipino delicacy). They started their business in 1976 and it is still doing well today.

With increasing demands, they opted to seek financial assistance. That’s why in August 2008, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to use their loan facilities. She was able to pay her previous loan and is now applying for PHP10,000 (US$225). 

The amount will be used for her lechon business and venturing into duck raising. She is hopeful that someday, her business will expand to other areas and become successful with duck raising.

loans.use: To buy pigs for "lechon" business and start-up capital for duck raising

loans.name: Leody

texts.en:
Mr. Leody C. is a responsible father to his three children and all are in school. He is 41 years old and resides at P-5, Talairon, Oroquieta City. His wife stays home and takes care of their “sari-sari” store (general store) for income.

Mr. C. bought a motorcycle to be used as public vehicle. He believes this will help their family with added income. 

Recently, he joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to obtain additional working capital for his sari-sari store as well as to buy spare parts and tires for his motorcycle that was damaged. 

In the future, he will be happy enough if all his children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy additional commodities for sale and major repair of motorcycle

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Ms. Rona J. is 26 years old, single and a resident of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis, Occidental. The eldest of three children, she helps her parents in their small business, Amakan Vending. Amakan is woven bamboo often used in furniture. They started their small business through a cash advance from their existing clients. They want to expand their business, but lack the capital.

She heard from a friend about Paglaum, which offers credit services with a minimal interest rate. She attended the weekly center meeting and asked for some information on how to join. She received her first loan for additional capital and has paid it in a timely manner. 

She’s on her third cycle of loans amounting to Php7,000 (US$150) for additional purchases of bamboo for the business. For a almost a year since she become a member of Paglaum, she has appreciated the services that Paglaum has for its members' welfare. Through the capital, their business is slowly growing and their clients are also increasing in number.  

She is hoping that someday all her dreams will be realized. She really wants to help her parents to have a better life and all her siblings to finish their degrees.

loans.use: Purchase bamboo for amakan making

loans.name: Mongolmaa

texts.en:
Mongolmaa O., 28, lives with her parents and younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2007, she has been running a cellular phone sales business through a rented stall at the Tedy center. Tedy is the biggest cellular phone sales center in Ulaanbaatar.

When she began her retail business, her working capital was 1.5 million MNT ($1USD=1,600 MNT). She pays $230 monthly to rent her stall. Mongolmaa's average monthly income is 3 million MNT, and her average monthly profit from her business is 300,000 MNT. Once every three months she visits Ereen, a Chinese border city where many Mongolians who run businesses buy their goods, and brings back cheap cell phones to resell. Now, her working capital has increased to 5 million MNT. Her business has become quite successful. She is the only one in her family who brings in an income, as her parents are retired. Her younger sister is a university student and Mongolmaa pays for her tuition. "My sister will graduate from university next year. Then she will begin to work and become a salaried employee. At that time I hope my family's living condition will be improved," Mongolmaa says in Mongolian. She is a hard-working and humble personality. With this loan, she will buy more cellular phones.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mrs. M. is a resident of Barangay Napilan, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and blessed with six children. Two of her children are studying in college and high school. She has a Sari-Sari Store and started it during her first cycle of loans. She sells to neighboring barangays, or towns.

She is requesting Php14,500 (US$325) to buy additional inventory. Her business helps in supporting her family's daily needs and by sending her children to school.

She is thankful to Paglaum for helping them in their capital needs. Her hope and aspiration for the business is to become a mini-grocery someday. She’s also hoping that, with the help of her business, she can send her children to school and have a better standard of living for the family.

loans.use: Purchase additional items for sari-sari store

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia O. is 47 years old and married to Vicente. They find comfort residing at Calaca-an Misamis Occidental. They are blessed with four children. 

Her husband is retired from the Philippine military and already helps her to manage their small business, a Sari-Sari Store. Letecia has been a good member of Paglaum MPC since 2004. In fact, she manages her business well, and it's a big help for her in meeting the financial needs of her children in school.

She hopes that through the help of Paglaum MPC her business will expand to a mini-grocery store in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase of grocery items

loans.name: Leolinda

texts.en:
Leolinda is a resident of Sulipat Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married and blessed with seven children. Two of her children are in school and one is already married. Her husband works in farming and she operates a small Sari-Sari Store at their residence. She started her business with some small capital. 

She heard from a friend about Paglaum; she was convinced to join and immediately applied for membership. She was recognized last Aug. 27, 2008, and used the credit services for additional capital of her existing Sari-Sari Store. She is applying for Php 5,000 to purchase additional inventories such as canned goods and bottled items.


She is thankful that Paglaum became her financing partner. She added that it is a big help for the family to have additional capital for the business. For now Mrs. F. continues doing her daily activities and struggling against poverty. She hopes that someday her business will expand for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additonal grocery items for Sari-Sari Store

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma L., 48, is a housewife with two children. Her family resides in Plaridel Misamis, Occidental, a place where fishing is a primary activity for earning a living. Her husband is a fisherman and already owns a small boat and operates a little variety store. 

They have applied for a PHP15,000(US$325) loan to buy an additional motorized pumpboat. Elma hopes to earn additional income so she can fix their house someday and welcomes the thought of seeing their children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase additional boat for fishing

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes D. dreams of a simple life that is fulfilled and satisfied. She is 43 years old, married and resides at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. She has three children. She wants to give all of her support to her children, who are presently studying. Her husband is a laborer. 

Because of her husband’s unstable income, she has found ways to sustain the needs of her family. She spends most of her time working, working and working. Fortunately, her eldest child works in a famous restaurant in the city and helps her with their daily expenses.  

At present, she is thinking of venturing into pig raising. In order to have working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in August 2008. Now, she is applying for PHP10,000(US$225) to buy piglets and feed. In the future, she will be fulfilled and contented if all her children will have successful careers and obtain a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
A. Albertine  est née vers 1981 à Ganvié, village lacustre dans le département de l'Atlantique au Sud du Bénin. A. Albertine  est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont seul l'aîné est scolarisé. 
Depuis son enfance A. Albertine  vend du poisson frais d’abord pour  mère ensuite pour son propre compte.  Mais, il y a deux mois,  A. Albertine  a commencé aussi à  vendre de  la nourriture  (haricot préparé , mangé avec le  pain ou la farine de manioc et de l’huile rouge).  A. Albertine a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé.  A. Albertine  veut un  troisième crédit  pour  renforcer  son activité de vente de nourriture.  A. Albertine espère  avec ses revenus, aider son mari, un pêcheur, à acquérir une barque pour la pêche. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Albertine A. was born circa 1981 in Ganvié, a lake village in the Atlantique district, in Southern Benin. Albertine is married and has three children, of which only the eldest goes to school. Since she was a child, Albertine has been selling fish, first with her mother, then on her own. But two months ago, Albertine also started to sell food (prepared beans, to be eaten with bread or manioc flour and red oil). Albertine has already received two credits with ALIDé. She requested a third loan to strengthen her food sales activity. Albertine hopes to help her husband who is a fisherman with her profits, to buy a small boat to go fishing. The meaning of ALIDé in Benin local language - Fon - is "a path always exists for the poorest". Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. ALIDé offers special credits at 0% interest rate for very vulnerable people, and is part of a group that soon will launch a program of heath micro-insurance for the beneficiaries of a micro-credit.

Translated from French by anne-laure behaghel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bag of beans and gari (manioc flour), 50 litres of red oil, a basket of chili, a basket of oignons.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangeline F. is a simple yet hardworking wife and mother. She is 40 years old, married and resides at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She aims to have a bigger store and enough space for her business.

As of now, they are the wholesaler of fresh “pancit” (fresh noodles) in town. They cater to two cities, Oroquieta and Ozamis. With the extreme demand, their working capital is insufficient to meet the needs of clients. 

Considering the situation, Mrs. F. decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to buy flour, oil and ingredients for making pancit. She prefers to buy ingredients in volume to receive discounts and earn higher returns. She is applying for a loan of PHP10,000 (US$225) now. Granting this loan would be a great help for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour, oil and ingredients for "pancit" making

loans.name: Koam's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Koam C. is the leader of this five-member group of borrowers who all live in the Nokor Tom Commune of Siem Reap Province. Koam C. is a 30-year-old widowed mother of four children, who are all single and going to secondary school. She currently works as a domestic construction worker. As another income source, she also cultivates rice on her own farmland in the village. She works hard every day at her business activities because she wants her children to get the highest education in the future. The family's living conditions are not comfortable because their house is lacking parts, hence Koam C. is asking for a loan to buy wood to repair her house.

The other four borrowers are: M., who sells different kinds of groceries from home and requests a loan to decorate her house; M., a construction worker applying for a loan to repair her old house; V., who sells soft drinks in bulk and seeks a loan to increase her stock of soft drinks; and S., who sells beef from home and is looking for a loan to enlarge her business operation.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair her house

loans.name: Honoré

texts.fr:
H. Honoré est né vers 1966 à Ganvié. Initié à la pêche dès son enfance,la pêche constitue encore aujourd'hui la seule et unique activité de H. Honoré. H. Honoré mène sa pêche depuis dix ans dans les eaux de la lagune de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. H. Honoré est marié et père de 5 enfants dont deux  sont scolarisés. Les trois autres enfants de H. Honoré l'aident pour la pêche. H. Honoré a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. Avec ces deux prêts, H. Honoré a vu son niveau de vie s'amélioré. C'est pour acquérir de nouveaux filets de plus grande résistance que H. Honoré sollicite un troisième prêt. Dans l'avenir H. Honoré souhaite acquérir une seconde  barque motorisée. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Honoré H. was born circa 1966 in Ganvié. Introduced to fishing during his childhood, this still constitutes his only business. He's been fishing for ten years in the Cotonou lagoon. Cotonou is the economic capital of Benin. He's married and the father of 5 children, out of which two attend school. The other three help him fish. Honoré H. already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner Alidé. With these loans, he managed to improve his standard of living. He's seeking a third loan to purchase new, stronger fishnets. In the future, he wishes to buy a second motorized small boat.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 rolls of fishnet with all fishing accessories

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo C. is determined and hardworking. He is 72 years old, married, and lives at Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Although he’s older, he still very works hard to earn an income, and he’s happy about what he’s been doing. He has 6 children. His income comes from his “sari-sari” (general) store, in which his wife is his partner. They have good chemistry. 

Because of the benefits that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative has given to pensioners like him, he decided to take a loan to buy additional canned goods and other supplies for his sari-sari store. He wanted to expand his business into a grocery store that offers a variety products for sale. He also wanted to have a restaurant adjacent to his grocery store.

loans.use: To buy canned goods and other supplies for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
K. Elisabeth est née vers 1981 à Ganvié. K. Elisabeth est mariée à MIGNANWANDE Lissanon et mère de cinq enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. K. Elisabeth a été initiée depuis son enfance à la vente de poisson. K. Elisabeth continue de mener cette activité de vente de poisson. K. Elisabeth a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. K. Elisabeth veut diversifier un peu son activité avec la vente de récipients et bassines en plastique. C'est pourquoi K. Elisabeth sollicite un troisième crédit; ainsi K. Elisabeth va pouvoir tirer plus de revenus de ses activités lui permettant de satisfaire au mieux ses besoins.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Elisabeth K. was born circa 1981 in Ganvié, she's married to Lissanon MIGNANWANDE and the mother of five children, out of which two attend school. She was introduced to fish selling during her childhood. To this day, she continues to run this business. She already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, Alidé. She wants to diversify her business by selling plastic basins and containers. This is the reason why she's seeking a third loan, which will enable her to increase her profit and to better provide for herself.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 plastic baskets and 15 plastic containers

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
In the town of Aloran, there lives a certain Mrs. Andresa G., 63 years old. She is blessed with 3 children. Her husband has no permanent job and works as a laborer on an on-call basis. Despite her age, she still works hard to support the family. 

Luckily, her business, which is a “sari-sari” (general) store, has been doing well. To expand her business and enable her to sell a variety of goods, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in March 2008. She was able to renovate her store and buy “kalan” (man-made pottery products made of clay). 

Now she is applying for PHP 15,000 to buy additional merchandise to sell, particularly soft drinks, canned goods, and other basic commodities. In the future, she plans to venture into copra (coconut) sales in addition to her “sari-sari” store. She also prays that her husband will have his own business one of these days.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya P., age 43, lives with her husband and three children in a traditional Mongolian "ger" (a yurt or circular tent that dates back hundreds of years into Mongolia's nomadic past). The family lives in a ger district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since 2006, she has been running a retail business. Narantuya is an artist. She creates unique wall hangings by using crochet and polished stones. Her wall hangings are very intricate and usually depict classic Mongolian images. Narantuya loves her work and teaches her art form to those who want to learn. She works from home while taking care of her youngest child, who is two years old. She sells her art products through two art shops. 

Her business capital is 800,000 MNT (~$485 USD; USD $1=MNT 1650). Her monthly average income from this business is 120,000 MNT ($73 USD). She is planning to expand her business by increasing her business capital. She has a humble and indefatigable personality. With this loan, she will buy cotton, wooden frames and polished stones.

loans.use: To buy cotton, wooden frames and polished stones

loans.name: Hodonou Jacob

texts.fr:
Y. Hodonou Jacob est vers 1974 à Ganvié. Y. Hodonou Jacob est marié et père de trois enfants dont les deux premiers sont scolarisés. Y. Hodonou Jacob a commencé à aller à la pêche avec son père depuis qu'il était tout-petit. Aujourd'hui, c'est la même pêche qui nourrit Hodonou Jacob avec toute sa famille. Hodonou Jacob a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. Quand Hodonou Jacob compare le niveau actuel de son activité à sa situation initiale avant qu'il ne commence par bénéficier de prêt à ALIDé, Hodonou Jacob trouve qu'il y a une nette amélioration. Hodonou Jacob a pour but d'acheter de nouveaux filets. C'est pourquoi Hodonou Jacob sollicite un troisième crédit. Y. Hodonou Jacob aimerait pour cette cette année, ce doter de différents types de filets pour mieux  rentabiliser son activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Hodonou Jacob Y. was born circa 1974 in Ganvié. He's married and the father of three children, out of which the two elder ones attend school. When he was a little boy, he started going fishing with his father. Today, his fishing business enables him to provide for himself and his entire family. Hodonou Jacob already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner Alidé. When Hodonou Jacob compares his current living standard with his situation before he obtained the loans, he sees a clear improvement. With this third loan, he plans to buy new fishnets. In the course of the year, he would like to buy various kinds of fishnets in order to make his business more profitable.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2.5 rolls of fishnets with all fishing accessories

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan S. is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She runs a small restaurant near the taxi station where she sells snack foods and soft drinks. She sells her products to passengers and taxi drivers. 

She married to Savan, age 41, who is a motorcycle taxi driver, and who helps her to sell food. The family has three children, all of whom are students, and they always help her work when they are not studying. 

S.'s investment is running well and she has gained much income. Most of her clients frequently recognize her and the delicious foods she cooks and sells. Because S.'s workshop is too small, she would like to ask for a loan to increase size of her workshop. 

S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To increase the size of her workshop

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Кабиров Джурабек проживает в районе Джилликуль.Возраст 32 года , женат и имеет пятерых детей.Занимается животноводством . Имеет хозяйство , где разводит мелко рогатый скот. Опыт работы составляет три года. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jurabek K. lives in Jilikul. He is 32 years old, married, and has five children. He works in animal husbandry. He has a plot of land where he raises livestock. He has three years experience. He plans to take out a loan to increase his flocks. He can pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of likestock

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Née vers les années 1971, D. Sophie est mariée à ATTIGBEDJO Benoît et est mère de deux filles toutes scolarisées. D. Sophie mène comme activité la vente de vivres comme le maïs, le haricot et aussi la vente de tenues d'enfants et la restauration c'est-à-dire la vente du riz et du haricot préparés. D.
