Sophie s’approvisionne sur les marchés locaux du Bénin et aussi au Togo, un pays de l'Afrique de l'Ouest frontalier au Bénin. D. Sophie mène l’activité de la vente de vivres et de tenues d'enfants depuis 15 ans. C’est après son 1er prêt à ALIDé que D. Sophie a commencé par vendre de nourriture tous les matins. Toujours dans le souci de répondre à la demande de ses clients D. Sophie sollicite un troisième prêt.   

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Sophie D. was born circa 1971, she's married to Benoît ATTIGBEDJO and the mother of two girls who attend school. Her business consists in selling food products such as corn and beans, as well as children clothing and also in catering (selling cocked rice and bean dishes). She gets her supplies from local markets in Benin and also in Togo, a neighboring country in Western Africa. She's been in this business for 15 years. After obtaining her first loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé, Sophie started selling food every morning. Always anxious to meet customer demand, she's seeking a third loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice and children clothing

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama G. est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Nassinkar depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente d’huile de palme et de crèmes glaces. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du pain de singe et du sucre  pour  renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama G. is married and has 3 children to support. She's been a member of the village bank of Nassinkar for six and a half years. Her business consists in selling palm oil and ice cream. She wants to purchase palm oil, "monkey breads" (baobab tree fruits), and sugar to bolster her business and improve the living and health standards of her family. She's applying for a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To retail palm oil and ice cream

loans.name: Adama Mama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Mama D. est un âgé de 33 ans et vit avec sa femme et son enfant  chez son père dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Adama a tenté plusieurs activités génératrices sans réussite notamment l’achat et la vente d’habits,  de chaussures, a même fait le chauffeur d’un particulier. Il  finit par opter pour la vente des boissons de fabrication industrielle depuis maintenant deux ans. Il  a entrepris ce créneau commercial (vente de boissons) par l’entremise de son oncle. Les fêtes religieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les occasions pendant lesquelles les ventes de boissons sont  considérables, sans oublier ces temps ci, période d’intense chaleur.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires il décida de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des dépositaires agrées pour venir revendre à Bougouni à une clientèle composée de  boutiquiers, de restaurateurs et des détenteurs de bar. 
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama Mama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA.
 Dans les années à venir il envisage être un dépositaire de boissons à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Mama D., 33, lives with his wife and child in his father's household in the Hérémakono Centre district of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Adama tried out several money-earning activities without success, notably buying and selling clothing and shoes, and he even tried out being a chauffeur for a private citizen. He ended up deciding to sell industrially-produced drinks and has been at this business for the last two years. He got into this commercial niche selling drinks with the help of his uncle. Religious holidays and important ceremonies (baptism, marriage) are occasions where a lot of drinks are sold, as is this season of the year where the weather is so very hot.

In his search for complementary financial resources, he decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan.

He buys his merchandise in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from official depots and then sells it in Bougouni to a clientele composed of shopkeepers and restaurant and bar owners. With this loan Mr. Adama Mama D. expects to make a monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA. In the coming years, he hopes to have his own drinks depot in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of alcoholic and non-alcoholic (fizzy) drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Ahmat

texts.ru: Худойбердиев Ахмат проживает в Джилликульском районе.Возраст 52 года, женат и имеетпятерых детей. Бизнесмен. Занимается земледелием. Выращивает различного рода сельхоз культуры. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Закупив своевременно качественную продукцию , он сможет получить каченственный урожай. Это возместит расходы и даст дополнительную прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ahmat H. lives in the Jilikul area. He is 52 years old, married, and has five children. He is a businessman working in agriculture. He grows various agricultural products. He plans to take out a loan to buy seed and fertilizers. If he purchases modern, quality products, he can harvest a high-quality crop. It will both cover his expenses and leave him with a profit. He can pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang P. usually buys fish in bulk from suppliers and fisherman and then sells them retail them in the local market. She is 39 years old and is a villager living in rural area of Kompong Tom province. She is married and has two children who are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Ban, age 45, is a local building foreman. 

Neang P. is requesting a loan of $600 to increase her current capital. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her current capital

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jean Claude B. est un  célibataire de 21 ans qui vit  chez ses parents  dans le quartier Torakabougou Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir fini ses études secondaires en Comptabilité, Monsieur Jean Claude décide de mener  une activité génératrice de revenus. Après avoir tenté plusieurs telle l’achat vente de tissus, il opta finalement pour les  jeux téléchargés. Il fît ses premiers pas  auprès d’un de ses  amis.
Avec une expérience de 3 ans, Monsieur Jean Claude B. arrive à bien s’en sortir car maîtrise son activité et devient la coqueluche des jeunes de la ville. Les week-end,  congés de Noël, de pâques et les grandes vacances sont les périodes  intenses pour son activité.
Pour améliorer son entreprise, il décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte  acheter avec ce prêt,  1 téléviseur pour les jeux téléchargés et 4 cassettes à  Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Ses clients sont généralement les jeunes du quartier. 
Avec ce prêt, monsieur Jean Claude B. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA.
 Dans les années à venir il envisage ouvrir une autre salle de jeux dans un autre quartier de Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Jean Claude B., age 21, is an unmarried man who lives at his parents’ place in the Torakabougou Bougouni district (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After finishing his secondary studies in accounting, he decided to work in an incoming-generating activity. After having tried several kinds of work, such as buying and selling cloth, he finally opted for downloaded games. He made his initial steps with one of his friends.

With three years of experience, Mr. Jean Claude B. is managing to come out of it nicely because he’s mastering his business and becoming the idol of youngsters in town. Weekends, Christmas and Easter holidays, and vacation times are when business is intense.

To improve his enterprise, he decided to join the loan program of the finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which he is now on his first individual loan. He intends to use this loan to buy a television set for downloaded games and four cassettes in Bamako (capital of Mali). His customers are generally young people of the district.

With this loan, he plans to realize a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. In the years to come, he envisions opening another game room in another district of Bougouni.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a television set and four game cassettes

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: Fatou Bintou D. est mariée avec des enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Nassinkar depuis 2 ans. Son activité est la vente d’huile de palme et de balaies. Elle veut renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Fatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou D. is married and has children to support. She's been a member of the Nassinkar village bank for 2 years. Her business consists in selling palm oil and brooms. She wants to bolster her business and improve the living and health standards of her family. She's applying for a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil and brooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) for resale

loans.name: Arslan

texts.ru: Палванов Арслан проживает в районе Джилликуль. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей. В сфере бизнеса работает уже три года. Имеет магазин по продаже автозапчастей. Его бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому он планирует развивать дело . Для этого он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Arslan P. lives in Jilikul. He is married and has four children. He works in sales. He has been in business for three years. He has an auto parts shop. This business is the only source of income for his family. Therefore, he plans to develop the business. In order to do that, he has decided to take out a loan for twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales

loans.name: Luvsanpurev

texts.en:
Luvsanpurev P. lives with his mother and two younger brothers in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. Although he is married, he has been living apart from his spouse. 

In 2006, he began to make wooden home furniture and to paint the decorative wood beams of "gers" (a "ger" or yurt is a form of traditional, nomadic Mongolian housing). He gets paid 100,000 MNT for painting all the beams for one ger. When he began to run his furniture business, his business capital was 300,000 MNT. Now it has increased to 500,000 MNT. Also, he now has his own workshop next to his home. 

Luvsanpurev is very good at attracting clients. He really believes in himself. In the future, he thinks he will have a bigger workplace and will attract clients from other provinces. With this loan, he will buy paint, brushes and decorative stencils for his business.

loans.use: To buy paint, brushes and decorative stencils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second-hand goods for resale

loans.name: Benkadi (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de cinq femmes mariées vivant majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne  35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent ensemble dans le quartier Rails Ko de Markala (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali) où elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et  d’amitié.
Elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso suite à une assemblée générale tenue à la Mairie de la  commune rurale de Markala à l’intention des Artisans et petits Entrepreneurs de la dite localité. Elles excellent dans le secteur de l’alimentaire (restauration, fabrication de boisson non alcoolisées, ventes de produits alimentaires etc.).  
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles décidèrent d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe), après avoir correctement remboursés les trois premiers.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter 2 sacs d’oignons frais,1 bassine de tomates fraîches,  2 bassines de gombo séché dont une partie est transformée en poudre, 2 cartons de poissons séchés, 2 sacs de fonio,1sac de graines d’arachide transformées en (Djouga : couscous à base de fonio et d’arachide), 2 cartons de pommes de terre vendues sous forme de fritures et de ragoûts ; 2 sacs de sucre, 1sac de gingembre,1sac d’oseille de Guinée, 25 kg de lait en poudre et 1 carton d’essence (arômes) pour la préparation des boissons (gingembre, dableni : jus de feuilles d’oseille de Guinée et yaourt). 
Elles se ravitaillent en pomme de terre, fonio et arachide à Sikasso et quant aux produits pour les boissons locales et les condiments  à la foire de Diamarabougou. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants à domicile en ambulant, dans les gargotes et au marché. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 43 750FCFA qui servira pour le remboursement du prêt et à l’achat des fournitures scolaires des enfants. Leur objectif est d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of five married women living for the most part in monogamous families. The women average 35 years of age and 5 children each. They live together in the Rails Ko district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), where they know one another through ties of community and friendship. They were knowledgeable of Soro Yiriwaso (a micro-finance institution) following a general assembly held at the town hall of the rural community of Markala that was intended for artisans and small-scale entrepreneurs of the aforementioned town. The women excel in the food sector (restaurants, selling grocery items, etc.)

Concerned with satisfying their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan) after having correctly repaid the first three. This loan will be used to buy: two sacks of fresh onions, one basin of fresh tomatoes, two basins of dried okra (a portion in powdered form), two sacks of fonio (a kind of millet), one sack of peanuts for making into djouga (couscous made of fonio and peanuts), two boxes of potatoes to be sold fried or stewed, two sacks of sugar, one sack of ginger, one sack of dried hibiscus flowers, 25 kg of powdered milk, and one box of flavorings for making beverages (ginger and dableni: a drink of hibiscus flower and yoghurt).

Supplies of potatoes, fonio, and peanuts are gotten in Sikasso. As for the goods for making local beverages and the condiments, these are gotten at the Diamarabougou fair. Sales are made to customers composed of men, women, and children, cash or credit accepted, at the house, door-to-door, in eateries, and at the marketplace.

The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 43,750 francs CFA for making loan payments and for buying school supplies for the children. Their objective is to have a house for living in.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and essential ingredient for making a local dish (djouga) and local beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second-hand goods for resale

loans.name: Toshpulat

texts.ru: Эшболтаев Тошпулот проживает в районе Джилликуль. Возраст 32 года. Женат , но детей не имеет. Живет в очень большой семье. Живет с рождителями и семьей брата. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно рогатый скот. Занимается этим бизнесом уже шесть лет.В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Toshpulat A. lives in Jilikul. He is 32 years old. He is married but has no children. He lives with a very big family. He lives with his parents and brother’s family. He works in animal husbandry. He raises cattle. He has been doing this work for six years. At present, he plans to take out a loan to increase the number of cattle he has. He plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase number of livestock

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng P., age 43, is a local palm climber. By climbing palm, he can tap palm juice from palm trees and then boil it to make palm sugar or turn it into palm wine to sell. He currently earns an average of US $3.00 each day to help feed his family. 

He is married to Eng, age 30, who helps him in the business, boiling palm juice into sugar to sell. The couple has four children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school. 

Heng P. is asking for a loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle that he can use to transport sugar to the market to sell. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: M. Célestine

texts.fr:
Née vers les années 1952, M. M. Célestine est mariée à ASSA Innocent et est mère de 6 enfants dont un décédé et les 5 autres scolarisés. M. Célestine mène comme activité principale depuis les années 1978 la restauration (poissons, crabes, crevettes , pâte de maïs). Célestine s’approvisionne en poissons soit dans les poissonneries ou au bord du lac. Grâce à son activité Célestine a pu acheter une parcelle de terrain. Célestine est à son troisième crédit avec ALIDé. Soucieuse de répondre au mieux à la demande de ses clients Célestine sollicite à nouveau de prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born around 1952, Ms. M. M. Célestine is married to Mr. ASSA Innocent and is the mother of six children, one of whom passed away, and the others are in school. Célestine has been in the restaurant business (fish, crabs, shrimp, corn mash) since 1978 as her main work. She supplies herself with fish either from the fisheries or at the lake shore. Thanks to her business, she has been able to buy a parcel of land. She is on her third loan with ALIDÉ. Wanting to respond to the demands of her customers better, she's requesting a new loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish, corn, peanut oil, and condiments for sauce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and to build a garage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Хаитов Анвар житель Джилликульского района. Возраст 27 лет .Женат и имеет двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование . Занимается животноводством. Скупает бычков для откормки . Затем продает их на тех же рынках. Планирует получить кредит. Использовать деньги хочет для покупки бычка.Таким образом он увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Anvar H. lives in the area around Jilikul. He is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. He has a higher education. He works in animal husbandry. He buys calves for fattening. Then, he sells them in the same markets where he bought them. He plans to take out a loan. He wants to use the money to buy a calf. That way he can increase the number of cattle he has. He can pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase number of livestock

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga C., age 42, lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 18 and 14, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2002, she has been running a shoe sales business at Narantuul, the biggest year-round outdoor market in Mongolia. When she started her business, she sold shoes through only one stall, but within a couple of years, she was able to buy a second stall to expand her business, and she began to employ one saleswoman. 

She periodically visits Ereen, a Mongolian town just across Mongolia's border with China, where many Mongolians who run businesses buy their goods. She brings back shoes to resell. Though her supplies from Ereen have helped her business to grow, Gantulga plans to go to Beijing from now on for her wholesale purchases, to avail herself both of the higher quality products there and the larger variety of shoes that are offered. 

With her profits, she recently bought a vehicle for her family. Her husband runs a taxi business with his own car. Gantulga's eldest daughter will be graduating from high school next spring. Hence, Gantulga is saving money for her daughter to enroll in a university. "I want my children to become educated persons. I'll try my best to make my wish come true," she said in Mongolian. With this loan, she will buy shoes in Beijing.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Betania 1B Group

texts.en:
Betania 1b is a group of 10 farmers in Nekmese Naet Village – Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. This group is led by Ande K., a 29-year-old man. He is married and has 1 daughter, aged 1. His wife usually helps him on the farm. The soil in Nekmese Naet Village where Ande lives is fertile, and it has potential to growth coconut and banana. Most of the community in this village relies on the agricultural sector to earn money. The weather and climate in this area is good as the season changes every 6 months. 

Ande is interested in the cattle fattening program because he wants to improve his living standard as a farmer, and the availability of cattle food that he has encourages him to join the cattle fattening program. Ande is requesting loan from TLM amounting to Rp 3,300,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened in 12 months. The other borrowers of Betania 1b group are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened. After the cattle have been fattened for 12 months, they will be sold and the initial cost of the cattle will be repaid to the lender and the group members will get the profit from the sale.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Betania 1A Group

texts.en:
Apner N. is forty-two years old. He leads a group of 10 people, which is called Betania 1a Group. He lives in Nekmese - Naet, Kupang District, East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. The income source of the community in Nekmese Naet village is the agricultural sector. To earn money, Apner usually sells bananas, cucumbers, vegetables, cassavas, corns and coconuts in the traditional market as well as the markets in Kupang City, but he feels that the income that he earns is not enough to meet his family needs. Apner is a married man and has 4 children who are: Ricki N. 15 years old - in Junior High School Grade 3; Frengki N. 13 years old - in Elementary School Grade 6; Nonci N. 11 years old who has suffered from deafness since she was born. Apner can not send her to school because there is no school for deaf people in this village. And the last one is Reni N. 5 years old – who studies in the Kindergarten.

As a farmer, Apner wants to improve his income by running another business. He is interested in the cattle fattening program because it can generate a large profit. Apner is requesting Rp. 3,300,000 to buy cattle to be fattened. The same as Apner, the other group members are also requesting loans from TLM to buy cattle to be fattened over the 12 month period. They will repay the initial cost of the cattle and get the profit after selling the cattle. 

Note: The group picture was taken separately because 4 members of this group are involved in building the church in their village. Yurita also wasn't present when the group picture was taken, so her husband replaced her in the group picture.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr:
A. Séraphine est née dans les années 1972 et est mères de sept enfants tous scolarisés. A. Séraphine est mariée à AÏHA Raymond. A. Séraphine vend les divers(les produits concentrés, les pâtes alimentaires, les détergents, le sucre)ainsi que les produits vivriers tels que le maïs, le haricot,le mil. A. Séraphine vend dans l’un des marchés locaux de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. A. Séraphine s’approvisionne en divers à Tokpa, marché international du Bénin. Mais en ce qui concerne les produits vivriers, A. Séraphine s’approvisionne à glazoué-le grand marché des produits céréaliers. A. Séraphine a déjà eu deux crédits à ALIDé. Pour mieux développer son activité A. Séraphine sollicite un troisième prêt.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Séraphine A. was born in 1972 and is the mother of seven, all of whom are in school. Séraphine A. is married to Raymond Aïha. Séraphine A. sells sundries (concentrated products, pastas, detergents, sugar), as well as food-producing products like corn, beans, and millet. Séraphine A. sells in one of the local markets in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Séraphine A. stocks up on sundries in Tokpa, the international market in Benin. But when it comes to the food-producing products, Séraphine A. stocks up at Glazoué, the large grains market. Séraphine A. has already had two loans at Alidé. To increase her business, Séraphine A. seeks a third loan. The signification of Alidé in the local language of Benin, the Fon, is that: “There is always a way for the poorest.” Benin is a country in West Africa next to Nigeria where the GDP per inhabitant is $1,500. Alidé offers special loans at 0% interest to those who are vulnerable. She is also part of a group who will soon launch a micro-health insurance program for those receiving microcredit loans.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, detergent, sugar, soap and grains: rice, corn, millet, sorghum, bean, etc.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Суярова Диляфруз проживает в районе Джилликуль. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Имеет среднее образование. Работает в магазине "Ориеи" , который находиться в центре района. Работает в сфере бизнеса уже три года. Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот  , она планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilafruz S. lives in the area around Jilikul. She is married and has two children. She has a high school education. She works in a shop called “Oriei,” which is in the central part of the region. She has worked in business for three years. To increase her sales, she plans to take out a loan for twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru: Камолов  Наджмиддин проживает в районе Джилликуль. Женат , но детей не имеет. Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Опыт в бизнесе уже три года. Для расширения бизнеса планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Таким образом он привлечет новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует ав течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Najmiddin K. lives in the area around Jilikul. He is married, but has no children. He has shop where he sells food. He has three years experience in business. To expand his business, he plans to take out a loan and increase the variety of products he offers. Thus, he will gain new customers. He plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Daglive Molibo

texts.fr: Madame Daglive malibe est une femme mariée avec trois enfants (03), elle vit dans le quartier de hedzranawoé à lomé avec sa famille, cette dame est une revendeuse de céréales, elle a commencé à exercer cette activité depuis 1990, sa clientèle ne cesse de s’accroître. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locales d’assahon, notse et atakpamé. Elle veut rehausser son stock de marchandises, pour le faire elle demande à WAGES un prêt pour acheter  03 sacs de maïs, 04 sacs d’haricots et 02 sacs de mils. Son commerce lui permet d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
Daglive Malibo is a married woman with three children. She lives in the neighbourhood fo Hezranawoé in Lomé with her family. She sells cereals and has been doing so since 1990: her customer base continues to grow. She gets her product from the local markets of Assahon, Notse and Atakpamé. She wants to increase her stock of merchandise and has asked WAGES for a loan for this purpose: she will buy three bags of corn, four bags of beans and two bags of millet. Her business allows her to help her husband with the day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans and millet

loans.name: Cemara C Group

texts.en:
Cemara C Group is a group of 15 farmers who rely on farming and selling crops to meet their families' needs. This Group is led by Zakarias R., a 77 year old man. Zakarias lives in Niukbaun Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. He is married and has been blessed with 3 children. His children are: Thobias R., 18 years old; Merry Rasi, 15 years old – in Junior High School Grade 3; and Marthen R., 13 years old. Both Thobias and Marthen are not at school because they want to help their father (Zakarias) to earn money by farming. In this village, Zakarias works as a farmer who finances his family and the education of his children by selling banana, coconut and cassava. Sometimes the daily income that he earns is not enough to meet his family's needs. This is the reason why Zakarias wants to run another business. He is requesting a loan amounting to Rp 3,200,000 to buy cattle to be fattened.  Zakarias is interested in joining the cattle fattening program because he can benefit by the profit of the cattle sale. He has a dream to send his children to the university. 

The other members of this group also face the same situation as Zakarias faces. Their income from farming is not enough to meet their family's needs. And like Zakarias, they also want to improve their standard of living by running another business. They are interested in the cattle fattening program because they feel that this program can help them to generate more income for their family and for that reason, they are requesting a loan to buy cattle to be fattened. 

Note: When the group picture was taken, Anika and Sarluta weren’t present, so their husbands replaced them in the group picture.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr:
Z. Léa est née vers 1966 à Agonlin, département de Mono. Z. Léa est mariée à AYIDONOUGBO Benjamin et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Z. Léa réside à fidjrossè en banlieue de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Z. Léa a pour activité la vente de poissons et de crustacés frits accompagnés de pâte de maïs. Z. Léa s’approvisionne en poisons et crustacés au marché international de Cotonou et aussi au bord de nos côtes lagunaires. Z. Léa vend également de charbon de bois. Grâce à ses activités Z. Léa arrive à aider son mari pour les charges courantes du foyer. Pour répondre au mieux à la demande de sa clientèle et faire croître ses activités Z. Léa sollicite actuellement un troisième prêt.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Lea Z. was born around 1966 in Agonlin, in the province of Mono. Lea Z. is married to Benjamin Ayidonougbo and is the mother of three children, all attending school. Léa Zanou resides in Fidjrossè outside the city of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Léa Z. sells fried fish and seafood accompanied with corn dough. Lea Z. obtains her fish and seafood at the international market in Cotonou as well as along the coasts and its lagoons. Lea Z. also sells charcoal. Thanks to these activities, Lea Z. is able to help her husband with household expenses. She is asking for a third loan so that she can grow her business to meet her client's demand. In the local language, le Fon, Alidé means "There is always a way for the poorest". Bénin is a country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans at 0% interest to those who are very vulnerable. It is also in a group who will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to those receiving micro-credit loans.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, corn, fish and seafood for her business

loans.name: Masuda

texts.en:
Masuda T. applied first to MicroInvest in 2009 and she liked the loan procedure, so she is taking a business support loan. Masuda lives in B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. 

Masuda sells food products at a mini-market that she opened in her own home. She has an assortment of vegetable oil, sugar, macaroni, tea, etc. 

Masuda is asking for a loan of 1600 STJ for 4 months to expand her assortment of goods.

loans.use: To expand her assortment of goods

loans.name: Azizov

texts.ru: Азизов Хайдарали проживает в Джиликульском районе. Возраст 25 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает  в сфере услуг. Имеет столовую в которой работает уже два года. Столовая находиться в центре района . На центральном рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить инвентарь. Таким образом он сможет улучшить качество обслуживания и привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует  в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
H. Azizov lives in the Djikulskiy region. He is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is occupied in 'services' sector of the economy. He has owned a cafe for the last 2 years. It is located in the central part of the city in the central market. He would like to obtain a loan to purchase additional equipment. That way, he will be able to improve the quality of his services and attract new customers. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette  femme  habite le quartier  de forever, elle exerce  comme activité le commerce de charbons de bois qui est très rentable à Lomé parce que le charbon de bois est très utilisé à Lomé pour préparer  la nourriture. Elle a commencé à exercer ce commerce en 1999, elle réalise beaucoup de bénéfice parce qu’elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et à l’intérieur du pays les sacs de charbon de bois sont moins coûteux. Voulant rehausser son activité, elle demande à WAGES un prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est divorcée de son mari et à 02 enfants, elle travaille dur pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the Forever neighborhood. Her business consists in selling charcoal, which is very profitable in Lomé where charcoal is very much used to cook food. She started this business in 1999, and turns a good profit because she gets her supply in the interior of the country where sacks of charcoal are less expensive. Wanting to bolster her business, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES in order to purchase sacks of charcoal. She's divorced from her husband and has two children. She works hard to support them.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.en:
A. Abdukarim is a young married man with two kids, aged 3 and 1 and a half. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard for him to find a job and he thus he started his own business of selling teenagers' clothes and hats. Fortunately, he made good sales and his business is growing thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides. Abdukarim now needs a $ 2500 USD loan which he will use to buy goods to respond to his customers’ demand. He promises to repay this loan in 12 months. Abdukarim is very thankful to you for helping him improve his service and the quality of life of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new hats and T-shirts

loans.name: Malayev

texts.ru: Маллаев Нурмахмад проживает в районе Джилликуль. Имеет большую семью. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Обеспечивает семью путем торговли. Занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин рядом с домом. Торгует продуктами питания. Обеспечивает население своего кишлака свежими продуктами. В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
N. Malayev lives in the Djillikul region. He has a large family. He is married and has 5 children. He provides for his family by working in trade. He owns a grocery store close to his house. His business provides residents of his village with fresh produce. He would like to obtain a loan to increase his inventory. He plans to pay it off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en:
G. Kurbon is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have a two-year-old child. 

He has always been a hard worker. He started working at an early age, helping his mother with her clothing business, and contributing his earnings to them from the time that he was 15 years old. When Kurbon married, his expenses increased and he had to strike out on his own to build a business that would support his own family. With the help of his father, he started his own clothing-sales business and his wife helped him in her spare time. His business has grown little by little but he wants to continue to grow in order to better quality of life. 

Kurbon is asking for a $800 USD loan to buy merchandise for his business so that he can continue to expand it. He is offering to repay the loan in 12 months. He and his family are very grateful for the support you are providing to help them get ahead. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Eklou Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur A. eklou kodjo est un célibataire qui travaille dur pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, pour y arriver il a commencé par exercer depuis 2007 le commerce de portables et des accessoires de portables, il exerce son commerce dans une cabine  dans un quartier périphériques de Lomé appelé N’KAFU, il est le seul à exercer cette activité dans cette zone ce qui lui permet de réaliser beaucoup de recette, il s’approvisionne à DEKON où le commerce de portables est très animé. Son stock s’épuise, il demande donc à WAGES un crédit pour rehausser son stock.
texts.en:
Mr. Eklou Kodjo A. is single and works hard to provide for himself. To make ends meet he began a business in 2007 selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He has a stall in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé called N’Kafu. He is the only person running such a business in the area, which means sales are good. He gets his supplies from Dékon, which does a brisk business in mobile phones. As his inventory is running low, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to boost his stock.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Курбонова Раджабгуль проживает в районе Джилликуль. Возраст 42 года , замужем и имеет пятерых детей.Уже пять лет работает в сфере торговли. Имеет магазин , который находится рядом с ее домом . Торгует продуктами питания. Хочет расширить бизнес , путем ввоза нового ассортимента товара. Это даст возможность больше заработать. Для этого он планирует получить кредит. Погасить его он сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabgul Q. lives in the Djillikul region. She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has been working in trade for the last 5 years. She owns a grocery store that is located close to her house. She would like to expand her business by purchasing additional inventory. This will give her an opportunity to increase her income. To accomplish this, she would like to obtain a loan, which she plans to pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Annick

texts.fr:
L. Annick est mariée à EUSSOUME Pierre et mère de trois enfants dont deux scolarisés. L. Annick réside à fidjrossè, un banlieue de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. L. Annick vend de bouillie, de gâteaux, de charbon en détail et de l’huile d’arachide. Pour renforcer son capital, L. Annick sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Annick L. is married to Pierre Eussoume and is the mother of three children, two of whom are at school. She lives in Fidjrossé, a suburb of Cotonou, Bénin’s economic capital. Mrs. L. sells “bouillie” (a type of porridge), cakes, coal in bulk and peanut oil. To boost her capital, Mrs. L. is requesting a second loan from Alidé. In Bénin's local language, Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest.” Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to the most vulnerable and is part of a group that is about to launch a micro-health insurance program for beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, corn flour, sugar, peanut oil and coal

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
G. Munira has been selling groceries and drinks in “Panjshanbe,” Khujand's famous central market, for 5 years. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine her client's needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Munira is focused on expanding her business. Presently, she has a monthly income of about $400.

Munira is currently seeking a loan for $1500 USD for a term of 12 months. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Munira hopes to expand her grocery and improve the living standards of her family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food to increase of the range of goods in her store

loans.name: Léma Yérima

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une résidente du quartier de hedzranawoé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé, elle est mariée à un monsieur qui fait la mécanique automobile, elle a eu 02 enfants.
Yoyo léma exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a associée à cette activité la vente de cartes de recharges. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1996 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé.  Elle désire agrandir son activité pour mieux faire face à la clientèle, raison pour laquelle elle demande à WAGES son premier prêt pour acheter 02 cartons d’huile, 01 bidons d’huile, 02 sacs de riz et divers produits.
texts.en:
Léma Yoyo is a resident of the Hedzranawoé neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé. She is married to a car mechanic and has two children. To generate income, Mrs.Yoyo runs a business selling general foodstuffs. She has added to this the sale of rechargeable cell phone cards. She began the business in 1996 and buys her supplies from the main market in Lomé. She wants to grow the business in order to be of better service to her customers, hence the reason she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy two boxes of oil, one drum of oil, two bags of rice and miscellaneous items.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Otaqul

texts.ru: Алимардонов Отакул проживает в районе Вахш. Занимается фермерской деятельностью. Имеет дехканское хозяйство, а так же занимается животноводством. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Обратился к нам за кредитом , потому что хочет закупить комбикорм для своих животных. Это поможет завезти комбикорма оптом и сэкономить  деньги  на транспортировке. Погасить кердит сможет в  ечение 5 месяцев.
texts.en:
Otaqul A. lives in the Vahsh region. He is in the agriculture business. He owns an animal farm. He is married and has 4 children. He would like to obtain a loan so he could purchase feed for his livestock. Additional funds will help him to buy a large amount of feed at wholesale prices and save money on transportation costs. He plans to pay off his loan within 5 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Yawoa Akofa

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Totsi à lomé, elle est une revendeuse de sacs de sortie pour dame, elle exerce son activité près du marché local de Totsi, ce qui lui permet d’attirer beaucoup de clientes, elle a commencé à exercé cette activité en 2005, actuellement elle n’a plus beaucoup de marchandises elle demande alors  auprès de WAGES un autre crédit pour l’achat de 50 sacs de sorties et des produits de beauté. Elle est mariée et  a 03 enfants.
texts.en:
Yawoa A. lives in the Lomé neighborhood of Totsi and sells women’s handbags. She runs the business near Totsi’s local market, which enables her to attract a lot of customers. She began the business in 2005. She currently has very little merchandise left and is therefore asking WAGES for another loan to buy 50 handbags and some beauty products. She is married and has three children. .

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's handbags

loans.name: Wassiatou

texts.fr:
OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou est née vers les années 1968et Résidente à Cotonou. OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou est veuve depuis plus de cinq ans et a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou vend les produits de beauté, les pâtes dentifrice dans l'un des marchés locaux du Bénin. Grâce à ses activités OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou arrive à satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. OTTEKPOLA Wassiatou sollicite un deuxième prêt pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Wassiatou Ottekpola was born some time around 1968 and lives in Cotonou. She has been a widow for five years and has five children, all of whom are at school. Mrs. Ottekpola sells beauty products and toothpaste in one of Bénin’s local markets. Thanks to her business, Mrs. Ottekpola is able to provide for her own needs and those of her children. Mrs. Ottekpola is requesting a second loan to better respond to customer demand. In Bénin's local language, Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest.” Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to the most vulnerable and is part of a group that is about to launch a micro-health insurance program for beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and toothpaste

loans.name: Hasanboy

texts.en:
Since he was very young, M. Hasanboy has dedicated himself to raising livestock. He is married and a father who needs to support his children, who no longer need his help to complete their studies. His wife also helps him with the business. 

Hasanboy needs to purchase calves. To commercialize the derivative products, he sells the raised animals to farmers who then resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals to start the cycle, Hasanboy has come to IMON International to obtain the necessary credit. In this way, he will continue to maintain his dear home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Massan Nora Marie

texts.fr: Madame KPOSSOUWA est une femme mariée à un monsieur qui est enseignant, elle a 03 enfants et réside  avec sa famille dans le quartier de Doumassessé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle fait comme commerce la vente de charbons de bois et de sacs vides. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays plus précisément à Wahala et Haho. Elle vend les charbons en gros et en détail aux bonnes dames de son quartier. Actuellement, son stock ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses  clients, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 100 sacs vides et 40 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Mrs. KPOSSOUWA is marreid to a man who works as a school teacher. She has 3 children and lives with her family in the neighborhood of Doumassessé, just outsides the city of Lomé. She sells charcoal and empty sacs. She obtains materials from the interior of the country, specifically Wahala and Haho. She sells charcoal wholesale and on a retail basis to women living in her neighborhood. Her current inventory level does not allow her to meet her clients' demand and she is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 100 empty sacs and 40 sacs of charcoal.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Najmidin

texts.en:
K. Najmidin is 50 years old. He is married with 5 children. Najmidin is a farmer. He plants wheat, onions, carrots, cabbages and garlic. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. Thanks to his savings, he was able to arrange the marriage of his elder son. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve Najmidin’s income and his family's living standards. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Argash

texts.ru: Юлдошев Эргаш житель Вахшского района. Возраст 40 лет , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает учителем в средней школе района. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы  закупить комбикорм. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 5 месяцев.
texts.en:
Argash U. is a resident of Vachshkiy region. He is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. He works as a middle school teacher. Besides his occupation in school, he has a business involving livestock. He breeds cattle. He plans to use the loan to purchase animal feed. Argash will be able to repay his loan within 5 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
A. Julienne est née vers 1963 et mariée à AGBANNON Faustin. A. Julienne est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. A. Julienne vend de condiments, de l’huile rouge, de charbon et aussi de gari(farine de manioc). A. Julienne s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays et à un lieu fixe de vente qui est devant sa maison. Dans le souci de diversifier son activité et de renforcer son capital A. Julienne a sollicité en 2007 un  premier prêt. ce prêt lui a permis de commencer la vente de charbon. Actuelle A. Julienne sollicite un nouveau prêt pour toujours renforcer ses activités.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Julienne A. was born around 1963 and is maried to Faustin Agbannon. She is the mother of five children, all of of them in school. Julienne A. sells condiments, red oil, charcoal and manioc flour. She obtains materials from the interior of her country and has established a location in front of her home from which she operates. Julienne A. took her first loan in 2007 to diversify her business and begin selling charcoal. She is requesting another loan to expand her business. In Bénin's local language, le Fon, Alidé means "there is always a way for poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a per capita income of $1,500. Alide offers special loans with 0% interest to the very vulnerable. It is also part of a group that will soon launch a micro- health insurance program for those benefiting from micro-credit..

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods: pepper, fresh tomatoes, onions, spices, smoked shrimp, charcoal, manioc flour and red oil.

loans.name: Koffi Nyento

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Koffi est un célibataire qui  réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il est un informaticien de formation, mais depuis 2007  comme il ne trouvait pas de travail il s’est lancé dans  la vente de quincaillerie, son dynamisme a fait qu’il a conquis beaucoup de clients, aujourd’hui il est un vendeur  très connu dans son quartier. Présentement le stock de marchandises dont il dispose ne lui permet pas de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, il demande à WAGES son premier prêt pour acheter des contre plaquets, des tubes, des tôles et autres matériaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi A. is single and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood. He is trained as a computer specialist, but since he could not find a job in his field, he started a hardware business in 2007. He has won over many clients with his dynamism and is a well known vendor in his neighborhood. At present, his merchandise inventory levels don't allow him to meet his clients' needs. He is seeking his first loan from WAGES to purchase tubes, sheet metal and other material.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hardware mateial

loans.name: Urunbay

texts.en:
M. Urunbay is 59 years old. He and his wife have raised three children together. Urunbay is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 20 years. He bakes the national bread, “lepeshka,” at home. His children and wife help him with his business. 

Having many customers, Urunbay sells the majority of his products just from his home. However, he also runs a trading place in the central local market to sell the lepeshka. 

Urunbay is requesting a loan of $1300 USD for 12 months. He is planning to buy the flour that he requires for his business on a wholesale basis. Urunbay is grateful to all who support him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: To buy flour wholesale to bake “lepeshka," the Tajik national bread.

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Юлдошев Мурод проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 40 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает учителем в средней школе района. Кроме того имеет 15 летний стаж по разведению крупно рогатого скота. В данный момент решил получить кредит для того, чтобы купить молодого бычка, для откормки. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 5 месяцев.
texts.en:
Murod U. lives in the Vahsh region. He is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. He works as a middle school teacher. Besides his work as a teacher, he has 15 years worth of experience in breeding livestock. At this moment, he decided to obtain a loan so he could purchase a calf. He plans to pay off the loan within 5 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Surmakhon

texts.en:
Surmakhon has a small business selling children’s clothing. She is a widow and has been in business for 25 years. She is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. For example, there are  times when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory. Rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open. 

Surmakhon has requested a loan to help renew her clothing inventory. The change of seasons means a busy time of year for clothing vendors. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy new clothing for women for the spring season.

loans.name: Sora

texts.en:
Sora  K. is 51 is years old. She is widow and the mother of three children. Sora works hard to ensure the best future for her children. 

Sora has been running her own small business for 12 years. She has a place in the central local market for selling foods, such as sugar, tea, sweets, eggs, and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. The business is stable and that allows her to improve her family's living conditions. 

Now Sora needs a loan to increase the range of goods that she sells. She is requesting 3000 Somoni for a term of 10 months. Sora and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To iIncreasing her stock and purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
M. Sherali is 56 years old. He is married and has four children. Sherali's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. 

He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Tursunzade, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for 30 years. Currently Sherali’s car needs some repairs and he wants to borrow 3000 Somoni for 10 months. The financing will go towards repairs of his vehicle purchasing winter tires. Sherali thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: To buy spare parts to fix his car

loans.name: Antoinette Clémence

texts.fr:
D. M. Antoinette Clémence est née vers 1963. D. M. Antoinette Clémence est mère D. 6 enfants et mariée à AKODJETIN Bienvenu. D. M. Antoinette Clémence résiD. au quartier  Fidjrossè, un banlieue D. la ville D. Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. D. M. Antoinette Clémence vend D. maïs en gros et D. sacs D. charbon. D. M. Antoinette Clémence achète ses marchandises dans les marchés locaux à l’intérieur du pays. D. M. Antoinette Clémence vend également en périoD. D. soudure D. la bouillie D. maïs accompagnée D. beignets. D. M. Antoinette Clémence est à son deuxième prêt avec ALIDé. Pour renforcer son capital afin D. mieux répondre à la forte demanD. du marché, D. M. Antoinette Clémence sollicite un autre prêt à ALIDé.

 
La signification D. ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays D. l’Afrique D. l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux D. 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme D. la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires D. micro crédit.
texts.en:
Antoinette Clémence D. M. was born around 1963. She is the mother of 6 children and is married to Bienvenu Akodjetin. Antoinette Clémence D. M. lives in Fidjrossè, outsiD. the city of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She sells corn wholesale and sacs of charcoal and obtains her materials from local markets in the interior of her country. Antoinette Clémence D. M. also sells corn porridge and donuts at certain times. This is her second loan with Alidé and will augment her capital to allow her to respond better to the strong market demand. She is also seeking another loan with Alidé. In Bénin's local language, le Fon, Aidé means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a per capita income of $1,500. AliD. offers special loans at 0% interest for the very vulnerable. It is also part of a group that will soon launch a micro-heatlh insurance program for those benefiting from micro-credit.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacs of corn, charcoal and oil

loans.name: Avazhon

texts.ru: Гулмирзоев Авазхон житель Вахшского района. Возраст 33 года , образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Обратился за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить комбикорм. Это поможет ему в его деятельности . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 5 месяцев. Аваз не женат и не имеет детей. Живет с родителями и семьей брата. Зарабатываемые деньги использует на развитие бизнеса , а так же на обеспечение семьи.
texts.en:
Avazhon G. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 33 years old and has a high school education. He practices animal husbandry. He has requested a loan for purchase of complete animal feed. This will help with his work. The loan will be repaid over 5 months. Avaz is not married and has no children. He lives with his parents and brother's family. His income will be used to further develop the business, as well as to support the family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase complete animal feed

loans.name: Bibisora

texts.en:
M. Bibisora is a hard working woman. Since 1998 she has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Tursunzade. She characterizes herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of two minor children to whom she would like to offer an education. To realize this dream, Bibisora now requests 2500 Somoni for the term of 10 months. With this loan she wants to buy a greater variety of vegetables to increase her earnings. With your collaboration she’ll be able to realize her dream in a short time.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the the variety of vegetables she sells

loans.name: Urunbi

texts.en:
Urunbi is widowed and has one child. She has a business selling clothing in the small market of Shahrituz. Urunbi’s business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last 4 years. Urunbi is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar product or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued and respected . Urunbi is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so she can support herself and her daughter.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women for the spring season.

loans.name: Djobo

texts.fr: Née le 09 avril 1970 à Sokodé, Mme A. DJOBO est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants.  Elle réside actuellement à Adétikopé où elle exerce comme activité la vente des ustensiles ménagers en aluminium et en plastique. C’est un commerce qui marche très bien pour elle mais elle est souvent confrontée à de fréquentes ruptures de stocks. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour des achats de marchandises en gros afin de pouvoir satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle. Cela lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born April 9, 1970 in Sokodé, Mrs A. Djobe is married and is the mother of six children. She lives in Adétikopé where she sells household items made of aluminum or plastic. The business is going very well for her but she is often left short of inventory. She is seeking a loan to purchase goods on a wholesale basis so that she can satisfy her clients' demands. This will allow her to increase her sales and income.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale goods

loans.name: Salom

texts.ru:
Ниёзов Абдусалом женат, имеет 1 дочь. В этом году у него дела идут не так хорошо, как он планировал. А он должен дочь выдать замуж , приданное надо ей готовить. Он решил получить кредит , что бы отремонтировать машину и ездить на ней как маршрутное такси . Он переоборудует машину на газ и она будет ездить не на бензине а на газе. Газ дешевле чем бензин, поэтому он считает что это выгодно. 
Его жена тоже работает, она  продает пирожки на улице. Дочь учиться в университете, а также она ходит учиться на швею , что бы в будущем помогать родителям и стать хорошей портной.
texts.en:
Salom N. is married and has 1 daughter. This year he is not doing as well as he planned, but he needs to marry off his daughter and needs to prepare a dowry for her. He decided to take out a loan to repair his car and to drive it like a taxi with a fixed route. He is planning to convert the car so that it runs on gas and the car will run on gas instead of on gasoline. Gas is cheaper than gasoline, this is why he thinks this would be profitable. His wife also works, she sells pastries on the street. His daughter studies at the university, she is also learning to be a seamstress, so that she can help her parents in the future and to become a good tailor.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert automobile

loans.name: Kpoliawoè

texts.fr: Mme Kpoliawoè A. est née en 1975 à Agotimé. Elle est mariée avec six (06) enfants à charge et réside actuellement à kladjèmé et exerce comme activité la préparation et la vente de produits alimentaires. Cette activité est menée dans des conditions hygiéniques précaires et à l’air libre. Pour vendre ses denrées dans des conditions acceptables, elle sollicite un crédit pour construire un petit restaurant et constituer des provisions afin de pouvoir répondre efficacement aux exigences des clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kpoliawoè A. was born in Agotimé in 1975, she's married and has six children to support. She currently lives in Kladjèmé and her business consists in preparing and selling food products. She runs her business in precarious conditions and out in the open. To sell her products in acceptable conditions, she's seeking a loan to build a small restaurant and constitute a stock of provisions, in order to be able to efficiently meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a small restaurant and constitute a stock of provisions

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Seven years ago, Mahbuba started her women's clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Mahbuba has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family of three chidlren. Throughout the last year, IMON International has provided assistance to Mahbuba’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Mahbuba has used her previous loans wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni to replace depleted inventory, hoping to continue expanding her business and supporting her family.
