loans.use: To purchase new clothing for teenagers.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Mme Adjovi A. est née en 1960 à Agoènyivé dans la banlieue nord de Lomé au sud du Togo. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle a comme activité principale la culture de produits vivriers et de légumes. Ces rendements agricoles ont largement chuté ces dernières saisons à causes de la pauvreté des sols et des aléas climatiques. Pour relancer ses activités, elle demande un crédit pour acheter des intrants et des engrais. Cela va lui permettre d’avoir de bons rendements et d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjovi A. was born in 1960 in the northern suburbs of Lomé in Southern Togo. She's married and is the mother of five children. Her main business consists in selling staple foods and vegetables. Agricultural yields experienced a large drop these last seasons, due to poor soils and poor weather. To revitalize her business, she's seeking a loan to buy fertilizers. This will enable him to increase his yields and his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
The agriculture business is one that requires much effort for the simple reason that it requires exposure to the sun, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Nabi U.  has dedicated himself for 20 years to cattle raising which supports his humble family who rely on him. Currently Nabi has turned to IMON International for a loan of $1350 USD to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his children and wife whom he loves greatly.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Садриддин  работает в магазине уже более 5 лет. Он зарабатывает что бы купить себе дом и переехать туда. Он до сих пор  живет с родителями и ему хочется  отделиться, так как у него есть своя семья, и растут дети. 
Брат Садриддина взял в партнеры, и пол товара привозит Садриддин сам. Сейчас магазин перестраивают   и переносят ближе к дороге. Тем самым они хотят повысить свою прибыль. 
Он благодарен КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Sadriddin has been working in a store for more than 5 years. He is earning money so that he can purchase himself a house and move there. He still lives with his parents and would like to separate as he has his own family and the children are growing. Sadriddin’s brother took him on as a partner and Sadriddin brings half of the products himself. Right now they are remodeling their store and moving it closer to the road. They are doing this because they want to increase their profits. He is grateful to KIVA for its support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Emile

texts.fr: Né en 1964 à Anfoin dans la préfecture des lacs au sud du Togo, Mr Emile K. est marié avec deux (02) enfants à charge et réside actuellement à Kladjèmé où il mène comme activité la culture des produits vivriers (piments, tomates fraîches, gombo, etc.…). C’est une activité qui lui rapporte énormément en terme de revenu. C’est pourquoi il veut étendre sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais pour la fertilisation des sols. Il sollicite donc pour cela un financement. Cela va accroître ses rendements et forcement ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Emile K. was born in 1964 in Anfoin in Southern Togo. He's married, has two children to support, and currently lives in Kladjèmé where his business consists in growing food products (chili pepper, fresh tomatoes, okra, ...). This business earns him a solid income. This is why he wants to expand his arable area and buy fertilizers. He's therefore seeking a loan, in order to increase his yields and his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
A. Dilorom is an enterprising, capable, and very hard-working woman. She lives in Isfara, Tajikistan and sells women’s clothes. She began her own business because her husband was unemployed for some time. Her work is allowing her two children go to school. It is very important to Dilorom that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals.

You can help Dilorom provide for the education of her children. She needs $1200 USD to buy merchandise in order to increase sales. She wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Support her!

loans.use: Purchase new women's clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Xolali

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Aményran dans la préfecture de Vo, Mme A. Xolali est marié et a deux (02) enfants. Elle vit à Kladjèmé est mène comme activité la vente de vente de sachets en plastiques. Elle est cependant confrontée à un manque de moyens financiers. Toutefois, pour relancer son petit commerce, elle sollicite un crédit lui permettant d’acheter en gros ses marchandises afin de pouvoir les revendre en détail pour en tirer de meilleurs bénéfices. Cela lui permettra de faire face aisément aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Aményran in the prefecture of Vo, Xolali A. is married and has two children. She lives in Kladjèmé and sells plastic bags. Her greatest difficulty is a lack of funds. In order to boost her small business, she is asking for a loan to buy her merchandise in bulk in order to retail them and gain more profits from her sales. This will allow her to more easily pay for her household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bags wholesale for retail purposes

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин еще не женат, но молодой и полон сил и энергии. Он торгует  продуктами питаниями: сахар, соль спички, и другими хозяйственными товарами. Товар ему привозит отец, он помогает ему со снабжением товара. В бизнесе ему также помог родственник. Он взял его в качестве помощники продавца. Со временем и его отец решил что он может и сам работать с торговлей. Так он и  получил очередной кредит  и продолжает свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Kamoliddin is still single, but he is young and full of strength and energy. He sells grocery products, such as sugar, salt, matches and other household products. His father delivers the goods and helps Kamoliddin with the goods supply. Another relative also helps Kamoliddin with the business. Kamoliddin hired him to be a sales assistant. Soon his father too decided that he can work in sales. He received his next loan and continues to build his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman est composé d’une célibataire et de trois  femmes mariées vivant dans des familles monogamiques. Âgées en moyenne de 33 ans avec 2 enfants, elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Ségou Coura Somono de la ville de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et professionnel et font le commerce d’articles divers (riz, habits, tubercules, bijoux,  bracelets, chaînes, boucles d’oreille  etc.). 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé  d’adhérer au programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter,  70 pièces de pagnes wax, 10 couvres lits, 25 sacs de riz et  50 caisses de pomme de terre. Elles se ravitaillent en pièces de pagnes wax et en couvres lits au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali), en riz à Niono  et quant à la  pomme de terre, elle  est livrée à domicile par des forains Sikassois sur commande. Elles vendent en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile et en ambulant.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42250FCFA qui servira au remboursement des intérêts  du prêt, et subvenir aux charges familiales (éducation, santé) et sociales (mariages, baptêmes et funérailles).
Elles ont pour objectif, l’ouverture d’une boutique de vente en gros à Ségou.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouman is composed of four women (one unmarried and four married) living in monogamous families. Averaging 32 years of age and 2 children each, the women all live in the Ségou Coura Somono district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and profession and do commerce in various goods (rice, clothing, tubers, jewelry, chains, earrings, etc.)

Concerned with doing better in satisfying their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their seventh solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They intend to use this loan to buy: 70 bolts of Wax pagnes, 10 bed spreads, 25 sacks of rice, and 50 cases of potatoes. Supplies of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and bed spreads are gotten at the marketplace of Bamako (capital of Mali). The rice is gotten in Niono, and the potatoes are home-delivered by Sikasso vendors by special order. Sales are made at the house and door-to-door to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 42,250 francs CFA that will be used for making loan interest payments and for cover family expenses (education, health) and social expenses (marriage, baptisms, funerals). Their objective is to open a wholesale shop in Ségou.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, rice, and potoates

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is a married mother of 4 children. Her women’s clothing business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past eleven years that she’s been in business. In a typical month, Dilorom makes about $500 in profit from the business. Dilorom is hard-working, polite and a communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. Dilorom has requested a loan of $3000 USD to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new women's clothing for spring season.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme Afi A. est née en 1977 à Séwui au Ghana. Mariée avec trois (03) enfants à charge, elle réside actuellement à Kladjèmé. Son activité principale est la préparation et la vente de la bouillie de mais dans son village tous les matins. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années et en tire suffisamment de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de sa petite famille. Malgré sa volonté et son dynamisme, elle n’arrive pas à sortir de sa situation précaire, faute de moyens financiers suffisants. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour acheter un stock important de mais, de sucre et autre. Ce financement va réduire ses coûts d’achat et augmenter considérablement ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Afi A. was born in 1977 in Séwui, Ghana. She is married and has three dependent children. She is now living in Kladjèmé. She prepares and sells corn porridge every morning in her village. She has had this business for a number of years and is able to make enough money to take care of the basic needs of her small family. Despite her will and her energy, she is unable to get out of her precarious situation due to a lack of money. She is therefore asking for this loan to buy large amounts of corn, sugar and so on. This loan will reduce her buying costs and considerably increase her profits.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large amounts of corn and sugar

loans.name: Umurboy

texts.en:
Umurboy H. is a farmer dedicated to the production of potatoes for more than 12 years. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker and the business of Umurboy is the sole source of income for his family. His potato harvest is about to come out and that is why he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to acquire agricultural products and apply them to his harvest. Umurboy wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so from the income that his production will bring.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase agricutural products to help with harvest

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Dame K. Essi agée de 34 ans, est une femme née dans le village de Tchékpo Dédékpo, localité située à 58 km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle a pour activité la restauration dans le quartier d’Avedzi.
Ce premier crédit quelle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 4 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d’huile végétale. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Essi K. is 34 years old. She was born in the village of Tchékpo Dédékpo, which is 58 kilometres from the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of three children. She has a restaurant in the neighbourhood of Avedzi. This is her first loan which she is asking for in order to buy four bags of rice, three drums of vegetable oil. With the revenues from her business she will be able to help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her restaurant

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutoura est composé de six femmes mariées dans des familles monogamiques exceptée une seule. Âgées en moyenne de 34 ans avec 4 enfants, elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Ségou Coura Somono de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali.)
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié  et professionnel et exercent comme activité l’achat vente d’habits, de la pomme de terre, des fruits et légumes, des céréales et des condiments alimentaires tels que l’oignon, le sel de cuisine et des tomates. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire).
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs de riz, 6 sacs d’arachide en gousse dont une bonne partie est grillée et 400 kg de banane. Elles se ravitaillent en riz à Ségou  avec les forains de Siribala ; en arachide au grand marché de Ségou et la banane est livrée à domicile par les fournisseurs. Elles vendent en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants à domicile, au bord du goudron à Ségou Coura,  en ambulant et au marché du quartier.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de  38000FCFA qui sera  utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et des tontines. 
Leur ambition est d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The group Soutoura is composed of six married women in monogamous families, except one. They average 34 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in the Ségou Coura Somono district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and profession. And they do buying and selling of clothing, potatoes, fruits and vegetables, grain, and condiments, such as onions, salt, and tomatoes.

To satisfy the needs of their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their fourth gourp loan (solidarity loan). This loan will be used to buy: 20 sacks of rice, 6 sacks of unshelled peanuts (some of which will be roasted), and 400 kg of bananas. Supplies of rice are gotten in Ségou from vendors of Siribala; the peanuts, from the grand marketplace of Ségou; the bananas, home-delivered by suppliers. Sales are made to customers composed of men, women, and children, cash or credit accepted, at the house, along the asphalt in Ségou Coura, door-to-door, and at the district marketplace.

The group members intend to realize an average monthly profit of 38,000 francs CFA that will be used to make payments on the loan interest and to the tontines (community revolving savings and loan associations). Their ambition is to have a house for living in.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, peanuts, and bananas

loans.name: Agbodjinsi

texts.fr: Agée d’une cinquantaine d’années, Mme Agbodjinsi A. est une veuve avec huit (08) enfants à charge. Pour faire face à la scolarisation de ses enfants, elle vend des produits alimentaires de premières nécessités (légumes, tomates fraîches, épices et autres ingrédients) dans le marché de son village. C’est une femme très appréciée dans son milieu qui draine avec elle un nombre considérable de clients. Cette sollicitude permanente de ses clients l’oblige à demander un crédit afin de pouvoir satisfaire pleinement leurs demandes. Cela va également lui permettre d’accroître ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
In her fifties, Agbodjinsi A. is a widow with eight dependent children. In order to pay her children's tuition, she sells basic foodstuffs (vegetables, fresh tomatoes, spices and other ingredients) in the market of her village. She is very well regarded in her area and attracts a large number of customers. Her clients' demands are what brings her to ask for a loan in order to satisfy them. The loan will also allow her to increase her revenues and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a chicken coop

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gilbert A. est un jeune commerçant  âgé de 26 ans qui est marié et père d’une fille. Depuis 2005, qu’il a crée son BAR dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, il ne cesse d’accueillir un grand nombre de clients.
A l’approche de la fête des Pacques, il désire faire l’approvisionnement des boissons et des produits de premières nécessités afin de pouvoir bien satisfaire ses clients et dégager beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mr. Gilbert A. is a young, 26-year-old storekeeper who is married and the father of a girl. Since 2005, when he opened his bar in the Adidogomé neighborhood, he hasn’t stopped welcoming a large number of clients. As the Easter holiday approaches, he wants to stock up on drinks and other necessary goods in order to be able to satisfy his clients and draw a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and food

loans.name: Miklohou

texts.fr: Né en 1963, Mr Miklohou A. est marié et père de six (06) enfants. Il réside actuellement à Kladjèmé où il mène comme activité la culture des produits vivriers (piments, tomates fraîches, gombo, et autres légumes …). C’est de cette activité qui lui rapporte énormément en terme de revenu qu’il arrive à scolariser ses enfants et à faire face aux charges de sa famille. C’est pourquoi il veut étendre sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais pour la fertilisation des sols. Il sollicite donc pour cela un financement. Cela va lui permettre d’accroître ses rendements et forcement ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Born in 1963, Mr. Miklohou A. is a married father of six children. He currently resides in Kladjèmé, where he cultivates food products (chili, fresh tomatoes, okra, and other vegetables…). It’s due to this business that earns him a good income that allows him to send his children to school and to take care of his family. This is why he would like to grow his cultivatable land and to buy fertilizer for his soil. He therefore seeks a loan for this. This will allow him to enhance his productivity and inevitably his profits.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to grow food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cassava and corn growing

loans.name: Amlan

texts.fr: Mme Amlan A. est née en 1950 à adétikopé, mariée avec onze(11) enfants en charge. C'est de son petit commerce de fruits (orange, mandarine ...) qu'elle s'occupe tant bien que mal des charges du ménage. Mais elle manque cruellement de fond de commerce pour augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour disposer de fonds nécessaire et s'approvisionner régulièrement. Les revenus  tirés de ses activités l'aideront à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Amlan A. was born in 1950 in Adétikopé, is married and has eleven children. It is her small fruit business (selling oranges, mandarins, etc.) that, with great difficulty, allows her to manage the household. But she is lacking the funds to be able to increase her sales. She is, therefore, soliciting a loan to be able to have enough funds to regularly restock her supply. Her revenues from this business will help her manage the needs of the household.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit sales

loans.name: Kossi Malibita

texts.fr:
Monsieur KPOBIE Kossi est né le 15 décembre 1972 à Tomégbé, localité située à 147 km de la capitale togolaise. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Depuis 2006, il a ouvert une librairie dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Dans sa librairie « ETS GRACE ET PAIX » on peut trouver les livres des cours primaires et secondaires. 
Il est à son troisième cycle de crédit auprès de WAGES et rembourse toujours bien.
Ce crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 cartons de livre de cours primaires et 2 cartons de livre littéraires.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossi Kpobie was born December 15, 1972 in Tomégbé, situated 147 km from the Togolaise capital. He is married and the father of 3 children. He opened his bookstore in 2006 in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. In his bookstore "Est.Mercy and Peace" one can find books for primary and secondary level classes. He is on his third credit cycle with WAGES and has always repaid well. The loan he is requesting will allow him to purchase 5 cartons of primary schoolbooks and 2 cartons of literary books.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Books

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr:
Agée de 36ans, avec cinq (05) personnes en charge, Mme Dodji B. est mariée et pour activité principale la vente de boisson locale sans alcool appelé "Tchoukoutou".
Elle est fabriquée à base de maïs et/ou du mil très appréciée dans la localité. pour mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du maïs et du mil. Le fruit de ce commerce sera utiliser pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dodji B. is 36, married and has five dependants. Her main business is selling a local non-alcoholic drink called “Tchoukoutou". It is made from a base of corn and/or millet and is very popular in the local area. In order to better meet the demand from her customers, she is asking for a loan to help store corn and millet. The income from her business will be used to improve her family’s quality of life.


Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To store corn and millet for the preparation of a local drink

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Née en 1954 à Havé (Adétikopé), Mme Yawa A. est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Son commerce de poissons fumés qu'elle exerce depuis plusieurs années lui réussit bien et elle compte étendre son activité à d'autres quartiers de la localité. Elle sollicite un financement pour mettre en place des fours à grande capacité pour le fumage et la conservation des poissons, acheter en grande quantité du poisson frais pour servir sa clientèle. De la vente de ses produits sortira un bénéfice pouvant augmenter le niveau de vie de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Born in Havé (Adétikopé) in 1954, Yawa A. is married and the mother of seven children. She does well from her fish smoking business, which she has been running for the last few years and she wishes to expand the business into other nearby areas. She is requesting a loan to put in some high capacity ovens to smoke and preserve the fish and to buy a large quantity of fresh fish to serve to her customers. Selling her produce will bring in an income capable of improving the whole family’s quality of life.


Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ovens and fresh produce for fish smoking business

loans.name: Ayaba Gloria

texts.fr:
Madame K. Ayaba Gloria est une jeune fille célibataire qui a tellement de passion pour l’exercice de la couture. Elle a ouvert son propre atelier depuis 2005 après avoir suivi une formation de 3 ans au près d’une femme dynamique. Aujourd’hui, travaillant pour son propre compte, elle met tous les moyens en œuvre pour la réussite de sa petite entreprise.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des pagnes et tissus afin de pouvoir confectionner des habits et vendre. Ainsi avec le revenu de son activité, elle pourra subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Ayaba Gloria K. is a young single woman with a real passion for dress-making. She opened her own studio in 2005 after training for 3 years under the instruction of a dynamic woman. Now, working for herself, she works in every possible way to ensure the success of her small business. She is asking for this first loan in order to buy ‘pagnes’ (coloured West African cloth) and fabric so that she can make and sell clothes. With the income from this business, she will be able to support herself.


Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coloured cloth and fabric for dress-making business

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Hidaya S. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of two and thirteen. Hidaya has been running a tailoring business since 2004. Her business is making clothes, especially for women. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week. Hidaya currently earns about $80 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $325 USD to buy materials to make women clothes for resale. In the future, she plans to increase her efforts on her clothing business. Hidaya thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials to make women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Dame S. Akouavi est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans avec deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale, la vente des produits congelés. Ces derniers temps elle a épuisé son stock compte tenu des ventes qu’elle a eu à réaliser.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 7 cartons de poissons frais, et 9 cartons de poulets. 
Etant donnée qu’elle est la seule à vendre ces produits congelés dans la localité, elle n’aime pas avoir des ruptures de stock mais elle désire toujours satisfaire les clients et ainsi gagner des profits.
texts.en:
Mrs Akouavi S. is a 38-year old married woman with two children. Her main business activity is selling frozen goods. She has exhausted her inventory of late due to high sales levels. She is asking for her first loan to purchase 7 cartons of fresh fish and 9 cartons of chicken. Since she is the only one in the area selling frozen products, she does not like to run out of merchandise. She would rather satisfy her customers and thereby earn profits.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Frozen Food Products

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Felista S. from Mwanza. She is divorced with three children between the ages of 13 and 18. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two other dependents because they are orphans.

Felista has been running a bar for selling local beer since 2002. Her business is selling different types of beers and she works at the business for 16 hours per day, seven days per week. Felista currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy beers like Serengeti castle lager, Kilimanjaro, ndovu, balimi and konyagi, and soda and water for resale. In the future, she plans to innovate and build her business. Felista thanks you for the support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda and water for resale

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Demoiselle A. Afiwaga âgé 49 ans est célibataire avec un enfant. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des pagnes. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante c’est-à-dire qu’elle vend de maison en maison et de quartier en quartier. Elle a commencé par exercer cette activité depuis 1998 ce qui fait qu’elle est bien expérimentée dans le domaine. 
Ce troisième prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 12 pièces de pagne de qualité supérieure.
texts.en:
Ms. Afiwaga A. is 49 years old and single with one child. She sells fabrics door to door in different neighborhoods. She has been doing this since 1998 and, as such, has a great deal of experience. This third loan that has been requested will allow her to purchase 12 pieces of superior quality fabric.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Fabric

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: El Sr. Eugenio S. M. quinces años que vive por esta zona, el es nacido en Montero de Santa Cruz, ahora vive en este lugar llamado Jardín de las delicias con su esposa la Sra. Lidia Arias Chávez y sus tres hijos, la actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, con la cual mantiene a su familia, generalmente se dedica a la siembra de maní, maíz, y arroz. El cuenta con una parcela en este lugar de 38 hras. De tierra en la que ahora debido a la época quiere sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Eugenio S. M. has been living in this region for the past 15 years. He was born in Montero de Santa Cruz but now lives in the region called Jardin de las Delicias with his wife Mrs. Lidia Arias Chavez and their three children. His occupation is agriculture, through which he supports his family. Generally he cultivates chickpeas, maize, and rice. He has a plot of land of 38 hectares in this region. He now plans on starting a potato plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeding potatoes.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de trois (3), dame A. Akouvi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois, de maïs et d’ignames. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2005 et tire beaucoup de profit qui lui permet d’aider son mari qui est chauffeur dans les dépenses de la famille.
Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter 50 tubercules d’ignames et 12 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Akouvi A. sells charcoal, corn and yams. She started her business in 2005 and is able to make good profits which allow her to help her husband, a driver, with the family expenses. Having repaid her first loan on time, she is asking for this, her second loan, to buy 50 yam tubers and 12 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and charcoal

loans.name: Aide

texts.es: Aide tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo, su nuera y su nieto. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa colocando un pequeño mueble a manera de bar. Este negocio sólo atiende los sábados y domingos porque ella trabaja en una institución como secretaria desde hace 27 años, por lo que su hijo y su nuera se encargan de su negocio durante la semana y ella lo atiende los sábados y domingos. Le es muy rentable porque está ubicado en una buena zona y sus bebidas heladas se venden a diario. Posteriormente quiere complementar su negocio con la venta de comida o de lo contrario distribuir cerveza a otros negocios que se encuentran cerca de su zona. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Trabajando juntos” y si le gusta ser parte de éste porque los miembros demuestran mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más bebidas, y así implementar su negocio con lo necesario para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Aide is 55 years old. She's a single mother and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and grandson. For two years she's sold drinks in a space she prepared in her house by arranging a small piece of furniture to serve as a counter. She only takes care of this business on Saturdays and Sundays because she's been working as a secretary in an institution for 27 years. Her son and daughter-in-law are in charge of the business during the week, and she runs it on the weekends. It's very profitable because it's in a good location, and her cold drinks are sold every day. In the future she'd like to expand this business by selling food or distributing beer to other businesses nearby. This is her sixth loan with MFP. Her communal bank is called "Trabajando juntos" (Working Together), and she enjoys being part of it because the members are very responsible. She will use the requested loan to purchase more drinks and stock her business in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock of drinks

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Es cliente nuevo el mismo que viene por referencias de otros clientes que ya sacaron créditos con anterioridad.
El vive en la localidad de Villa San Carlos del municipio el Torno, cuenta con casa tiene su vagoneta que la hace trabajar como taxi, el cual trabaja hace 1 año.
El crédito que le fue dado fue para la compra de una línea el mismo que tenia un costo de $us. 550 dólares americanos. 
El tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y comenta que dentro de un tiempo va invertir en la agricultura para la siembra de maíz y papa. Don Rogelio esta casado y tiene hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
He is a new client referred by other clients who have previously received loans. He lives in the Villa San Carlos neighborhood of El Torno municipality. He has a home and a small car with which he has worked as a taxi driver for a year. The loan was given to buy a taxi route that cost $US 500 American dollars. He has a great desire to continue working and he says that shortly he will invest in farming by growing corn and potato. Rogelio is married and has three school-aged children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a taxi transportation route

loans.name: Stone Quarry Group

texts.en:
Milly is a 35 year old woman who runs a retail shop and a small dairy business.

She has been in both of these businesses for 8 years and hopes they will both continue to grow as time goes on. In her dairy business, she currently has five cows but only two that provide milk for selling. From these two cows, she gets 9 liters of milk per day which she sells at 500 USH per liter. Milly spends most of her time at her retail shop. She tries to sell a very wide variety of items so that people can use her shop for all of their needs. In the future Milly would like to change her retail shop into a wholesale shop, because she thinks that this endeavor would be more profitable.

Today, Milly is requesting a loan of 1.5 million USH to restock her shop. Because Milly keeps her shop stocked with a large variety of items, she is unable to make bulk purchases of items. With this loan Milly plans to purchases items like sugar, posho flour, soda, soaps, etc.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, posho flour, soda, and other items.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: Carla tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su dos hijos en su casa es propia. Se dedica a la crianza de pollos en un pequeño galpón construido en la parte posterior de su casa, en esta actividad lleva 2 años y le va muy bien, porque no trabaja sola, ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. Le gusta su trabajo porque a sus pollos los cría con mucho cariño hasta que obtengan el peso necesario para su venta. Este negocio le es rentable porque sus pollos ya están listos para la venta en menos de 45 días y los deja a aun buen precio, aparte de contar ya con fieles clientes. Para el futuro Carla quiere mandar a construir otro galpón porque el que tiene solo le alcanza para 100 pollos y ella está dispuesta a criar más. Su banco comunal se llama “Trabajando juntos”, este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, nos cuenta que últimamente están habiendo algunos problemas en su grupo, pero tiene la esperanza que puedan solucionarse pronto. Más allá de eso, ella tiene el compromiso de ser responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de pollos bebés y alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en:
Carla is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She's been raising chickens in a small shed in the rear of the house for two years. The business is going very well because she doesn't work alone: her husband also helps. This business is profitable because her chickens are ready to sell in less than 45 days and she sells them at a good price. She also has loyal customers. In the future, Carla would like to build another shed because the one she has only has room for 100 chickens, and she'd like to raise more. Her communal bank is called "Trabajando juntos" ("Working Together") and this is her seventh loan with MFP. She tells us that recently there have been some problems in her group, but she hopes they can be resolved quickly. Apart from that, she promises to be responsible in making her payments. She will invest the requested loan in purchasing chicks and feed.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks and feed to raise poultry

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. Daniel sells electrical items at Kisi near Elmina, which he has done since 2004. His wife is a trader. Daniel uses his income for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other expenses. Daniel will use the loan to purchase more and a greater variety of electrical items to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Daniel plans to save towards a house he wants to put up so that he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: To increase size and variety of store inventory

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac G. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high. Since 2006, Isaac has been selling mobile phones and accessories at Kisi near Elmina. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income to pay the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Isaac will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of mobile phones and accessories to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to buy more goods for further expansion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones and accessories
